analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma'o //
translated: Vajrasūrya.

original: phyag rgya chen por sbyor ba'i thabs kyis ni zhal gsum dang phyag drug pa'i rab tu gnas pas de nyid lho phyogs su bzhugs te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen por sbyor ba'i thabs kyis ni zhal gsum dang phyag drug pa'i rab tu gnas pas de nyid lho phyogs su bzhugs te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The method of application to the Great Seal is the consecration of the three faces and six arms, and he resides in the south, the stage of creation.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, etc.

original: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul ni chen po ni sems can gyi tshogs kyi 'dod chags nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir tshul ni lam ste so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul ni chen po ni sems can gyi tshogs kyi 'dod chags nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir tshul ni lam ste so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The method of great passion is the path, the discriminating wisdom, for the sake of the purification of the passion of the mass of sentient beings.

original: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni de bzhin du bshad pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni de bzhin du bshad pa ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That samādhi is explained as such, the stage of completion.

original: chen po ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum ste shes rab bo //
analyzed: chen po ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum ste shes rab bo //
translated: Great is the thirty-three natures of passionlessness, etc., which is wisdom.

original: 'dod chags ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bzhi bcu ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bzhi bcu ste /
translated: Passion is the forty natures of passion, etc.,

original: thabs so // tshul ni ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bdun te /
analyzed: thabs so // tshul ni ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bdun te /
translated: which is method. The method is the seven natures of ignorance,🔽etc.

original: de rnams 'od gsal ba gang gis rnam par dag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams 'od gsal ba gang gis rnam par dag par bya ba ste /
translated: By that, one is purified.

original: de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what it is called.

original: de ni sems rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sems rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: That is the purification of the mind.

original: nyid kyi sku dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi sku dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du'o //
translated: One’s own body, etc. , are as before.

original: a'a ro li ka ces pa ni sgra'i don du'o //
analyzed: a'a ro li ka ces pa ni sgra'i don du'o //
translated: Ārolikā is in the sense of sound.

original: a'a ni sngon du ste kun du sgra byed pas na a'a ro ste ngag la bya'o //
analyzed: a'a ni sngon du ste kun du sgra byed pas na a'a ro ste ngag la bya'o //
translated: Ā is in front, and since it makes all sounds, it is āro, which is to be taken as speech.

original: de nyid li ka ces pa ni rnam par dag par 'gro bas na aa ro li ka ste /
analyzed: de nyid li ka ces pa ni rnam par dag par 'gro bas na aa ro li ka ste /
translated: That itself is likā, since it goes to purification, and so it is ārolikā.

original: snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: That is Amitābha.

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the completion stage.

original: a'a zhes bya ba ni dbyangs ring pos brjod par bya ba'i gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: a'a zhes bya ba ni dbyangs ring pos brjod par bya ba'i gos dkar mo'o //
translated: Ā is Pāṇḍaravāsinī, who is to be expressed by a long vowel.

original: ra aa ao zhes bya ga la yon tan du byas la ngo yin no //
analyzed: ra aa ao zhes bya ga la yon tan du byas la ngo yin no //
translated: Ra, ā, and o are taken as qualities.

original: de la ra ni khrag go //
analyzed: de la ra ni khrag go //
translated: There, ra is blood.

original: aa ni @38b bdud rtsi ste byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: aa ni @38b bdud rtsi ste byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Ā is the ambrosia, which is bodhicitta.

original: ao zhes pa ni de dag ro gcig par byas pa'o //
analyzed: ao zhes pa ni de dag ro gcig par byas pa'o //
translated: O is the making of those into a single taste.

original: de rnams li ka ces pa ni rtogs par byed pa ste a'a ro li ka ces so //
analyzed: de rnams li ka ces pa ni rtogs par byed pa ste a'a ro li ka ces so //
translated: The term likā means to be realized, as in ārolikā.

original: de'i don 'di yin te gos dkar mo dang gnyis su med pa de'i padmar zla ba dang nyi ma gcig tu shes pas de nyid kyi phyir 'di sangs rgyas thams cad la sogs pa'i rgyud rnams la padma gar gyi dbang phyug ma zhes brjod pa ste rgyu yin
analyzed: de'i don 'di yin te gos dkar mo dang gnyis su med pa de'i padmar zla ba dang nyi ma gcig tu shes pas de nyid kyi phyir 'di sangs rgyas thams cad la sogs pa'i rgyud rnams la padma gar gyi dbang phyug ma zhes brjod pa ste rgyu yin
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Since the moon and sun are known to be one in the lotus of that nondual with Pāṇḍaravāsinī, therefore she is called Padmanartteśvarī in all the tantras of the buddhas, etc.

original: no // rdo rje 'dod chags gi rigs ni 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i rigs te snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs so //
analyzed: no // rdo rje 'dod chags gi rigs ni 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i rigs te snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs so //
translated: The vajra passion family is the family of pure passion, the family of Amitābha.

original: mchog gi snying po'i snying pa zhes ba ni de nyid bskyed pa'i rgyu'i sngags te bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: mchog gi snying po'i snying pa zhes ba ni de nyid bskyed pa'i rgyu'i sngags te bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: The essence of the supreme essence is the mantra that is the cause of its generation, that is, the creation stage and the perfection stage.

original: nyid kyi sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: nyid kyi sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: One's own body and so forth are as before.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug rig pa chen po zhes pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gang gis rnam par dpyod par byed pa de ni 'jig rten te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug rig pa chen po zhes pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gang gis rnam par dpyod par byed pa de ni 'jig rten te /
translated: The great knowledge lord of the world is he who analyzes the nature of things.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: He is discriminating wisdom.

original: de la dbang phyug ni de'i ngo bo snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: de la dbang phyug ni de'i ngo bo snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The lord of that is Amitabha, whose nature is speech.

original: rig pa chen po'i bdag po ni sngags thams cad dang rig pa rnams kyi bdag po ste /
analyzed: rig pa chen po'i bdag po ni sngags thams cad dang rig pa rnams kyi bdag po ste /
translated: The great knowledge lord is the lord of all mantras and knowledge mantras,

original: gsung gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsung gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the nature of speech.

original: de nyid kyi phyag rgya chen po sbyor ba'i thabs kyis zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin du bskyed pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyag rgya chen po sbyor ba'i thabs kyis zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin du bskyed pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: The method of union with that great seal is as before, the stage of generation and the stage of completion.

original: rgyab tu bzhugs so zhes pa ni nub phyogs pa'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: rgyab tu bzhugs so zhes pa ni nub phyogs pa'o zhes ston to //
translated: He resides in the west, it is taught, because he is in the west.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gdon mi za ba'i dam tshig ni sems can smin pa dag grol ba dag spro ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gdon mi za ba'i dam tshig ni sems can smin pa dag grol ba dag spro ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes te /
translated: , in the liberation of beings who are matured.

original: de las byung ba'i rdo rje gang yin pa de ni gdon mi za ba'i dam tshig 'byung ba'i rdo rje ste don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rdo rje gang yin pa de ni gdon mi za ba'i dam tshig 'byung ba'i rdo rje ste don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The vajra that arises from that is the vajra of the commitment that must be done, which is Amoghasiddhi.

original: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin de bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin de bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: The samadhi called that is the generation and perfection stages.

original: dam tshig 'gugs pa'i rigs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dam tshig 'gugs pa'i rigs zhes pa ni /
translated: The family of the commitment that summons, etc.

original: dam tshig ni mu stegs pa'i mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ni mu stegs pa'i mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: The commitment is the tirthika dakinis, dakas, etc.

original: de rnams dgug par bya ba 'phyir rigs ni don yod grub pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: de rnams dgug par bya ba 'phyir rigs ni don yod grub pa'i rigs te /
translated: The family that summons them is the family of Amoghasiddhi,

original: rlung gi khams gtso bor gyur bas 'gugs pa'i las mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung gi khams gtso bor gyur bas 'gugs pa'i las mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it performs the action of summoning, since the wind element is predominant.🔽The essence of the essence of the supreme, etc.

original: mchog gi snying po'i snying po zhes pa ni de nyid bskyed pa'i sngags te /
analyzed: mchog gi snying po'i snying po zhes pa ni de nyid bskyed pa'i sngags te /
translated: is the mantra that generates that.

original: snga ma bzhin du bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go //🔽pradzny'a dhri ka @39a * //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag go // pradzny'a dhri ka @39a * //
translated: As before, there are the creation and perfection stages.

original: ces bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa ni pradzny'a ste de 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa ni pradzny'a ste de 'dzin pa ste /
translated: PRAJNA DHRI K means one who holds prajna,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: which is the perfection stage.

original: shes rab bzhin du ral gri rno ba ni pradzny'a ste /
analyzed: shes rab bzhin du ral gri rno ba ni pradzny'a ste /
translated: The sword is sharp like wisdom, which is prajna,

original: de 'dzin par byed pas na bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pas na bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: and it is held, which is the creation stage.

original: phul du byung ba'i shes pa ni pranydz'a ste 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i shes pa ni pranydz'a ste 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Supreme knowledge is prajna, which is clear light,

original: de 'dzin pa ste mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa ste mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: and it is held, which is manifest enlightenment.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Then, etc. is easy to understand.

original: gdon mi za ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i dngos grub sa bcu la gnas par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can sems can thams cad la gang las byung ba ni gdon mi za ba'i dngos grub ste rta mchog go //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i dngos grub sa bcu la gnas par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can sems can thams cad la gang las byung ba ni gdon mi za ba'i dngos grub ste rta mchog go //
translated: The unfailing is the unfailing attainment, which is the supreme horse, from which comes the unfailing result, which is the attainment of the ten stages.

original: de nyid kyi phyag rgya chen por sbyor ba'i thabs kyis zhes pa ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyag rgya chen por sbyor ba'i thabs kyis zhes pa ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The means of union with the Great Seal is the stage of development.

original: byang phyogs su zhugs so zhes pa ni don rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs su zhugs so zhes pa ni don rtogs pa'o //
translated: The northern direction is the realization of the meaning.

original: zhe sdang gti mug 'dod chags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don nye bar bsdus pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gti mug 'dod chags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don nye bar bsdus pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of hatred, delusion, desire, etc., should be summarized and explained.

original: 'dir ni dang po 'gro ba mun pa dang 'dra ba stong par yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni dang po 'gro ba mun pa dang 'dra ba stong par yod pa ste /
translated: Here, first, the world is like darkness, existing in emptiness.

original: de'i rjes la gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nam mkha' mtha' yas kyi skye mched la sogs pa gzugs med pa na yang zhe sdang gi bag chags drag par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i rjes la gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nam mkha' mtha' yas kyi skye mched la sogs pa gzugs med pa na yang zhe sdang gi bag chags drag par gyur to //
translated: After that, in the formless realm, in the formless realm of Infinite Space, etc., the latent tendencies of hatred became intense.

original: de ma thag tu gzugs dang ldan par 'gyur te //
analyzed: de ma thag tu gzugs dang ldan par 'gyur te //
translated: Immediately after that, they became endowed with form.

original: de nas nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi mthus zla ba mthong ba tsam gyis chu shel gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba de rnams kyis rang gi lus las snum pa'i rang bzhin chu'i rgyun 'bebs par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi mthus zla ba mthong ba tsam gyis chu shel gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba de rnams kyis rang gi lus las snum pa'i rang bzhin chu'i rgyun 'bebs par gyur to //
translated: Then, by the power of the latent tendencies of afflictions, like a water-crystal gem, they caused a stream of water with an oily nature to descend from their own bodies, merely by seeing the moon.

original: 'bebs pa de rnams kyi kha dog ser po'i sa'i khams chags par gyur to //
analyzed: 'bebs pa de rnams kyi kha dog ser po'i sa'i khams chags par gyur to //
translated: The yellow color of those descending beings is the earth element.🔽They arise from space and, due to the power of intense afflictions, they create the eon of the earth element and become its lords.

original: de rnams kyang nam mkha' las byung zhing nyon mongs pa drag po'i dbang gis sa'i khams kyi bskal ba byas shing bdag po byed pa dang ; de rnams kyang mtshan ma gnyis su gyur to //
analyzed: de rnams kyang nam mkha' las byung zhing nyon mongs pa drag po'i dbang gis sa'i khams kyi bskal ba byas shing bdag po byed pa dang ; de rnams kyang mtshan ma gnyis su gyur to //
translated: Those beings also have two signs:

original: bud med dang skyes pa'i sbyor bas 'gro ba rnams 'byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa'i sbyor bas 'gro ba rnams 'byung bar gyur to //
translated: from the union of male and female beings, beings arise.

original: ma dum pa la sogs srung bar byed pa /
analyzed: ma dum pa la sogs srung bar byed pa /
translated: The earth element is protected by the king of the earth element, such as Madhumatt and so on.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa dang / lus tshim par bya ba'i phyir 'bru la sogs pa byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa dang / lus tshim par bya ba'i phyir 'bru la sogs pa byung ngo //
translated: In order to satisfy the bodies of beings, grains and so on arise.

original: de nas rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'gro ba drug skye bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'khor ba zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor dang 'dra ba byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'gro ba drug skye bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'khor ba zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor dang 'dra ba byung bar gyur to //
translated: Then, the six types of beings arise in various ways. This is the arising of samsara, which has the nature of afflictions and secondary afflictions, like a waterwheel.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa gtso bor gyur pa'i 'gro ba gzigs nas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i lam spangs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa gtso bor gyur pa'i 'gro ba gzigs nas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i lam spangs te /
translated: Then, the Bhagavat, having seen the migrating beings for whom the afflictions are the main thing, abandoned the path of freedom from attachment.

original: de'i gtso @39b bor gyur ba nyon mongs pa lnga rna par dag pa'i ngo bo rigs lnga spros so //
analyzed: de'i gtso @39b bor gyur ba nyon mongs pa lnga rna par dag pa'i ngo bo rigs lnga spros so //
translated: The five afflictions, which are the main thing for them, were emanated as the five families, which have the nature of being pure.

original: zhe sdang gi rigs la mi bskyod pa'i rigs dang / gti mug gi rigs can la gti mug gi rigs te rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs dang / 'dod chags kyi rigs can la 'dod chags kyi rigs te snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs dang /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rigs la mi bskyod pa'i rigs dang / gti mug gi rigs can la gti mug gi rigs te rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs dang / 'dod chags kyi rigs can la 'dod chags kyi rigs te snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs dang /
translated: For those of the family of hatred, the Akṣhobhya family; for those of the family of delusion, the Vairochana family; for those of the family of desire, the Amitābha family; and for those of the family of pride, the Ratnasaṃbhava family.

original: nor gyi dregs pas khengs pa'i sems can rnams kyi brgyal spong ba'i phyi rnam mkha' mdzod kyi yid bzhin ro bu ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs dang / khyab 'jug dang drag po dang / dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa'i lha rnams ni gdul bar dka' ba'i gzhan gyi 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dam tshig dgug par bya ba'i don du dam tshig gi rigs ni sprul par mdzad do //
analyzed: nor gyi dregs pas khengs pa'i sems can rnams kyi brgyal spong ba'i phyi rnam mkha' mdzod kyi yid bzhin ro bu ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs dang / khyab 'jug dang drag po dang / dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa'i lha rnams ni gdul bar dka' ba'i gzhan gyi 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dam tshig dgug par bya ba'i don du dam tshig gi rigs ni sprul par mdzad do //
translated: The families of the deities Viṣṇu, Śiva, and Hṛṣīkeśa and so on are emanations of the pledge family for the purpose of summoning the pledges that are characterized by the harmfulness of others that are difficult to tame.

original: rigs lnga po de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams spros pas mtha' yas pa'i rigs brgya ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs lnga po de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams spros pas mtha' yas pa'i rigs brgya ru 'gyur ro //
translated: Those five families become one hundred families that are limitless due to the emanations of the tathāgatas, goddesses, bodhisattvas, and wrathful ones.

original: de rnams kyang sna tshogs pa'i bag chags dang ldan pa'i sems can gdul ba'i don du rigs bye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang sna tshogs pa'i bag chags dang ldan pa'i sems can gdul ba'i don du rigs bye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those also become ten million families for the purpose of taming sentient beings who possess various habitual tendencies.

original: zhes gtso bo nyid du lnga bstan to //
analyzed: zhes gtso bo nyid du lnga bstan to //
translated: Thus, the five are taught to be the principal ones.

original: de dag ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: 'dod dang thar pa rab grub pa //
analyzed: 'dod dang thar pa rab grub pa //
translated: The accomplishment of the desired and liberation.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi de rnams la mchod pa tsam phul ba de rnams la 'dod pa ni mtho ris kyi bde ba grub par byed pa ni ster bar byed pa dang / thob pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis de'i ngo bo rtogs pa gang yin pa de rnams la thar pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub pa yin no zhes bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi de rnams la mchod pa tsam phul ba de rnams la 'dod pa ni mtho ris kyi bde ba grub par byed pa ni ster bar byed pa dang / thob pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis de'i ngo bo rtogs pa gang yin pa de rnams la thar pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub pa yin no zhes bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o /
translated: This is the creation and completion stages, where one who has merely made offerings to those deities accomplishes the desired, which is the bestowal of the bliss of the higher realms, and for those who have attained and so forth, the stages of the realization of the nature of those deities is the accomplishment of liberation and nirvana.

original: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje 'chang ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje 'chang ni mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: Then Vajradhara is Akshobhya.

original: de la rjes su chags par bya ba ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde bas mnyes par phyir dam tshig ni de'i bya ba gcig dang ldan pa m'a ma k'i ste /
analyzed: de la rjes su chags par bya ba ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde bas mnyes par phyir dam tshig ni de'i bya ba gcig dang ldan pa m'a ma k'i ste /
translated: The one who is to be loved is the one who is pleased by the bliss of union. The commitment is the single activity of Mamaki.

original: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the samadhi called “then.” This is the creation stage.

original: rdo rje thams cad ni lnga'i nang na gtso bor gyur pa mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje thams cad ni lnga'i nang na gtso bor gyur pa mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: All vajras are the principal one among the five, Akshobhya.

original: de'i btsun mo mchog ni dam tshig lha mo gtso mo m'a ma k'i ste /

original: de nyid kyang rdo rje ni rigs sam cod pan du gang la yod pa de ni 'phags pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyang rdo rje ni rigs sam cod pan du gang la yod pa de ni 'phags pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa ste /
translated: That itself is the vajra, i.e., the clan or crown, on which there is the sublime Aparajita.

original: de zhes bya ba'i @41b ting nge 'dzin to /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i @41b ting nge 'dzin to /
translated: That is the samadhi called “that.”

original: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of generation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du ste /
translated: All Ones-Gone-Thus are the mandala, etc.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of generation.

original: pradzny'anta kri ta ces bya ba la le lo dang / phung po'i bdud dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / ma rig pa rnam shes rab kyis 'joms par byed pas na pradzny'anta kri ta de rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: pradzny'anta kri ta ces bya ba la le lo dang / phung po'i bdud dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / ma rig pa rnam shes rab kyis 'joms par byed pas na pradzny'anta kri ta de rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Prajnânta-kṛita means having destroyed ignorance with wisdom, and refers to the perfection stage.

original: phul du byung bas gzhan gyi gnod pa shes pas na pradzny'a ste /
analyzed: phul du byung bas gzhan gyi gnod pa shes pas na pradzny'a ste /
translated: Prajña means having understood the harm of others,

original: khyab 'jug dang lha chen po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab 'jug dang lha chen po la sogs pa'o //
translated: and refers to Viṣṇu, Maheśvara, and so forth.

original: de rnams khro bo'i gzugs kyis mthar ni 'dul bar byed pas na pradzny'anta kri ta de bskyed pa'i rim pa'o ;
analyzed: de rnams khro bo'i gzugs kyis mthar ni 'dul bar byed pas na pradzny'anta kri ta de bskyed pa'i rim pa'o ;
translated: Prajña-anta-kṛita means having subdued them with wrathful forms, and refers to the generation stage.

original: / rdo rje'i dam tshig bsnyengs par byed pa'i tshul du zhes pa ni rdo rje'i dam tshig ni de bzhin gshegs pa bsrung ba'i phyir bsnyengs par byed pa'i tshul ni khro bo'i tshul du ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: / rdo rje'i dam tshig bsnyengs par byed pa'i tshul du zhes pa ni rdo rje'i dam tshig ni de bzhin gshegs pa bsrung ba'i phyir bsnyengs par byed pa'i tshul ni khro bo'i tshul du ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The vajra pledge is the pledge to protect the Tathāgatas, and the manner of fearlessness is the wrathful manner, and refers to the generation stage.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: chos rin po che'i 'byung gnas ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni chos ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i gsung rab ste de nyid gzhan gyi bstan pa rnams las phul du byung ba'i phyir rin po che ste /
analyzed: chos rin po che'i 'byung gnas ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni chos ni yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i gsung rab ste de nyid gzhan gyi bstan pa rnams las phul du byung ba'i phyir rin po che ste /
translated: The samadhi called “Source of the Jewel of Dharma” is the Dharma, the scriptures of the twelve branches, which is a jewel because it is superior to other teachings.

original: de'i 'byung gnas ni bskyed pa'i gnas te gsung gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir snang ba mtha' yas te /
analyzed: de'i 'byung gnas ni bskyed pa'i gnas te gsung gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir snang ba mtha' yas te /
translated: Its source is the place of generation, which is Amitabha, because he is the nature of speech.

original: de'i ngo bo ting nge 'dzin te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o//
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ting nge 'dzin te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o//
translated: His essence is samadhi, which is the stage of generation.

original: yang na chos ni lus kyis bskyod pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na chos ni lus kyis bskyod pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the Dharma is the movements of the body and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi rin po che ni h'um dang phat la sogs pa'i sngags rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rin po che ni h'um dang phat la sogs pa'i sngags rnams so //
translated: The jewel of those is the mantras such as hum and phat.

original: 'byung ba nas ni de dag gis thob pa'i mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba ste las so //
analyzed: 'byung ba nas ni de dag gis thob pa'i mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba ste las so //
translated: The source is the supreme joy obtained by those, which is the action.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa nam snga ma bzhin te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa nam snga ma bzhin te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The samadhi called “Passion of All Tathagatas” and so forth is as before, which is the stage of generation.

original: padm'anta kri ta ces bya ba la ma dran pa dang nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / log par lta ba dang / las kyi sgrib pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnams padma bzhin du kha phye ba'i shes rab kyi mthar ni 'joms par byed pas na padm'anta kri ta de rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: padm'anta kri ta ces bya ba la ma dran pa dang nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / log par lta ba dang / las kyi sgrib pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnams padma bzhin du kha phye ba'i shes rab kyi mthar ni 'joms par byed pas na padm'anta kri ta de rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Padmantakṛta means that which destroys the afflictions of the demon of forgetfulness, wrong views, the obscurations of karma, and the desire for desire, which are like lotuses, with the tip of wisdom, and that is the completion stage.

original: padma dang a'anta ni rdo rje ste de dag byed pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba ste padm'anta kri ta de ni rgyu'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni gsum gang yin pa de rnams la byin gyis brlab pa ni las thams cad pa yin pa'i phyir srung bar @42a * //
analyzed: padma dang a'anta ni rdo rje ste de dag byed pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba ste padm'anta kri ta de ni rgyu'o // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni gsum gang yin pa de rnams la byin gyis brlab pa ni las thams cad pa yin pa'i phyir srung bar @42a * //
translated: Padma and anta are vajras, and their making is their union, and that is padmantakṛta, which is the cause.

original: mdzad pa'o // de nyid kyi phyir khro bo chen po ste gzugs kyis gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mdzad pa'o // de nyid kyi phyir khro bo chen po ste gzugs kyis gnas pa ste /
translated: The consecration of the three maṇḍalas of the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas is the protection, because it is the all-activity consecration. For that very reason, it is the great wrathful one, abiding in form.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the generation stage.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rdo rje theg pa la zhugs pa'i sgrub pa po rnams so //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rdo rje theg pa la zhugs pa'i sgrub pa po rnams so //
translated: Or else, all the Tathagatas are the adepts who have entered the Vajra Vehicle.

original: de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor la dam tshig nyams pa'i dbang gis dri ma dang ldan pa de rnams la byin gyis brlab pa ni gzhan 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor la dam tshig nyams pa'i dbang gis dri ma dang ldan pa de rnams la byin gyis brlab pa ni gzhan 'tsho ba ste /
translated: Their mandala of body, speech, and mind, and the mandala of commitments, are defiled by the power of the transgression of commitments. The consecration of those is the other life.

original: gang gi phyir don yod grub pa'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor pa rnams ni dam tshig nyams pa gso ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bla ma rnams bzhed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don yod grub pa'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor pa rnams ni dam tshig nyams pa gso ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bla ma rnams bzhed do //
translated: For what reason? The mandala deities of the Amoghasiddhi lineage have the power to heal the transgression of commitments, so the Gurus assert.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni bstan pa'i mthun par gyur pa'i bgegs rnams kyi sku gsung thugs gang yin pa de rnams la byin gyis brlab pa ni phur bus gdab pa ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni bstan pa'i mthun par gyur pa'i bgegs rnams kyi sku gsung thugs gang yin pa de rnams la byin gyis brlab pa ni phur bus gdab pa ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Or else, all the Tathagatas are the obstacles that are favorable to the teaching. The consecration of their body, speech, and mind is the driving in of the dagger, which is the stage of generation.

original: 'og tu rtse gcig pa'i bdud rtsi 'khyil pas bgegs rnams la phur bus gdab pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'og tu rtse gcig pa'i bdud rtsi 'khyil pas bgegs rnams la phur bus gdab pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The stake-driving of the obstructors by the Amṛtakuṇḍali of one-pointedness below has already been explained.

original: bighn'am ta krita ces bya ba ni g-yeng ba dang lha'i bu'i bdud dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / khong khro ba ste bighn'am no //
analyzed: bighn'am ta krita ces bya ba ni g-yeng ba dang lha'i bu'i bdud dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / khong khro ba ste bighn'am no //
translated: The so-called bighna or takṛt is distraction, the māra of the sons of the gods, the obscuration of karmic ripening, the grasping of views as supreme, and anger.

original: de rnams la de'i gnyen pos mthar byed pas na bighn'am ta kri ta de rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la de'i gnyen pos mthar byed pas na bighn'am ta kri ta de rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Since they are terminated by the antidotes to those, they are bighna or takṛt. That is the completion stage.

original: bighn'am ni khyab 'jug dang drag po la sogs pa de rnams kyi bdag po ste /
analyzed: bighn'am ni khyab 'jug dang drag po la sogs pa de rnams kyi bdag po ste /
translated: Bighna or na is the lord of those, such as Viṣṇu and Śiva.

original: glang po che'i gdong can log 'dren yang bighn'am no //
analyzed: glang po che'i gdong can log 'dren yang bighn'am no //
translated: The elephant-faced Gaṇeśa is also bighna or na.

original: de la mthar ni zhabs kyi 'og tu gnon par mdzad pa na bighn'am ta kri ta de bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de la mthar ni zhabs kyi 'og tu gnon par mdzad pa na bighn'am ta kri ta de bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: When he is terminated and pressed underfoot, that is bighna or takṛt. That is the stage of generation.

original: bighn'am ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa de dag stong pa nyid du bsgoms pas /
analyzed: bighn'am ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa de dag stong pa nyid du bsgoms pas /
translated: Bighna or na is the conceptions of self and others.

original: mtha' snang bar byed pas ni bighn'am ta kri ta de dang por sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mtha' snang bar byed pas ni bighn'am ta kri ta de dang por sbyor ba'o //
translated: The maker of the end of obstacles is the first application of Vighnāntakṛt.

original: bighn'am ni sems can gyi don la bgegs te stong pa nyid bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bighn'am ni sems can gyi don la bgegs te stong pa nyid bsgom pa'o //
translated: Vighnāntakṛt is the meditation on emptiness, which is the obstacle to the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de las zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim gyis sku dang dkyil 'khor spro bas aanta ni de stong par byed pas na bighn'am ta kri ta de dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: de las zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim gyis sku dang dkyil 'khor spro bas aanta ni de stong par byed pas na bighn'am ta kri ta de dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: From that, by the stage of the moon, vajra, and so on, the emanation of the body and maṇḍala is Anta, and because it makes that empty, it is Vighnāntakṛt. That is the supreme victor maṇḍala.

original: bighn'am ni sa bcu ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: bighn'am ni sa bcu ma thob pa'o //
translated: Vighnāntakṛt is the non-attainment of the tenth stage.

original: bdud rtsi myang ba la sogs pas de mthar byed pas na bighn'am ta kri ta de las kyi rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: bdud rtsi myang ba la sogs pas de mthar byed pas na bighn'am ta kri ta de las kyi rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: The supreme victor activity is the one who makes an end of that by tasting elixir, and so on. That is Vighnāntakṛt.

original: bighn'am ni snang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bighn'am ni snang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Vighnāntakṛt is the appearances, and so on.

original: de rnams 'od gsal bas mthar byed pa sa bighn'am ta kri da de sems rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'od gsal bas mthar byed pa sa bighn'am ta kri da de sems rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The one who makes an end of those by means of luminosity is Vighnāntakṛt. That is the pure mind.

original: yi ge gsum 'jug pa dang gnas @42b pa dang ldang pa'i rim gyis tha dad par bzlas pa gang yin pa de ni bgegs so //
analyzed: yi ge gsum 'jug pa dang gnas @42b pa dang ldang pa'i rim gyis tha dad par bzlas pa gang yin pa de ni bgegs so //
translated: The repetition that is differentiated by the stages of entry, abiding, and rising of the three syllables is the obstacle.

original: yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pas de mthar byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de /
analyzed: yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pas de mthar byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de /
translated: Since it ends that by recitation without defect, it is the end of obstacles.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'o //
translated: It is vajra recitation.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched brtags pa sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mthar byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched brtags pa sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mthar byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de /
translated: Since it ends by the meditative stabilization of the illusion-like investigation of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, it is the end of obstacles.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: It is self-consecration.

original: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags par pa rnams ni bgegs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags par pa rnams ni bgegs te /
translated: Attachment, non-attachment, and the middle free from attachment are obstacles.

original: de rnams lhan cig skyes pa'i rim gyis mtha' ni mi dmigs par byed pas ni bgegs mthar byed de mngon par byang chub pa'o//
analyzed: de rnams lhan cig skyes pa'i rim gyis mtha' ni mi dmigs par byed pas ni bgegs mthar byed de mngon par byang chub pa'o//
translated: Since it ends those by the process of their innate union, it is the end of obstacles. It is manifest enlightenment.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha dad pa ni bgegs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha dad pa ni bgegs so //
translated: The difference between the conventional and the ultimate is an obstacle.

original: de dag gi mtha' ni dbyer med par byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mtha' ni dbyer med par byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Since it ends that by making them inseparable, it is the end of obstacles. It is union.

original: dgongs pa bshad pas ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: dgongs pa bshad pas ni shes rab bo //
translated: The explanation of the intention is wisdom.

original: bighn'am ni thabs so //
analyzed: bighn'am ni thabs so //
translated: The obstacle is the method.

original: de dag gi mtha' ni sbyor bar byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de rang bzhin no ;
analyzed: de dag gi mtha' ni sbyor bar byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de rang bzhin no ;
translated: Since the end of those is made into a union, it is the nature of Vidyo-🔽tanamukha.

original: / tha mal pa'i 'jig rten gyi skyes pa dang bud med kyi rgyal mchan dag ni bgegs te /
analyzed: / tha mal pa'i 'jig rten gyi skyes pa dang bud med kyi rgyal mchan dag ni bgegs te /
translated: The banners of ordinary worldly men and women are obstacles.

original: de dag gi mtha' ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pas sdud par byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de rgyu'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mtha' ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pas sdud par byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de rgyu'o //
translated: Since the end of those is gathered by means of supramundane conduct, it is the cause of Vidyantakrt.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba ni bgegs te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba ni bgegs te /
translated: The transference of bodhicitta is an obstacle

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba nyams pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba nyams pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it destroys connate bliss.🔽Therefore, since the end of that is protected by the syllables such as

original: / de bas na h'um phat la sogs pa'i yig 'brus de rengs par byas shing mtha' ni skyong bar byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de las so //
analyzed: / de bas na h'um phat la sogs pa'i yig 'brus de rengs par byas shing mtha' ni skyong bar byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de las so //
translated: hum phat, it is the action of Vidyantakrt.

original: bgegs ni dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang dga' bral lo //
analyzed: bgegs ni dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang dga' bral lo //
translated: The obstacles are joy, supreme joy, and the joy of separation.

original: de rnams la bzhi pa ni mthar te /
analyzed: de rnams la bzhi pa ni mthar te /
translated: The fourth is the end of those.

original: des ro gcig par byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: des ro gcig par byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de 'bras bu'o //
translated: Since that makes them of one taste, it is the result of Vidyantakrt.

original: so sor sdud pa la sogs mi mthun pa ni bgegs te /
analyzed: so sor sdud pa la sogs mi mthun pa ni bgegs te /
translated: The obstacles are the individual retentions and so on.

original: de rnams so sor sdud pa la sogs pa yan lag drug gi mthar ni 'jig par byed pa na bgegs mthar byed de rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de rnams so sor sdud pa la sogs pa yan lag drug gi mthar ni 'jig par byed pa na bgegs mthar byed de rnal 'byor ro //
translated: At the end of the six limbs, such as the withdrawal, when one is destroying, one is the destroyer of obstacles, the yoga.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang kha na ma tho ba spom po ni bgegs te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang kha na ma tho ba spom po ni bgegs te /
translated: The gross transgressions and sins are the obstacles.

original: de rnams la dam tshig dang sdom pas mthar byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la dam tshig dang sdom pas mthar byed pas na bgegs mthar byed de sgrub pa'o //
translated: Since one destroys them with the commitments and vows, one is the destroyer of obstacles, the practice.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni sems can thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs ni gang zhig lus dang ngag dang sems la gnod par byed pa ste srin po rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni sems can thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs ni gang zhig lus dang ngag dang sems la gnod par byed pa ste srin po rnams so //
translated: The bodies, speech, and minds of all sentient beings are the tathagatas. The rakshasas are those who harm the body, speech, and mind.

original: de rnams la skrag pa ni 'jigs par byed @43a * //
analyzed: de rnams la skrag pa ni 'jigs par byed @43a * //
translated: One is frightened of them, one is terrified.

original: pa'i rnam pa phyag rgya chen po'i khro bo'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: pa'i rnam pa phyag rgya chen po'i khro bo'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: In the form of the wrathful great seal, one is the one who terrifies them.

original: byang phyogs kyi sgor bzhugs so zhes bya ba ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi sgor bzhugs so zhes bya ba ste bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: One sits at the northern gate, the creation stage.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: One should summarize with “all tathagatas,” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dang bcas pa dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyi bgegs 'joms pas mnyes par byed pa ni mgu bar mdzad pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dang bcas pa dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyi bgegs 'joms pas mnyes par byed pa ni mgu bar mdzad pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: All the Tathagatas, together with the lords of the maṇḍala, are pleased by the destruction of the obstacles to the body, speech, and mind of the maṇḍala deities.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor ni gzhi'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor ni gzhi'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Similarly, the maṇḍala is the ground maṇḍala.

original: de'i dam tshig ni rdo rje'i rab la sogs pa bcing ba'i bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni rdo rje'i rab la sogs pa bcing ba'i bya ba ste /
translated: Its pledge is the activity of binding the vajra hook, etc.

original: de'i don du sems pa ni rtsol pa dang ldan pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de'i don du sems pa ni rtsol pa dang ldan pa'i sems so //
translated: Thinking of that is the mind that is endowed with effort.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor ni gzhi can gyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor ni gzhi can gyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Similarly, the maṇḍala is the maṇḍala that has the ground.

original: de'i dam tshig ni dka' ste dbye ba'i phyir sems pa ni rtsol ba dang ldan pa'i sems te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni dka' ste dbye ba'i phyir sems pa ni rtsol ba dang ldan pa'i sems te bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Its pledge is the difficult-to-attain, and thinking of that is the mind that is endowed with effort.

original: de ltar na dbus kyi padmar bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de ltar na dbus kyi padmar bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān is in the center lotus.

original: 'dab ma rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four Tathāgatas are on the petals.

original: grva rnams su lha mo spyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: grva rnams su lha mo spyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The goddesses Locanā, etc., are in the corners.

original: phyi rol gyi rim pa'i grva bzhi po la gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rim pa'i grva bzhi po la gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the four corners of the outer circle are Rūpavajrā and so forth.

original: reg bya rdo rje ma ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: reg bya rdo rje ma ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khyud pa'o //
translated: Sparśavajrā embraces the Lord.

original: snam bu bzhi po la ni shar gyi snam bu nas brtsams te /
analyzed: snam bu bzhi po la ni shar gyi snam bu nas brtsams te /
translated: On the four ledges, beginning with the eastern ledge,

original: byams pa la sogs pa gnyis gnyis te /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa gnyis gnyis te /
translated: are two each of Maitreya and so forth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' brgyad yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brgyad yin no //
translated: These are the eight bodhisattvas.

original: shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams la gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams la gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'o //
translated: At the gates beginning with the east are Yamāntaka and so forth.

original: shar lho la sogs pa'i sgo'i grva rnams la mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shar lho la sogs pa'i sgo'i grva rnams la mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: At the corners of the gates beginning with southeast are Acala and so forth.

original: steng dang 'og tu gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po dang gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba dag dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po dang gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba dag dgod par bya'o //
translated: Above and below are Sumbharāja and Uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin.

original: de rnams kyi sku mdog phyag la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni sngar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku mdog phyag la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni sngar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Their colors, hand implements, and so forth have been previously explained.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis le'u 'di la lha bcu gsum bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis le'u 'di la lha bcu gsum bstan pa yin te /
translated: Well then, the Bhagavān has taught thirteen deities in this chapter.

original: ci'i phyir sum cu rtsa gnyis brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sum cu rtsa gnyis brjod ce na /
translated: Why are thirty-two mentioned?

original: de'i lan 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan 'di yin te /
translated: The answer is this.

original: gleng gzhi 'das ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pas te /
analyzed: gleng gzhi 'das ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pas te /
translated: The Lord taught immediately after the introduction.

original: skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: skyon med pa'o //
translated: There is no fault.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo dang khro bo rnams ni the tshom med do //
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo dang khro bo rnams ni the tshom med do //
translated: For example, the Tathagata, the Goddess, and the Wrathful Ones are without doubt.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la @43b sogs pas gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la @43b sogs pas gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Bodhisattva-mahasattva Rupavajra, etc., indicates Rupavajri, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dam tshig rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' brgyad bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dam tshig rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' brgyad bstan to //
translated: The Bodhisattva-mahasattva Samayavajra, etc., indicates the eight Bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar na khro bo bzhi lus par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na khro bo bzhi lus par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: In that case, are not four Wrathful Ones missing?

original: lus par mi 'gyur te grvar bzhugs pa de rnams la gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i sprul pa yin te /
analyzed: lus par mi 'gyur te grvar bzhugs pa de rnams la gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i sprul pa yin te /
translated: They are not missing, because those who stand in the corners are emanations of Yamantaka, etc.

original: gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi po dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi po dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because Yamantaka, etc., are not different from the four Tathagatas.

original: de'i phyir lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is the wheel of the maṇḍala of the thirty-two deities.

original: de nyid gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid gnas pa yin no //
translated: That is the abiding.

original: da ni le'u'i ming brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni le'u'i ming brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the name of the chapter will be stated:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “All tathāgatas” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: All tathāgatas are Akṣhobhya and so on.

original: de rnams kyi gang zhig sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba'i yi ge gsum ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gang zhig sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba'i yi ge gsum ste /
translated: Among them, the three syllables of the secret of body, speech, and mind are the three syllables.

original: de rnams nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs la sbas pa'i phyir gsang pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs la sbas pa'i phyir gsang pa ste /
translated: Since they are hidden in the family of śrāvakas and so on, they are secret.

original: de rnams kyis gang zhig 'dus pa ni de rnams yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa dkyil 'khor pa rgyud gang la yod pa de la ni de skad ces bya ste de las so /
analyzed: de rnams kyis gang zhig 'dus pa ni de rnams yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa dkyil 'khor pa rgyud gang la yod pa de la ni de skad ces bya ste de las so /
translated: The gathering of them is the maṇḍala born from their complete transformation. The tantra in which they exist is called that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
translated: All tathāgatas are Mahāvajradhara.

original: de nyid kyi gang zhig dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi rim pas sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi gang zhig dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi rim pas sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: That very one, the mandala of commitment, is the emanation mandala by the stage of the inner nature.

original: de yang phyi rol du spro ba ste /
analyzed: de yang phyi rol du spro ba ste /
translated: And that is also the emanation externally.

original: de nyid byin gyis brlab pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du dgod pa'i tshul le'u gang la yod pa de ni de zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid byin gyis brlab pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du dgod pa'i tshul le'u gang la yod pa de ni de zhes bya'o //
translated: That very one, the consecration, is the method of arrangement in the same stage. The chapter in which it is found is called that.

original: dper na bya khang bzhin du ni khang pa'i steng du gnas pas rlung dang char pa la sogs pa sel bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: dper na bya khang bzhin du ni khang pa'i steng du gnas pas rlung dang char pa la sogs pa sel bar byed pa ste /
translated: Like a bird's nest, it is a place on top of a house that removes wind, rain, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i skyon 'joms par byed pas na bya khang bzhin du le'u zhes brjod do //🔽rgyud 'grel las le'u dang po'i tshig gi don bcu drug gi bshad pa'o /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i skyon 'joms par byed pas na bya khang bzhin du le'u zhes brjod do // rgyud 'grel las le'u dang po'i tshig gi don bcu drug gi bshad pa'o /
translated: In the same way, it is called a chapter because it conquers the faults of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.🔽This is the explanation of the sixteen topics of the first chapter of the Tantra Commentary.

original: // / le'u dang po'i 'grel pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i grangs ni stong phrag gcig dang tshigs su bcad pa brgya tham pa'o //
analyzed: // / le'u dang po'i 'grel pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i grangs ni stong phrag gcig dang tshigs su bcad pa brgya tham pa'o //
translated: The number of verses in the commentary on the first chapter is one thousand and one hundred.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi lha'i rnal 'byor bsgom pas rgod pa bskyed pas de nyid sel bar bya ba'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa gtso bor gyur pa byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u gnyis pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi lha'i rnal 'byor bsgom pas rgod pa bskyed pas de nyid sel bar bya ba'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa gtso bor gyur pa byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u gnyis pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: Since one generates agitation by meditating on the yoga of the deity with the two aspects, in order to remove that, one should undertake the second chapter on the thought of awakening, which is primarily the ultimate truth.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa @44a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa @44a * //
translated: Then, etc.

original: la ; de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: la ; de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: All tathāgatas are Vairocana, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das ye shes la dbang thob pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ye shes la dbang thob pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
translated: The Blessed One, who has attained mastery of intuition, the lord of the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas, is Great Vajradhara.

original: de la mchod pa ni phyi nang gsang ba'i mtshan nyid can byas nas phyag 'tshal ba yang byas nas 'di skad gsol to zhes pa ni 'di skad 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: de la mchod pa ni phyi nang gsang ba'i mtshan nyid can byas nas phyag 'tshal ba yang byas nas 'di skad gsol to zhes pa ni 'di skad 'dri ba yin no //
translated: Having made offerings to him, which have the character of outer, inner, and secret offerings, and having also made prostrations, he said this: this is the question.

original: de'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: rang gi thugs ka las gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo lnga spros te /
analyzed: rang gi thugs ka las gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo lnga spros te /
translated: Five goddesses such as Rūpavajrā emanate from one’s heart.

original: de dag gis me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnam pa lngas yang dag par mchod cing reg bya rdo rje mas kyang snyoms par zhugs pa'i mchod pa byas la /
analyzed: de dag gis me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa rnam pa lngas yang dag par mchod cing reg bya rdo rje mas kyang snyoms par zhugs pa'i mchod pa byas la /
translated: They make offerings with the five types of offerings such as flowers and so on and also make offerings through the yoga of the vajra of touch.

original: de nas mar la mar bzhin du tha mi dad pa'i blos phyag btsal nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa the tshom zhugs pa'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de nas mar la mar bzhin du tha mi dad pa'i blos phyag btsal nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa the tshom zhugs pa'o zhes ston to //
translated: Then, with the thought that they are not different from the nectar, they prostrate and ask questions such as “What is Vairocana?”

original: rab tu byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las kyang /
translated: The topic divisions also states:🔽Just as water dissolves into water and

original: ji bzhin chu la chu thim dang // ji ltar mar la mar bzhin du //
analyzed: ji bzhin chu la chu thim dang // ji ltar mar la mar bzhin du //
translated: just as butter dissolves into butter,

original: rang gis rang gi ye shes ni //
analyzed: rang gis rang gi ye shes ni //
translated: one’s own pristine consciousness🔽dissolves into itself.

original: thim pa de ni phyag yin no //
analyzed: thim pa de ni phyag yin no //
translated: That is a prostration.

original: 'on kyang kun mkhyen rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: 'on kyang kun mkhyen rtogs pa ni //
translated: However, if the realization of omniscience

original: med na de ni mi dmigs te //
analyzed: med na de ni mi dmigs te //
translated: does not exist, it is not perceived.

original: mun pa'i tshogs kyis bkab pa na //
analyzed: mun pa'i tshogs kyis bkab pa na //
translated: When it is covered by a mass of darkness,

original: drin gyis mar me thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: drin gyis mar me thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: one obtains a lamp through kindness.

original: ci zhig gsol to zhe na ;
analyzed: ci zhig gsol to zhe na ;
translated: What do they request?

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kye bcom ldan 'das kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang pa'i bag chags 'joms par byed pa kye rdo rje 'chang chen po byang chub sems ni byang chub ni 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kye bcom ldan 'das kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang pa'i bag chags 'joms par byed pa kye rdo rje 'chang chen po byang chub sems ni byang chub ni 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: Body, speech, mind, and so on means, O Bhagavān, O great Vajradhara, who conquers the traces of affliction and purification, please explain the three consciousnesses, the mind of enlightenment, which is enlightenment, clearlight.

original: de la sems ni de'i bdag nyid du zhugs pa rnam par shes pa gsum bshad du gsol /
analyzed: de la sems ni de'i bdag nyid du zhugs pa rnam par shes pa gsum bshad du gsol /
translated: Mind means that which has entered into its nature.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: snying po zhes pa ni chos nyid kyi ngo bo de bzhin du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi kun brtags kyi mchog ces bya ba ni thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bos phul du byung ba'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: snying po zhes pa ni chos nyid kyi ngo bo de bzhin du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi kun brtags kyi mchog ces bya ba ni thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bos phul du byung ba'o zhes ston to //
translated: Essence is the nature of reality. Supreme means that the imagined body, speech, and mind are the best by nature of being empty of everything.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun ni phung po la sogs pa mi snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun ni phung po la sogs pa mi snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: All tathāgatas means that which makes the aggregates and so on invisible.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la mi bstan pa'i phyir gsang ba'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la mi bstan pa'i phyir gsang ba'o //
translated: It is secret because it is not taught to those who practice the stage of generation.

original: bla na med pa ni slob bzhin ma yin pa'i ngo bo byang chub kyi sems de nyid snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa ni slob bzhin ma yin pa'i ngo bo byang chub kyi sems de nyid snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The unsurpassed is the very essence of the enlightenment mind, which is not in the process of learning, and is connected with the previous [line].

original: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the completion stage.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: thams cad stong pa @44b nyid kyi ngo bo nyid la mos pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la ji ltar rdo rje 'chang chen pos de bzhin nying bstan par mdzad pa de ltar gsungs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung
analyzed: thams cad stong pa @44b nyid kyi ngo bo nyid la mos pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la ji ltar rdo rje 'chang chen pos de bzhin nying bstan par mdzad pa de ltar gsungs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung
translated: The Tathāgatas, who are endowed with devotion to the nature of the emptiness of everything, speak in the same way that Mahāvajradhara taught suchness, i.e., the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathāgatas.

original: dang thugs rdo rje ni mi snang bar mdzad pa de bzhin gshegs pa drug ste /
analyzed: dang thugs rdo rje ni mi snang bar mdzad pa de bzhin gshegs pa drug ste /
translated: The vajra of body, speech, and mind is the six Tathāgatas, who are made invisible.

original: de nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la gsol pa ni zhu ba mkhyen cing byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' gzhan ma rnams kyi yongs su rtog pa ni sems la gnas pa'i don dam pa'i rtog pa sgyu 'phrul gyi mthus nyid kyi ye
analyzed: de nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la gsol pa ni zhu ba mkhyen cing byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' gzhan ma rnams kyi yongs su rtog pa ni sems la gnas pa'i don dam pa'i rtog pa sgyu 'phrul gyi mthus nyid kyi ye
translated: By that very [vajra], the request to all the Tathāgatas is the knowledge of the request, and the thought of the other bodhisattvas, such as Maitreya, is the ultimate thought abiding in the mind. By the power of the magical display, one’s own mind is the nature of the five pristine

original: shes kyis mkhyen nas /
analyzed: shes kyis mkhyen nas /
translated: Knowing this with his wisdom,

original: de rnams la 'di skad ces bkal stsal to zhes pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i de kho na nyid gsungs so zhes ston to //
analyzed: de rnams la 'di skad ces bkal stsal to zhes pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i de kho na nyid gsungs so zhes ston to //
translated: he spoke thus to them. This shows that he will teach the thatness that will be explained below.

original: de yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Moreover, that is the completion stage.

original: khyed kyi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyed ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyed ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la'o //
translated: You, who are the Tathagatas, Bodhisattvas, etc.,

original: sems lus lta bu zhes bya ba la sems ni rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sems lus lta bu zhes bya ba la sems ni rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: your mind is like a body. The mind is the nature of the eight consciousnesses.

original: de lus lta bu zhes pa ni de las lus tha mi dad pa'o zhes ting nge 'dzin bskyed par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de lus lta bu zhes pa ni de las lus tha mi dad pa'o zhes ting nge 'dzin bskyed par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: It is like a body. It is not different from the body. Thus, you should generate the samadhi.

original: de bzhin du lus ni sgo dgu'i bdag nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus ni sgo dgu'i bdag nyid /
translated: Similarly, the body is the nature of the nine gates.

original: sems lta bu zhes pa ni sems kho na lus yin te /
analyzed: sems lta bu zhes pa ni sems kho na lus yin te /
translated: The mind is like a body. The mind itself is the body.

original: de las tha dad pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not different from it.

original: de bzhin du sems tshig tu brjod pa lta bu zhes pa ni gang zhig ngag brjod pa 'di ni yi ge dang tshig dang ngag la sogs pa'i rim pa brjod pa de yang de nyid kyi rnam pas sems ni yid bskyed par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems tshig tu brjod pa lta bu zhes pa ni gang zhig ngag brjod pa 'di ni yi ge dang tshig dang ngag la sogs pa'i rim pa brjod pa de yang de nyid kyi rnam pas sems ni yid bskyed par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Likewise, “as if the mind were speaking” means that whatever is spoken by the voice, that expression of syllables, words, and speech, should be generated by the mind in the form of that very [voice].

original: de ni 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: sems 'di dang tshig 'di dang lus 'di zhes bya ba'i dbye ba gzung bar ma byed cig pa ste /
analyzed: sems 'di dang tshig 'di dang lus 'di zhes bya ba'i dbye ba gzung bar ma byed cig pa ste /
translated: Do not apprehend the distinctions of “this mind,” “these words,” and “this body.”

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are empty by nature.

original: rten cing 'brel pa'i dbang gis rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid du snang ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel pa'i dbang gis rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid du snang ste /
translated: They appear in various forms by the power of dependent origination.

translated: The words “non-entity” and so on refer to the mantras that arise from the external teeth and lips, etc. Since they are momentary, they are destroyed by the utterance of the syllable tam. Therefore, the meditation on non-entity is the nature of the mantra recitation.

original: ma ning gi bzlas pa rab @46b tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma ning gi bzlas pa rab @46b tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the recitation of the neutral syllable.

original: de ni rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of vajra repetition.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Bhagavān, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po drug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po drug pa'o //
translated: All tathāgatas’ vajra body, speech, and mind is the sixth, Mahāvajradhara.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje ni khyad par du snang ba'i mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje ni khyad par du snang ba'i mdzes pa ste /
translated: Vairocana vajra is the beauty of special appearance,

original: sems rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pas so //
translated: by the purification of mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par shes pa gsum dang / mngon par rtogs pa ni rang bzhin rnams /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par shes pa gsum dang / mngon par rtogs pa ni rang bzhin rnams /
translated: All tathāgatas are the three consciousnesses, and the nature of realizations is vajra.

original: rdo rje ni mi snang bar byed pa 'od gsal ba ste de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi snang bar byed pa 'od gsal ba ste de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: It is the clear light that makes them invisible, and he entered into the meditative concentration called that.

original: snga ma bzhin du byang chub kyi sems 'di zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba ston par byed pa'i ngag gsungs so zhes 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du byang chub kyi sems 'di zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba ston par byed pa'i ngag gsungs so zhes 'brel ba'o //
translated: As before, this bodhicitta, etc., is the speech that teaches clear light.

original: dngos po thams cad dang bral ba //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dang bral ba //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Free from all things, etc.

original: dngos po thams cad ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ste gsum mo //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ste gsum mo //
translated: All things are threefold: the fundamental consciousness, the defiled mind consciousness, and the operative consciousnesses.🔽They are also fivefold: ignorance, means, wisdom, female, and male.

original: de rnams kyang ma rig pa dang / thabs dang / shes rab dang / bud med dang / skyas pa dang / ma ning dang / dus mtshams dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang / snang ba dang / snang ba mched pa dang /
analyzed: de rnams kyang ma rig pa dang / thabs dang / shes rab dang / bud med dang / skyas pa dang / ma ning dang / dus mtshams dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang / snang ba dang / snang ba mched pa dang /
translated: They are also sevenfold: neuter, season, night, day, light, increase of light,

original: snang ba nye bar 'thob pa dang / g-yon dang / g-yas dang / dbus dang / 'jam pa dang / rno ba dang / bar pa dang / padma dang / rdo rje dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs dang /
analyzed: snang ba nye bar 'thob pa dang / g-yon dang / g-yas dang / dbus dang / 'jam pa dang / rno ba dang / bar pa dang / padma dang / rdo rje dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs dang /
translated: and near attainment of light. They are also ninefold: left, right, middle, soft, sharp, intermediate, lotus, vajra, moon, sun, and the nature of the void of both anusvāra and visarga.

original: tsheg drag dang gnyi ga'i stong pa'i rang bzhin te de rnams dang bral ba ni thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: tsheg drag dang gnyi ga'i stong pa'i rang bzhin te de rnams dang bral ba ni thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: The void of all of them is the void of everything.

original: gzhan yang lus ngag yid la gnas pas na dngos po ni yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: gzhan yang lus ngag yid la gnas pas na dngos po ni yi ge gsum mo //
translated: Moreover, since it abides in body, speech, and mind, the thing is the three syllables.

original: de rnams dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Those are not entities.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs dang / lha la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis de kho na nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs dang / lha la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis de kho na nyid ma yin te /
translated: They are not reality, which is the nature of color, shape, deity, and so forth,

original: bzlas pa ni brtag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa ni brtag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because repetition is the nature of investigation.

original: yang na dngos po ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de yang sgra mtha'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin /
analyzed: yang na dngos po ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de yang sgra mtha'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin /
translated: Alternatively, an entity has the characteristic of engagement and so forth, and that is not reality, because it is impermanent and has the nature of the final sound.

original: ji ltar dngos grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos grub ce na /
translated: How is there spiritual attainment?

original: bsgom pa dag ni mi chags so //
analyzed: bsgom pa dag ni mi chags so //
translated: The yogī is not attached to meditation.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: phung po dang khams dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnams ni shes pa dang shes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnams ni shes pa dang shes bya ste /
translated: The aggregates, constituents, and subject-object [dichotomy] are consciousness and objects of consciousness.

original: de rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa rang bzhin brgya drug cu dag spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa rang bzhin brgya drug cu dag spangs pa'o //
translated: The cause of those is the abandonment of the one hundred and sixty natures.

original: 'dir yang @47a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang @47a * //
translated: Here,

original: rim pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: rim pa 'di yin te /
translated: this is the process.

original: sems rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dngos po bzhi yin te /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dngos po bzhi yin te /
translated: There are four entities for the sake of purifying the mind.

original: snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang / snang ba nye bar thob pa dang / 'od gsal ba ste gsum ni spang bya yin la /
analyzed: snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang / snang ba nye bar thob pa dang / 'od gsal ba ste gsum ni spang bya yin la /
translated: The three, namely, light, increase of light, and culmination of light, are to be abandoned.

original: bzhi pa ni blang bya ste 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni blang bya ste 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The fourth is to be adopted, and is the result.

original: de rnams la yang chung ba la sogs pa dbye ba rnam pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: de rnams la yang chung ba la sogs pa dbye ba rnam pa bzhi yin te /
translated: Moreover, each of these is divided into four, small, etc.

original: re zhig snang ba ni snang ba chung ba dang / snang ba 'bring dang snang ba chen po dang / snang ba chen po'i chen po'o //
analyzed: re zhig snang ba ni snang ba chung ba dang / snang ba 'bring dang snang ba chen po dang / snang ba chen po'i chen po'o //
translated: Light is small light, middling light, great light, and greater than great light.🔽Similarly, increase of light is small, middling, great, and greater than great.🔽In the same way, small light is small of the small, middling of the small, great of the small, and greater than great of the small.

original: de bzhin du snang ba mched pa chung ba nas 'od gsal ba chen po'i chen po'i bar du skad cig ma bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du snang ba mched pa chung ba nas 'od gsal ba chen po'i chen po'i bar du skad cig ma bcu drug yin no //
translated: Similarly, up to the great of the great, there are sixteen moments.

original: de bzhin du snang ba chung du'i chung ba dang / snang ba chung du'i 'bring dang / snang ba chung du'i chen po dang / snang ba chen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snang ba chung du'i chung ba dang / snang ba chung du'i 'bring dang / snang ba chung du'i chen po dang / snang ba chen po'o //
translated: Similarly, small of the small, middling of the small, great of the small, and small of the middling.

original: de ltar 'bring la sogs pa nas 'od gsal ba'i bar du skad cig ma drug cu rtsa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'bring la sogs pa nas 'od gsal ba'i bar du skad cig ma drug cu rtsa bzhi ste /
translated: Thus, there are sixty-four moments, up to the great of the great of the light of the light.

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dbye bas skad cig ma brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dbye bas skad cig ma brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the division of day and night, there are 128 moments.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin brgya drug cu yang chung ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas nyin mo dang mtshan mor bsgres na lnga stong brgya nyi shu yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin brgya drug cu yang chung ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas nyin mo dang mtshan mor bsgres na lnga stong brgya nyi shu yin no //
translated: The 160 natures of freedom from passion, etc., are 5,120 by the division of small, etc., by day and night.

original: snang ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de rnams 'od gsal ba mngon du byas pas skad cig ma bcu drug pas rnam par dag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de rnams 'od gsal ba mngon du byas pas skad cig ma bcu drug pas rnam par dag par bya ba yin te /
translated: Those natures of appearance, etc., are purified by the sixteenth moment, through the manifestation of clear light.

original: de la rim pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rim pa 'di yin te /
translated: The process is as follows:

original: dang po shes rab kyi ye shes ni zla ba'i 'od zer lta bu shar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dang po shes rab kyi ye shes ni zla ba'i 'od zer lta bu shar par 'gyur te /
translated: First, the wisdom of wisdom arises like the light of the moon.

original: de la dang po sprin gyis bkab pa'i zla ba'i 'od zer lta bu mthong ba dang / gnyis pa sprin med pa'i mi gsal ba'i 'od zer lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la dang po sprin gyis bkab pa'i zla ba'i 'od zer lta bu mthong ba dang / gnyis pa sprin med pa'i mi gsal ba'i 'od zer lta bu'o //
translated: First, it is seen like the light of the moon covered by clouds; second, it is like the light of the moon without clouds but not clear;

original: gsum pa shin tu gsal ba'i zla ba'i 'od zer lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa shin tu gsal ba'i zla ba'i 'od zer lta bu'o //
translated: third, it is like the light of the moon very clear.

original: bzhi pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu ste /
translated: The fourth is like the orb of the moon.

original: snang ba'i ye shes shar ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i ye shes shar ba'o //
translated: The pristine wisdom of appearance has dawned.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa ni thabs kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa ni thabs kyi ye shes te /
translated: Similarly, the second is the pristine wisdom of the method,

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer lta bu shar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer lta bu shar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: which arises like the light rays of the sun.

original: de la dang po sgra gcan gyis 'dzin pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer lta bu mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang po sgra gcan gyis 'dzin pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer lta bu mthong ba'o //
