translated: In that regard, the first is seeing the light rays of the sun held by Rāhu.

original: gnyis pa ni sgra gcan gyis grol ba'i nyi ma'i 'od zer lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sgra gcan gyis grol ba'i nyi ma'i 'od zer lta bu'o //
translated: The second is the light rays of the sun freed from Rāhu.

original: gsum pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i nyi ma'i 'od zer lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i nyi ma'i 'od zer lta bu'o //
translated: The third is like the light rays of the very clear sun.

original: bzhi pa ni shar ba'i dus su nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni shar ba'i dus su nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lta bu'o //
translated: The fourth is like the orb of the sun at the time of rising.

original: snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes ni dang po zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis 'dres pa cung zad mtshams kyi snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes ni dang po zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis 'dres pa cung zad mtshams kyi snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: The pristine wisdom of the attainment of appearance is like the appearance of the horizon when the light rays of the moon and sun mix a little.

original: de dag med pa mtshams kyi snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dag med pa mtshams kyi snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: The pristine wisdom of the nonappearance of that is like the appearance of the horizon without those.

original: gsum pa ni shin @47b tu mun pa mi gsal ba mtshams kyi snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni shin @47b tu mun pa mi gsal ba mtshams kyi snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: The third is like the appearance of the horizon of very dark obscurity.

original: bzhi pa ni mun pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa mtshams kyi snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mun pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa mtshams kyi snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: The fourth is like the light in the space between the directions, which is only without darkness.

original: de bzhin du 'od gsal ba'i ye shes la yang dang po smig rgyu lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od gsal ba'i ye shes la yang dang po smig rgyu lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, in the clear light of pristine consciousness, the first is like a mirage.

original: gnyis pa du ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa du ba lta bu'o //
translated: The second is like smoke.

original: gsum pa srin bu me khyer lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa srin bu me khyer lta bu'o //
translated: The third is like a firefly.

original: bzhi pa ni mar me 'bar ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mar me 'bar ba lta bu'o //
translated: The fourth is like a blazing lamp.🔽Those four moments are the clear result, which is like a cloudless sky, and the arising of the clear light of reality, which is the nature of clarity and joy, that occurs immediately after the sixteen moments have passed.

original: skad cig ma bzhi po de dag gis sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba 'bras bur gyur pa gsal ba dang / dga' ba'i rang bzhin skad cig ma bcu drug 'das ma thag tu byung ba 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid 'char ba gang yin pa de ni sems rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma bzhi po de dag gis sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba 'bras bur gyur pa gsal ba dang / dga' ba'i rang bzhin skad cig ma bcu drug 'das ma thag tu byung ba 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid 'char ba gang yin pa de ni sems rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: That is the pure mind.

original: de nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin rnal 'byor pa la gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin rnal 'byor pa la gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That itself is the pristine consciousness of the dharmadhātu, the perfection of wisdom, which will manifest to the yogin.

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i bdag nyid sngar bshad pas na /
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i bdag nyid sngar bshad pas na /
translated: Since the nature of mantra and mudra has been explained previously,

original: 'dir ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ma bstan pa'o //
translated: it is not explained here.

original: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po dang de'i thabs de gsum gyi dbye bas gso ba'i rig pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po dang de'i thabs de gsum gyi dbye bas gso ba'i rig pa lta bu'o //
translated: The science of healing, for example, is divided into three parts: the disease, which is the discordant factor; the medicine, which is the remedy; and the physician, etc., which is the means.

original: sems rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: The mind is purified by the three:

original: de la yang nad ni mi mthun pa dang / sman ni gnyen po dang / sman pa la sogs pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: de la yang nad ni mi mthun pa dang / sman ni gnyen po dang / sman pa la sogs pa ni thabs so //
translated: the disease is the discordant factor, the medicine is the remedy, and the physician, etc., are the means.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa gsum ni mi mthun pa dang // 'od gsal ba dang gnyen po dang / sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa gsum ni mi mthun pa dang // 'od gsal ba dang gnyen po dang / sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pa ni thabs so //
translated: Similarly, the three consciousnesses are the discordant factor, the clear light is the remedy, and the stages of mantra and seal are the means.

original: de bzhin du 'du gyed sems pa dang ldan pa dang / 'du byed lnga bcu rtsa gcig gi re re'i rigs brgya'i dbye bas lnga stong dang brgya phrag gcig dang nyi shur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du gyed sems pa dang ldan pa dang / 'du byed lnga bcu rtsa gcig gi re re'i rigs brgya'i dbye bas lnga stong dang brgya phrag gcig dang nyi shur 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, the mind endowed with the volition of effort and the one hundred divisions of each of the fifty-one mental factors become five thousand, one hundred and twenty.

original: de bas na phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin rnams spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin rnams spangs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and the apprehended and apprehender is abandoned.

original: de bzhin chos ni sngar bshad pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin chos ni sngar bshad pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the phenomena are the previously explained natures.

original: bdag med ni ngo bo med pa gang zag la sogs pa bdag med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med ni ngo bo med pa gang zag la sogs pa bdag med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Non-self is the absence of essence, which is the selflessness of the person, etc.

original: des mnyam pa nyid ni rang bzhin re re mtshungs pa'i rgyus rang sems ni rnam par shes pa gsum gyi ngo bo gzod nas ma skyes pa ni thog ma nyid du rang bzhin med pa de bas na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: des mnyam pa nyid ni rang bzhin re re mtshungs pa'i rgyus rang sems ni rnam par shes pa gsum gyi ngo bo gzod nas ma skyes pa ni thog ma nyid du rang bzhin med pa de bas na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni
translated: By that, the sameness is the cause of the equivalence of each nature. One’s mind, the nature of the three consciousnesses, is originally unborn, primordially essenceless. Therefore, it is the nature of emptiness.

original: thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: This means that the nature of everything is emptiness.🔽This is the stage of the purification of mind.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum dang de la gnas pa'i rang bzhin rnams 'joms par mdzad pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum dang de la gnas pa'i rang bzhin rnams 'joms par mdzad pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Blessed One is the one who destroys the three consciousnesses and their abiding natures.

original: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad ni rtags lnga @48a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad ni rtags lnga @48a * //
translated: Similarly, Vairocana is the five signs.

original: ste / de rnams 'das ma thag tu rdo rje ni 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: ste / de rnams 'das ma thag tu rdo rje ni 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: Immediately after those, the vajra is luminosity.

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'bras bu ster ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'bras bu ster ba'i phyir /
translated: That itself is the fruit of the Tathāgata, because it bestows it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ste sa bcu la rab tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ste sa bcu la rab tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is a Tathagata, i.e., well-established on the ten stages.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: las dang po yi rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: las dang po yi rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: The beginner yogi

original: se ni brgyad pa thob 'gyur te ;
analyzed: se ni brgyad pa thob 'gyur te ;
translated: attains the eighth stage,

original: / snang ba gsum ni mthong bas na //🔽bcu pa la ni legs gnas so //
analyzed: / snang ba gsum ni mthong bas na // bcu pa la ni legs gnas so //
translated: and, by seeing the three appearances,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is well-established on the tenth stage.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: rdo rje mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bskyod par mi 'gyur bas na mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bskyod par mi 'gyur bas na mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: Vajra-Akshobhya is called that because he is not moved by the illusion-like samadhi.

original: de nyid mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That itself is a vajra because it is indivisible, and he who has it is called that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i mi zad pa ni sems can gyi mi 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba phyogs bcu la gnas pa'i mi zad pa ni sems can gyi mi 'jig pa ste /
translated: All Tathagatas are past, future, and present, and the inexhaustible ones in the ten directions are the imperishable sentient beings.

original: de'i don du rdo rje ni sgyu ma'i ngo bo ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: de'i don du rdo rje ni sgyu ma'i ngo bo ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: For their sake, the vajra is the illusion-like essence of samadhi.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs te snga ma bzhin du byang chub kyi sems gsungs pa ni brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs te snga ma bzhin du byang chub kyi sems gsungs pa ni brjod pa ste /
translated: Having entered into meditative equipoise on that, the bodhisattva mind is expressed as before.

original: dngos po 'di rnams ma skyes par //
analyzed: dngos po 'di rnams ma skyes par //
translated: These things are unarisen,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: dngos po 'di rnams ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched de rang bzhin gyis dang po kho na ma skyes pa ni skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po 'di rnams ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched de rang bzhin gyis dang po kho na ma skyes pa ni skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: These things are the aggregates, constituents, and sources. They are primordially unarisen, not arisen,

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi sprul pa'i grong khyer bzhin du byis pa rnams la so sor snang ba ste ;
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi sprul pa'i grong khyer bzhin du byis pa rnams la so sor snang ba ste ;
translated: like a city manifested by an illusionist that appears individually to fools.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ni rkyen gyi tshogs pa la brten te skyes pa ni ma skyes pa dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ni rkyen gyi tshogs pa la brten te skyes pa ni ma skyes pa dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: That which is arisen in dependence on the assembly of conditions is like that which is unarisen.

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are mutually dependent.

original: rig pa drug cu pa las kyang /
analyzed: rig pa drug cu pa las kyang /
translated: The Yuktisfiashfitikavrftti says:

original: de la brten nas gang skyes pa //
analyzed: de la brten nas gang skyes pa //
translated: That which arises in dependence

original: de ni don dam skyes pa min //🔽gang zhig ngo bos ma skyes pa //
analyzed: de ni don dam skyes pa min // gang zhig ngo bos ma skyes pa //
translated: is not ultimately arisen.🔽How can that which is not arisen by nature

original: de ni skyes pa ji ltar yin //
analyzed: de ni skyes pa ji ltar yin //
translated: be arisen?

original: rgyu ni zad pas shi ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu ni zad pas shi ba ni /
translated: Death is the exhaustion of the cause.

original: de ni zad pa zhes bstan te //
analyzed: de ni zad pa zhes bstan te //
translated: That is taught to be cessation.

original: gang zhig ngo bos ma zad pa //
analyzed: gang zhig ngo bos ma zad pa //
translated: If something is not essentially ceased,

original: de ni zad pa ji ltar bshad //
analyzed: de ni zad pa ji ltar bshad //
translated: how could it be said to cease?

original: des na gang yang skyes pa min //
analyzed: des na gang yang skyes pa min //
translated: Therefore, nothing is produced,

original: gang yang 'gag pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gang yang 'gag pa ma yin te //
translated: and nothing ceases.

original: skye dang zad pa'i lam dag ni //
analyzed: skye dang zad pa'i lam dag ni //
translated: The paths of production and cessation

original: dgos pa'i don du bstan pa yin //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgos pa'i don du bstan pa yin // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: are taught for the sake of a purpose.

original: rje btsun rin chen sgron ma las kyang /
analyzed: rje btsun rin chen sgron ma las kyang /
translated: The venerable Ratnāvalī also says:

original: ji ltar chu shing rul pa'i sdong po las //
analyzed: ji ltar chu shing rul pa'i sdong po las //
translated: Just as when the trunk of a plantain tree is stripped

original: snying po 'dod nas skyes phu de gshegs te //
analyzed: snying po 'dod nas skyes phu de gshegs te //
translated: and searched for its core,

original: phyi dang nang med snying po yod mi snang //
analyzed: phyi dang nang med snying po yod mi snang //
translated: there is no core inside or outside,

original: de ltar chos rnams thams cad shes par gyis //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams thams cad shes par gyis // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: so you should understand all phenomena.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And:

original: dngos las dngos po skyes pa min //
analyzed: dngos las dngos po skyes pa min //
translated: Things are not produced from things.

original: dngos min las @48b kyang skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos min las @48b kyang skye mi 'gyur //
translated: They are not produced from nonthings.

original: rtag tu dngos po dngos 'khrul bas //
analyzed: rtag tu dngos po dngos 'khrul bas //
translated: Things are always confused about things.

original: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du skye //🔽bdag las ma skyes gzhan las min //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du skye // bdag las ma skyes gzhan las min //
translated: They are produced like sky flowers.🔽Not produced from itself, not from another,

original: gnyig las med rgyu med min //
analyzed: gnyig las med rgyu med min //
translated: not from both, not without cause.

original: dngos po gang dang gang du yang //
analyzed: dngos po gang dang gang du yang //
translated: It is never tenable that anything

original: skye ba nam yang 'thad pa min //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba nam yang 'thad pa min // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is produced from anything whatsoever.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po thams cad dang po nas ma skyes pa de bas na chos ni me la sogs pas sreg ba dang / gcod pa la sogs pa bzhin du mig la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i bya ba med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po thams cad dang po nas ma skyes pa de bas na chos ni me la sogs pas sreg ba dang / gcod pa la sogs pa bzhin du mig la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i bya ba med do //
translated: Therefore, since all things are originally non-arisen, there is no activity of apprehending form, etc. by the eye, etc., just as there is no burning, etc. by fire, etc.

original: chos nyid med pa zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams chos can te /
analyzed: chos nyid med pa zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams chos can te /
translated: The phrase “the non-existence of dharmas” means that the faculties such as the eye are the subject.

original: de rnams kyang med pa ni gnyis po de dag phan tshun ltos pas ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang med pa ni gnyis po de dag phan tshun ltos pas ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are non-existent because those two are not established by mutual dependence.

original: chos can yod pas chos rnams kyi //
analyzed: chos can yod pas chos rnams kyi //
translated: Since the subject exists,

original: 'jig rten la ni bsam pa zhugs //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten la ni bsam pa zhugs // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the world engages in reflection on dharmas.

original: yang na snga ma bzhin du phung po la sogs pa med pas na chos ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na snga ma bzhin du phung po la sogs pa med pas na chos ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yang med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, or else, as before, since the aggregates, etc. do not exist, dharmas also do not exist, which have the characteristics of permanence, etc.

original: chos nyid med pa zhes pa ni gzhan rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa bdag la sogs pas brdar byas pa'i chos can yang med pa ste tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid med pa zhes pa ni gzhan rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa bdag la sogs pas brdar byas pa'i chos can yang med pa ste tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “no reality” means that the phenomena that are imputed by others, such as the self, do not exist because there is no valid cognition that establishes them.

original: 'o na phung po kho na bdag yin zhes mngon sum gyi tshad mas sbed pa mi nus pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na phung po kho na bdag yin zhes mngon sum gyi tshad mas sbed pa mi nus pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it the case that the aggregates themselves are the self, and this is not concealed by valid knowledge?

original: de la lan smras pa /
analyzed: de la lan smras pa /
translated: The response to that is as follows.

original: re zhig gzhan ma rnams kyis bdag ni rtag pa dang / thams cad byed pa dang / khyab bdag dang / dbang phyug tu khas blangs te /
analyzed: re zhig gzhan ma rnams kyis bdag ni rtag pa dang / thams cad byed pa dang / khyab bdag dang / dbang phyug tu khas blangs te /
translated: First, others assert that the self is permanent, the creator of all, the all-pervading lord, and Īśvara.

original: phung po rnams ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang gnas pa'i rim pa mthong bas mi brtan pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang gnas pa'i rim pa mthong bas mi brtan pa'o //
translated: But the aggregates are seen to arise, disintegrate, and endure, so they are not stable.

original: de'i phyir gal te phung po rnams kho na bdag tu khas blangs na de'i tshe bdag kyang mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽phung po rnams mi rtag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te phung po rnams kho na bdag tu khas blangs na de'i tshe bdag kyang mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro // phung po rnams mi rtag pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, if the aggregates themselves are asserted to be the self, then it follows that the self is impermanent.

original: bdag ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The aggregates are impermanent, but the self is not.

original: 'o na ji ltar de dag gi de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de dag gi de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yin te /
translated: How then is there a relation of identity between them?

original: de yod pas na tha mi dad pa'i tshul gyis mthun pa'i chos nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de yod pas na tha mi dad pa'i tshul gyis mthun pa'i chos nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: Because of the existence of the latter, there is the existence of a compatible reality in the manner of non-difference.

original: 'o na yang de'i bdag nyid kyang dngos po gnyis la gzhan las ldog pas byas pa khyad par yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na yang de'i bdag nyid kyang dngos po gnyis la gzhan las ldog pas byas pa khyad par yod pa ste /
translated: But the identity is also made by the exclusion of the other in the two things.

original: dper na shing dang sha pa dag la shing ma yin pa dang sha ba ma yin pas byas pa ste /
analyzed: dper na shing dang sha pa dag la shing ma yin pa dang sha ba ma yin pas byas pa ste /
translated: For example, in the case of a tree and a śiṃśapā, the identity is made by the exclusion of non-tree and non-śiṃśapā.🔽In the same way, in the case of the aggregates and the self, the identity is made by the exclusion of permanence and impermanence.

original: de bzhin du phung po dang bdag la'ang rtag pa dang mi rtag par byas par 'gyur ro zhe na de skad ma zer cig / ldog pa zhes bya ba ni med par bkag pa yin gyi /🔽ma yin par bkag pa @49a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po dang bdag la'ang rtag pa dang mi rtag par byas par 'gyur ro zhe na de skad ma zer cig / ldog pa zhes bya ba ni med par bkag pa yin gyi / ma yin par bkag pa @49a * //
translated: Don’t say that! Exclusion is a negation of non-existence.

original: ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a negation of non-existence.

original: med par bkag pa ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: med par bkag pa ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: A negation of non-existence is a characteristic of non-existence, devoid of all capacity.

original: des ni dngos po yang dag par reg par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: des ni dngos po yang dag par reg par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: By that, one cannot touch a real thing.

original: 'ba' zhig rnam par rtog pa'i blos //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig rnam par rtog pa'i blos //
translated: Only the conceptual mind

original: ldog pa tsam du rnam par phye zhing dngos po tha mi dad pa la tha dad par sgro btags te /
analyzed: ldog pa tsam du rnam par phye zhing dngos po tha mi dad pa la tha dad par sgro btags te /
translated: In terms of mere reversal, they are distinguished, but in terms of undifferentiated entities, they are superimposed as different.

original: gzhan yid ches pa'i slad du chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad bya'i /
analyzed: gzhan yid ches pa'i slad du chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad bya'i /
translated: For the sake of convincing others, the terms of the subject and the predicate are used.

original: dngos po la dbye ba gang yang med de /
analyzed: dngos po la dbye ba gang yang med de /
translated: But there is no division whatsoever in entities.

original: de ltar yin na tshad mas kyang brtags pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po nges par thob par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na tshad mas kyang brtags pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po nges par thob par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that were the case, since they are also investigated by valid cognition, one would not definitely obtain entities.

original: thob par 'gyur te tshad ma ni brtags pa yin pa'i phyir khyad par du ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: thob par 'gyur te tshad ma ni brtags pa yin pa'i phyir khyad par du ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: One would obtain them, because valid cognition is an investigation, in particular an inference.

original: ji srid tshad ma'i bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i sprul pa yin la /
analyzed: ji srid tshad ma'i bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i sprul pa yin la /
translated: As long as the activity of valid cognition is the emanation of conceptuality,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i skabs su tshad ma dang gzhal bya ldog cing chos dang gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa rtog pa med pa rang gi ngang gis rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la snang ba ste de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i skabs su tshad ma dang gzhal bya ldog cing chos dang gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa rtog pa med pa rang gi ngang gis rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la snang ba ste de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin no //
translated: in the context of nonconceptuality, valid cognition and the object of comprehension cease, and the ultimate, which is characterized by the selflessness of phenomena and persons, is nonconceptual, naturally appearing in the continuum of the yogi, like the Tathāgata.

original: ji skad du rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad 'di dag ni blo la gnas pa'i chos dang chos can gyi rigs pa ste gang gi phyir chos dang chos can gyi dbye ba ni blo'i rnam pas byas pa yin gyis don gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad 'di dag ni blo la gnas pa'i chos dang chos can gyi rigs pa ste gang gi phyir chos dang chos can gyi dbye ba ni blo'i rnam pas byas pa yin gyis don gyis ma yin no //
translated: These conventions of the inferential object are the reason of the property and the property-possessor that exist in the mind, because the division of the property and the property-possessor is made by the aspect of the mind, not by the object.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: de dngos ma yin yongs ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de dngos ma yin yongs ldog pa'o //
translated: it is not a real thing, but a complete exclusion.

original: dngos po tsam ni rab bsgrubs pas ;
analyzed: dngos po tsam ni rab bsgrubs pas ;
translated: By establishing mere thing,

original: / rtags ni spyi yul ma yin dang // tha dad la ni mi gnas bshad //
analyzed: / rtags ni spyi yul ma yin dang // tha dad la ni mi gnas bshad //
translated: the reason is said to be not an object of the universal, and not to abide in the different.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated.

original: de bas na gzhan ldog pa ni dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan ldog pa ni dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the exclusion of other is not a real thing.

original: dngos po ni tha mi dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni tha mi dad pa kho na'o //
translated: A thing is only non-different.

original: de bas na phung po dang bdag ni tha mi dad pa yin pas mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na phung po dang bdag ni tha mi dad pa yin pas mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the aggregates and the self are not different, it follows that they are impermanent.

original: gal te de lta bu'i skyon du ma gyur cig ces bya bar bdag nyid gzhi la phung po yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta bu'i skyon du ma gyur cig ces bya bar bdag nyid gzhi la phung po yod do zhe na /
translated: If one says, Let us not have such a fault, and that the aggregates exist in the basis of the self,

original: de yang mi rigs te gang gi phyir bdag ces bya ba tshad mas 'grub pa mi dmigs te phung po bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te gang gi phyir bdag ces bya ba tshad mas 'grub pa mi dmigs te phung po bzhin no //
translated: That also is not reasonable, because the so-called self is not perceived to be established by a validating cognition, like the aggregates.

original: yod na yang gzhi rtag pa la gzhi can mi rtag pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: yod na yang gzhi rtag pa la gzhi can mi rtag pa mi rigs te /
translated: And even if it existed, it is not reasonable that the impermanent bases be in a permanent ground,

original: nam mkha' dang bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang bum pa bzhin no //
translated: like space and a pot.

original: gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dag la gzhi dang gzhi can gyi ngo bo mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dag la gzhi dang gzhi can gyi ngo bo mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of ground and that which is based on the ground is not tenable in the case of that which has form and that which does not have form.

original: de yod na yang de rnams la gzhi ni phan 'dogs pa yin nam /🔽de las gzhan yin /
analyzed: de yod na yang de rnams la gzhi ni phan 'dogs pa yin nam / de las gzhan yin /
translated: And even if it existed, is that ground helpful to them or not?🔽If it is helpful, by what nature is it helpful?

original: phan 'dogs pa ma yin pa gzhi dang gzhi can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa ma yin pa gzhi dang gzhi can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not helpful, there is no ground and that which is based on the ground.

original: gzhan du na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: phan @49b 'dogs pa yin na ngo bo gang gis phan 'dogs /
analyzed: phan @49b 'dogs pa yin na ngo bo gang gis phan 'dogs /
translated: If it is helpful, by what nature is it helpful?

original: lhung ba bzlog pa bzhin du rgya shug dang lhung bzed bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: lhung ba bzlog pa bzhin du rgya shug dang lhung bzed bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Like a bowl and a myrobalan fruit, in order to prevent falling.

original: de ltar yin na rgya shug lhung ba rnams kyis mi lhung ba'i chos gzhan bskyed pas lhung bzed ni rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na rgya shug lhung ba rnams kyis mi lhung ba'i chos gzhan bskyed pas lhung bzed ni rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, the bowl is the cause of the fruit because the falling fruits generate another fruit that does not fall.

original: de bas na gang zhig 'di gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gang zhig 'di gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the relation of basis and based is the nature of cause and effect.

original: de bas na rgyu ni gzhi yin la rgyu can ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu ni gzhi yin la rgyu can ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Thus, the cause is the basis and the effect is that which has the cause.

original: 'bras bu skyes na rgyu ni 'jigs pas bdag ni mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes na rgyu ni 'jigs pas bdag ni mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: When the effect arises, the cause is destroyed, so the self is impermanent.

original: gzhi ni gzhi can mngon du phan 'dogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhi ni gzhi can mngon du phan 'dogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The basis does not directly benefit the based,

original: 'on kyang nus pa'i khyad par gyis so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang nus pa'i khyad par gyis so zhe na /
translated: but rather through the special capacity.

original: de'i tshe na nus pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe na nus pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: In that case, the capacity is indeed the benefactor,

original: bdag gis ci bya /
analyzed: bdag gis ci bya /
translated: but what does the self do?

original: yang na bdag kho na phan 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na bdag kho na phan 'dogs pa ste /
translated: Or rather, the self alone is the benefactor,

original: nus pas ci bya /
analyzed: nus pas ci bya /
translated: but what does the capacity do?

original: yang na nus pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: yang na nus pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Or rather, the capacity is indeed the benefactor,

original: de ni bdag la tha dad pa yin nam tha mi dad pa yin /
analyzed: de ni bdag la tha dad pa yin nam tha mi dad pa yin /
translated: but is it different from the self or not different?

original: tha dad pa yin na bdag gi nus pa zhes ci'i phyir brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na bdag gi nus pa zhes ci'i phyir brjod pa'o //
translated: If they are different, why is it called the power of the self?

original: tha mi dad pa yin na bdag kho na phan 'dogs pa ste nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yin na bdag kho na phan 'dogs pa ste nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If they are not different, the self itself is the benefactor, not the power.

original: tha dad pa'i nus pa ni bdag gi 'brel bas bya ba byed do zhe na /🔽bdag gi zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ni de'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i nus pa ni bdag gi 'brel bas bya ba byed do zhe na / bdag gi zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ni de'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: If the power is different, it functions through the relation of the self.🔽The relation of the self is either the relation of identity or the relation of origination.

original: de las byung ba'i 'brel pa dag las gang yin /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'brel pa dag las gang yin /
translated: Which is it?

original: de'i bdag nyid yin na snga ma bzhin du tha mi dad pas tha dad pa'i 'brel pa drug pa rigs so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin na snga ma bzhin du tha mi dad pas tha dad pa'i 'brel pa drug pa rigs so //
translated: If it is the relation of identity, then, as before, they are not different, so it is reasonable that the relation is one.

original: gal te de las byung ba yin na bdag rgyu yin pas nus pa 'bras bu 'byung zhing 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de las byung ba yin na bdag rgyu yin pas nus pa 'bras bu 'byung zhing 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is the relation of origination, then the self is the cause, because the power arises and perishes as the effect.

original: yang na 'di ltar smra ba yin na /
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar smra ba yin na /
translated: Or, if you say this,

original: 'dir ni gnas skabs gnyis yin te //
analyzed: 'dir ni gnas skabs gnyis yin te //
translated: Here there are two states:

original: 'bras bu dang ni byed bdag /'bras bu nyid ni zad 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ni byed bdag /'bras bu nyid ni zad 'gyur te //
translated: The effect and the self as agent. The effect itself perishes,

original: byed pa nyid ni mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa nyid ni mi zad pa'o //
translated: but the agent itself does not perish.

original: 'dir ni dpe 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni dpe 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the example:

original: dug gi shing ni /
analyzed: dug gi shing ni /
translated: The poison tree

original: yal ga dang ni myu gu dang / lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu rnams rim gyis zad na dug gi shing ni mi 'jig pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yal ga dang ni myu gu dang / lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu rnams rim gyis zad na dug gi shing ni mi 'jig pa kho na'o //
translated: The branches, sprouts, leaves, flowers, and fruits are gradually exhausted, but the poison tree does not perish.

original: 'dir ni lan 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni lan 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the answer:

original: rags pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis ye shes kyi mig bsgribs pa'i byis pa rnams kyis rgyun mi 'jig go zhes so sor snang ste /
analyzed: rags pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis ye shes kyi mig bsgribs pa'i byis pa rnams kyis rgyun mi 'jig go zhes so sor snang ste /
translated: The childish, whose eye of knowledge is obscured by the latent impressions of attachment to the gross, perceive the continuum as not perishing.

original: don dam pas ni 'jig pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: don dam pas ni 'jig pa kho na yin no //
translated: But in reality, it does perish.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu skyes pa'i dus su rgyu ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba yang 'bras bu 'jig pa'i dus su ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu skyes pa'i dus su rgyu ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba yang 'bras bu 'jig pa'i dus su ma yin te /
translated: Because at the time the effect arises, it is not like the cause,

original: @50a * // bcud dang bcas pa dang bcud med pa nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dang / nus pa dang nus pa mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @50a * // bcud dang bcas pa dang bcud med pa nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dang / nus pa dang nus pa mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the difference of being nutritious and non-nutritious, and because of being potent and non-potent.

original: gal te ngo bo gcig pa mi 'jig pa rgyur 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo gcig pa mi 'jig pa rgyur 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the non-perishing of the same nature is the cause,

original: de'i tshe rtag tu 'bras bu skye bar byed pa'am dus gang du mi byed pa ste nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtag tu 'bras bu skye bar byed pa'am dus gang du mi byed pa ste nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: then it would always produce the effect, or it would never produce it, like space.

original: skyed par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / snga ma'i dus nas phyi ma'i dus su khyad par mthong ba'i phyir dang ngo bo gcig nyams pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / snga ma'i dus nas phyi ma'i dus su khyad par mthong ba'i phyir dang ngo bo gcig nyams pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because it is not a producer or not a non-producer, because a difference is seen from the earlier time to the later time, and because the one nature is lost, it is impermanent.

original: 'o na bum pa chag pa'o zhes mngon sum gyis mi rtag pa nyid du mthong ba zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bum pa chag pa'o zhes mngon sum gyis mi rtag pa nyid du mthong ba zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Is not impermanence seen by direct perception, as in ‘The pot is broken’?”

original: de'i tshe byis pa rnams kyis mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe byis pa rnams kyis mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs pa ste /
translated: At that time, the childish understand impermanence.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis thog mar de ni 'jig pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis thog mar de ni 'jig pa kho na yin no //
translated: By nature, it is only destroyed from the beginning.

original: gyo mo'i dus su 'bras bu gzhan byung bas rmongs pa rnams kyis blo ni bum pa 'jig go zhes skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyo mo'i dus su 'bras bu gzhan byung bas rmongs pa rnams kyis blo ni bum pa 'jig go zhes skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of the shards, because another effect arises, the confused mind thinks, “The pot is destroyed.”

original: de bas na gzhi dang gzhi can gyi kho bo khas blangs na mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di ni gnas pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzhi dang gzhi can gyi kho bo khas blangs na mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di ni gnas pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the only correct position: If the self is accepted as the basis and the based, it is not established because it is impermanent.

original: phung po rnams la yang dag gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po rnams la yang dag gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The self would not be based on the aggregates,

original: snga ma bzhin du gzhi dang gzhi can gyi ngo bo mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du gzhi dang gzhi can gyi ngo bo mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, as before, it is not possible for the basis and the one based on it to be identical.

original: phung po rnams kyang gzhi yin pas rgyu yin la rgyu ni 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir bdag mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyang gzhi yin pas rgyu yin la rgyu ni 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir bdag mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aggregates are the basis, the cause, and the cause must be consistent with the effect, because the self would be impermanent.

original: rgyu rnams kyang nges pas 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin pas res 'ga' bdag kyang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyang nges pas 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin pas res 'ga' bdag kyang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause is not always associated with the effect, so the self would not exist at times.

original: bar chad med pa'i dus su res 'ga' yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i dus su res 'ga' yang yod pa yin te /
translated: It would exist at times when there is no obstruction,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i chos dag rtag pa bdag la mi rigs te nam mkha' bzhin du'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i chos dag rtag pa bdag la mi rigs te nam mkha' bzhin du'o //
translated: because it is not possible for a permanent self to be associated with existent or nonexistent things, like space.

original: lhung bzed 'di la rgya shug gi 'bras bu bzhin du ldan pa'i 'brel pa yin na skyon te thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed 'di la rgya shug gi 'bras bu bzhin du ldan pa'i 'brel pa yin na skyon te thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self were related to the aggregates by the relation of possession, as Devadatta is to cows, then the error would follow that the self would be many, like the aggregates.

original: rgyu spun 'di rnams la snam bu 'di zhes bya ba bzhin du 'du ba'i 'brel pa yong na skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu spun 'di rnams la snam bu 'di zhes bya ba bzhin du 'du ba'i 'brel pa yong na skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If there is a relation of inherence in these causes and parts, there is no fault.

original: 'o na 'du ba zhes bya ba gang yin /
analyzed: 'o na 'du ba zhes bya ba gang yin /
translated: Well then, what is this so-called inherence?

original: cha shad dang cha shas can gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhe na /🔽'o na cha shas 'di rnams kyis cha shas can tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: cha shad dang cha shas can gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhe na / 'o na cha shas 'di rnams kyis cha shas can tha dad pa'am /
translated: It is the characteristic of the relation of the whole and the parts.

original: tha mi dad pa skyes par byed /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa skyes par byed /
translated: Well then, do these parts produce the whole as different or not different?

original: rgyu spun snam bu dag la tha dad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir re zhig tha dad pa ni skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: rgyu spun snam bu dag la tha dad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir re zhig tha dad pa ni skyed par mi byed /
translated: The whole is not produced as different, because the difference of the causes and parts from the cloth is not observed.

original: rgyu spun dang snam bu dag la tha dad pa yin na rgyu spun kho na cha shas @50b dmigs te cha can snyam bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu spun dang snam bu dag la tha dad pa yin na rgyu spun kho na cha shas @50b dmigs te cha can snyam bu ni ma yin no //
translated: If the causes and parts were different from the cloth, only the causes and parts would be observed, not the whole cloth.

original: g-yogs pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pas snam bu ni yod pa kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: g-yogs pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pas snam bu ni yod pa kho na yin zhe na /
translated: But the cloth exists because it performs the action of being wrapped and so on.

original: 'o na rgyu spun rnams med pas ji lta bu 'du ba'i 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu spun rnams med pas ji lta bu 'du ba'i 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Well then, how can there be a relation of inherence, since the causes and parts do not exist?

original: rgyu spun dang snam bu dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / cha shas dang cha shas can gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rgyu spun dang snam bu dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / cha shas dang cha shas can gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because the cause, the thread, and the cloth are not different, and because there is no such thing as a whole and parts.

original: de bas na rgyu spun kho na phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par gyis de ltar gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs pas byas pa'i tha snyad 'di ni snam bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu spun kho na phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par gyis de ltar gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs pas byas pa'i tha snyad 'di ni snam bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the cloth is the thread itself, which has become different through the perfection of its parts. This is the conventional expression that is made by the understanding.

original: des ni rtsom par byed pa dang tha mi dad par gyur pa ni cha shas yin no zhes pa'i gzhung sel lo //
analyzed: des ni rtsom par byed pa dang tha mi dad par gyur pa ni cha shas yin no zhes pa'i gzhung sel lo //
translated: This refutes the theory that the whole is the parts, which are not different from the one who composes them.

original: de'i phyir phung po rnams ni bdag gi ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po rnams ni bdag gi ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates are not the self.

original: de las tha dad pa bdag kyang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ji ltar dmigs par mi 'gyur bar stobs kyis de la zhen pas rang gi sems slu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa bdag kyang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ji ltar dmigs par mi 'gyur bar stobs kyis de la zhen pas rang gi sems slu bar byed pa'o //
translated: Since a self that is different from them is not perceived, how can it be perceived? By force of attachment to it, one deceives one’s own mind.

original: 'dir ni bum pa med de zhes bya ba'i snang ba mi dmigs pas re zhig bdag med do //
analyzed: 'dir ni bum pa med de zhes bya ba'i snang ba mi dmigs pas re zhig bdag med do //
translated: Here, the nonperception of the appearance of the statement “The pot does not exist” is the nonexistence of the self.

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pas ji ltar bdag med do zhe na /
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pas ji ltar bdag med do zhe na /
translated: How can the nonperception of the nonappearance of the pot be the nonexistence of the self?

original: de ltar ma zer cig tshad ma gnyis las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can de ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ma zer cig tshad ma gnyis las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can de ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin te /
translated: Do not say that, because a reason having a character opposite from the two authorities is a cause of doubt.

original: de nyid kyi phyir des ni de yod pa'i tha snyad mi rigs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir des ni de yod pa'i tha snyad mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not right that it should be a convention for the existence of that.

original: 'o na the tshom las rtog pa dad ldan pa 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na the tshom las rtog pa dad ldan pa 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, then, a person with doubt will engage in the investigation.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: don gyi the tshom dang / don med pa'i the tshom dang gnyi ga'i the tshom mo //
analyzed: don gyi the tshom dang / don med pa'i the tshom dang gnyi ga'i the tshom mo //
translated: Doubt about the object, doubt about the non-object, and doubt about both.

original: de la don gyi the tshom ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin la don med pa'i the tshom dang gnyi ga'i the tshom ni ldog pa'i yan lag yin la /
analyzed: de la don gyi the tshom ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin la don med pa'i the tshom dang gnyi ga'i the tshom ni ldog pa'i yan lag yin la /
translated: Among them, doubt about the object is a limb of engagement, and doubt about the non-object and doubt about both are limbs of disengagement.

original: gter bton pa dang / drag po'i chu bor rgyal ba dang / ro langs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gter bton pa dang / drag po'i chu bor rgyal ba dang / ro langs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the discovery of treasure, the victory in the river of the fierce one, and the zombie.

original: de'i phyir phyi ma'i the tshom dag la brten te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi ma'i the tshom dag la brten te /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the latter two doubts,

original: rtog pa dang ldan pas ldog pa kho na rigs so //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pas ldog pa kho na rigs so //
translated: it is right that a person with doubt should disengage.

original: the tshom las 'jug na yang phyi dus rtog pa sngon du byed pas snang ba mi dmigs pas bdag mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: the tshom las 'jug na yang phyi dus rtog pa sngon du byed pas snang ba mi dmigs pas bdag mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: If one engages in the view of the self through doubt, then later on, one will have the view of the self as a permanent entity.

original: phung po las tha dad pa bdag mi dmigs so //
analyzed: phung po las tha dad pa bdag mi dmigs so //
translated: The self is not perceived as different from the aggregates.

original: me dang bud shing bzhin du bdag dang phung po 'dres pa mi dmigs te /
analyzed: me dang bud shing bzhin du bdag dang phung po 'dres pa mi dmigs te /
translated: The self is not perceived as mixed with the aggregates, like fire and fuel.🔽If one accepts that the self and the aggregates are not different, then the error of the sameness of the self and the aggregates would follow.

original: gang gi phyir 'di me dang bud shing zhes bya ba'i ji ltar tha dad pa med pa de bzhin du bdag dang phung po dag la gal te khas blangs na de'i tshe phung po dang bdag la gzhi mthun pa las 'byung ba'i skyon tha dad par 'gyur te
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di me dang bud shing zhes bya ba'i ji ltar tha dad pa med pa de bzhin du bdag dang phung po dag la gal te khas blangs na de'i tshe phung po dang bdag la gzhi mthun pa las 'byung ba'i skyon tha dad par 'gyur te
translated: If one accepts that the self and the aggregates are not mixed, then the error of their difference would follow.

original: de ni gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the position.

original: da ni rnal ma'i don rjes su 'brang bar bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rnal ma'i don rjes su 'brang bar bya ste /
translated: Now, we will follow the meaning of the original text.

original: de ltar @51a * //
analyzed: de ltar @51a * //
translated: Thus,

original: phung po dang bdag la gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa med pas brag gi rtse mo nyi shu las 'byung ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba zad pas 'ba' zhig pa dri ma med pa'i mtha' yas pa nam mkha' dang 'dra ba 'od gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po dang bdag la gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa med pas brag gi rtse mo nyi shu las 'byung ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba zad pas 'ba' zhig pa dri ma med pa'i mtha' yas pa nam mkha' dang 'dra ba 'od gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no common locus for the aggregates and the self, the sole remaining stainless infinite view of the transitory collection, like space, becomes clear light.

original: ji skad du /🔽phung po bdag min de der min //
analyzed: ji skad du / phung po bdag min de der min //
translated: As it is said:

original: de la de min de med min //
analyzed: de la de min de med min //
translated: The aggregates are not the self, nor does the self possess them,🔽The self does not have the aggregates, nor do the aggregates have a self.

original: me dang bud shing bzhin du ni //
analyzed: me dang bud shing bzhin du ni //
translated: Like fire and fuel,

original: bdag phung 'dres min gang phyir yod //
analyzed: bdag phung 'dres min gang phyir yod //
translated: the self and the aggregates are not mixed, because one exists and the other does not.

original: bdag ces dngos po med pa ste //
analyzed: bdag ces dngos po med pa ste //
translated: The so-called self is a nonentity,

original: byed pa po zhes gang la brjod //
analyzed: byed pa po zhes gang la brjod //
translated: so what is called an agent?

original: chos can yod na chos rnams ni //
analyzed: chos can yod na chos rnams ni //
translated: When there is a phenomenon,

original: 'jig rten pa la smos zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la smos zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the world speaks of attributes.

original: de ltar phyi'i bdag la sogs pa'i phung po'i lta rnams sel bas ji ltar rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi don 'grub ce na /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i bdag la sogs pa'i phung po'i lta rnams sel bas ji ltar rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi don 'grub ce na /
translated: In this way, how do yogins accomplish the welfare of sentient beings by dispelling the views of the transitory collection, such as the external view of the self?

original: nam mkha' lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nam mkha' la gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nam mkha' la gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “like space” and so on means that because they abide in space, the yogins who have attained the state of the great seal of emptiness are like space.

original: nam mkha' ni 'ja' tshon te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni 'ja' tshon te /
translated: Space is a rainbow.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni sgyu ma'i ngo bo lha'i sku 'od gsal ba las cig car du spros pa dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo nyid du dkyil 'khor ba'i nang du gnas pa gzugs brnyan blangs te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni sgyu ma'i ngo bo lha'i sku 'od gsal ba las cig car du spros pa dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo nyid du dkyil 'khor ba'i nang du gnas pa gzugs brnyan blangs te /
translated: Like that, the nature of the illusion is the form of the deity, which is simultaneously emanated from the clear light, and having taken up the reflected image of the principal deity of the mandala, which is located in the center of the mandala,

original: sems can gyi don rnal 'byor pas bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don rnal 'byor pas bya'o //
translated: the yogi should perform the welfare of sentient beings.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bdag med pa zhes pa ni bdag med pa'i tshul sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa zhes pa ni bdag med pa'i tshul sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The way of non-self is illustrated by the twelve examples of illusion.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽The reflected image, the dream, the illusion, the water bubble,

original: me long gi ni gzugs brnyan dang // rmi lam sgyu ma chu bur dang // mig 'phrul dang 'dra gang gis ni //
analyzed: me long gi ni gzugs brnyan dang // rmi lam sgyu ma chu bur dang // mig 'phrul dang 'dra gang gis ni //
translated: the optical illusion, and the echo,🔽the Gandharva city, the magical creation, the lightning, and the cloud,🔽are the twelve examples of illusion.🔽By whom this view is known,

original: lta ba de ni khyab bdag yin //
analyzed: lta ba de ni khyab bdag yin //
translated: that one is the lord of the mandala.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: byang chub tshul 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tshul 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: this method of enlightenment is taught.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid de /
translated: Enlightenment is the reality of the clear light.

original: de las tshul ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis lha'i sku blang ba'o //
analyzed: de las tshul ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis lha'i sku blang ba'o //
translated: The method is the taking of the divine body by means of the illusion-like concentration for the sake of the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: bstan pa ni ma lus pa'i khams gsum gyi sems can smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la mi g-yo bar gyur pa rnal 'byor pa la skye ba yin te /
analyzed: bstan pa ni ma lus pa'i khams gsum gyi sems can smin pa dang grol ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la mi g-yo bar gyur pa rnal 'byor pa la skye ba yin te /
translated: The teaching is the arising in the yogi/nī of the immovability for the sake of the maturation and liberation of all sentient beings of the three realms without exception.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa gsum pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa don rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa gsum pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa don rtogs pa'o //
translated: The third stage of the self-consecration is the realization of the meaning of the Blessed One, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: rin chen ni byang chub kyi sems te de nyid dpal ni mtshan ma rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mor 'dzin pa'i yan lag gis gang gis 'dzin pa de ni rin chen dpal @51b rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rin chen ni byang chub kyi sems te de nyid dpal ni mtshan ma rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mor 'dzin pa'i yan lag gis gang gis 'dzin pa de ni rin chen dpal @51b rdo rje'o //
translated: The jewel is the Thought of Enlightenment, and that itself is the glory, the sign, which is held at the top of the victory banner. He who holds it is the Vajra of Glorious Jewel.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rtsa bdun khri nyis stong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rtsa bdun khri nyis stong ste /
translated: All Ones Gone Thus are the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: de rnams kyi gang zhig chos ni dga' ba la sogs pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gang zhig chos ni dga' ba la sogs pa gsum ste /
translated: Of those, the three dharmas are joy and so on.

original: de rnams kyi bdag med pa'i mngon par byang chub kyi rim pa bzhi pa ste de nyid mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag med pa'i mngon par byang chub kyi rim pa bzhi pa ste de nyid mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje'o //
translated: Of those, the fourth stage is the manifest enlightenment of selflessness. Since that is indivisible, it is a vajra.

original: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: He entered into the meditative concentration called “that,”

original: byang chub kyi sems 'di zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub kyi rim pa ston par byed pa'i tshig gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'di zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub kyi rim pa ston par byed pa'i tshig gsungs so //
translated: and spoke the words that teach the stage of manifest enlightenment, “this bodhicitta.”

original: chos rnams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs la /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs la /
translated: As for “all phenomena” and so on,

original: chos rnams thams cad ni 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags bar ba ste /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ni 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags bar ba ste /
translated: all phenomena are desire, freedom from desire, and neutral.

original: de rnams bskyod pa dang dga' ba dang / dga' bral gyi bdag nyid du brtags pa'i phyir dngos med ces pa ni spang bar bya ba'o zhes ston te /
analyzed: de rnams bskyod pa dang dga' ba dang / dga' bral gyi bdag nyid du brtags pa'i phyir dngos med ces pa ni spang bar bya ba'o zhes ston te /
translated: Since those are imagined to be the nature of movement, joy, and separation from joy, “nonentity” is taught to be what is to be abandoned.

original: chos ni dga' ba gsum gyi de nyid yin la de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par 'joms pa'i skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: chos ni dga' ba gsum gyi de nyid yin la de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par 'joms pa'i skad cig ma ste /
translated: Dharma is the reality of the three joys, and their characteristics are the various aspects, the fully matured, and the momentary destruction.

original: de rnams dang rnam par spang ba ni don dam pas nye bar mtshon pa brtags pa'i phyir med pa'o zhes ston te /
analyzed: de rnams dang rnam par spang ba ni don dam pas nye bar mtshon pa brtags pa'i phyir med pa'o zhes ston te /
translated: The abandonment of those is taught to be “nonexistent” because of being characterized by the ultimate.

original: skad cig ma dang dga' ba dag rgyu dang 'bras bu rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang dga' ba dag rgyu dang 'bras bu rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the moments and the joys are the nature of cause and effect, they are nonexistent.

original: gal te de ltar yin na blang bar bya ba'i de kho na nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na blang bar bya ba'i de kho na nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what is the reality that is to be accepted?

original: bdag med chos las kun du 'byung //
analyzed: bdag med chos las kun du 'byung //
translated: The reality that is to be accepted is the nonself that arises from the phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba la chos ni phung po la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la chos ni phung po la sogs pa'am /
translated: The phenomena are the aggregates and so on,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
translated: or they are desire and so on.

original: de rnams bdag med pa ni bla ma'i man ngag gis snang ba bzhi pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams bdag med pa ni bla ma'i man ngag gis snang ba bzhi pa thob pa ste /
translated: The nonself of those is the attainment of the fourth appearance through the guru’s intimate instruction.

original: de las kun du byung zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / gsal ba gang zhig dpe las byung ba'i bde ba skyes pa de nyid kyi rim pa thams cad kyi 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las kun du byung zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / gsal ba gang zhig dpe las byung ba'i bde ba skyes pa de nyid kyi rim pa thams cad kyi 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir blang bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase arising from that refers to the non-conceptual, clear, bliss that arises from the example, and since it is the result of all the stages, it should be taken.

original: gal te res 'ga'i tshe shin tu phra ba'i phyir sems la brtan par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe byang chub ni ril por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / tshul ni rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin kyis 'di zhes pa ni de kho na nyid bzhi pa brtan pa ste mi g-yo bar bya'o zhes tshig gi don te mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: gal te res 'ga'i tshe shin tu phra ba'i phyir sems la brtan par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe byang chub ni ril por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / tshul ni rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin kyis 'di zhes pa ni de kho na nyid bzhi pa brtan pa ste mi g-yo bar bya'o zhes tshig gi don te mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: If at some time it does not become stable in the mind due to being very subtle, then at that time, by the samādhi of grasping the whole and the samādhi of subsequent destruction, one should make it firm, that is, immovable, in the fourth reality. This is the meaning of the words. This is the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rin chen dpal rdo rje zhes bya ba la snga ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rin chen dpal rdo rje zhes bya ba la snga ma bzhin du'o //
translated: The phrase the Bhagavān and so on refers to the Vajra of Precious Glory as before.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dpag tu med pa ni tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dpag tu med pa ni tshad med pa ste /
translated: The phrase then and so on refers to the immeasurable, that is, the limitless, bliss of the mind.

original: srid pa dang mya ngan @52a * //
analyzed: srid pa dang mya ngan @52a * //
translated: Existence and nirvana🔽

original: las 'das pa dag la mi gnas pa'i phyir tshe ni sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir gnas pa ste /
analyzed: las 'das pa dag la mi gnas pa'i phyir tshe ni sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir gnas pa ste /
translated: Since he does not abide in either cyclic existence or nirvana, his life is abiding in order to accomplish the aims of sentient beings.

original: de nyid rdo rje gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He who has that vajra is so called.

original: chos ni kun rdzob dang / don dam pa dang / 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa la sogs pa ste de rnams 'od zer 'bar ba ni zung 'jug tu bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos ni kun rdzob dang / don dam pa dang / 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa la sogs pa ste de rnams 'od zer 'bar ba ni zung 'jug tu bya ba ste /
translated: Dharma is the conventional, the ultimate, passion, the absence of passion, with aspects, without aspects, and so on. The blazing light rays are the union of those.

original: de nyid gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i mun pa'i tshogs 'jig pas na sgron ma ni sgron me dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i mun pa'i tshogs 'jig pas na sgron ma ni sgron me dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: Since that is the destruction of the mass of darkness of purity, impurity, and so on, the lamp is like a lamp.

original: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid la snyoms par bzhugs te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid la snyoms par bzhugs te /
translated: He is said to be absorbed in equipoise in the samādhi called “that” that has the characteristic of a one-pointed mind.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'di ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin gtso bor gyur pa'i tshig gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'di ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin gtso bor gyur pa'i tshig gsungs so //
translated: This thought of enlightenment is the principal meditative stabilization of non-abiding nirvana.

original: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun rdzob dang don dam pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma skyes pa dang / zung du 'jug pa'i rim gyis dbyer med par gyur na de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa'i ngo bo med pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun rdzob dang don dam pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma skyes pa dang / zung du 'jug pa'i rim gyis dbyer med par gyur na de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa'i ngo bo med pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: As for unborn, etc., the unborn characteristic of the conventional, the ultimate, etc., and the indivisibility by the stage of union, at that time the yogi's non-entity is the realization of the conventional truth, etc.

original: bsgom pa yang med de don dam pa'i bden pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa yang med de don dam pa'i bden pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: And non-meditation is the realization of the ultimate truth, etc.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas pas 'khor ba'i bar du sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bya ba byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas pas 'khor ba'i bar du sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bya ba byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By abiding in the stage of union, until samsara is emptied, he performs the deeds of all the Buddhas. This is the meaning.

original: kun du 'od kyi sa la snga ma'i smon lam gyi shugs kyis rtogs pa med na yang rang gi ngang gis dmigs pa med dang ni thugs rje chen po'i dbang gis mi 'dod pas kyang sems can gyi don byed do zhes mi slob pa'i lam la cung zad
analyzed: kun du 'od kyi sa la snga ma'i smon lam gyi shugs kyis rtogs pa med na yang rang gi ngang gis dmigs pa med dang ni thugs rje chen po'i dbang gis mi 'dod pas kyang sems can gyi don byed do zhes mi slob pa'i lam la cung zad
translated: On the ground of Universal Light, even though there is no realization by the force of former prayers, still, by the power of his own nature and of his great compassion, he acts for the sake of sentient beings, even though he does not desire to.

original: kyang slob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyang slob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not train at all on the path of no more learning.

original: ji skad du rab tu byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: ji skad du rab tu byed pa las kyang /
translated: As the Prajfiiimula says,

original: zung 'jug ting 'dzin la gnas pas //
analyzed: zung 'jug ting 'dzin la gnas pas //
translated: Abiding in the samadhi of union,

original: slar yang cung zad mi slob bo //🔽zhe na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slar yang cung zad mi slob bo // zhe na 'byung ngo //
translated: He does not train in the slightest.

original: de ltar yin na rnal 'byor pa'i spyod pa ji lta bu zhe na /🔽nam mkha'i gnas su sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: de ltar yin na rnal 'byor pa'i spyod pa ji lta bu zhe na / nam mkha'i gnas su sbyor ba yis //
translated: If that is so, what is the yogi's conduct?

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: The text says,🔽The yogi should practice🔽The union in the abode of space.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rnal 'byor pas spyod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rnal 'byor pas spyod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The yogi of the samadhi of no intrinsic reality, the yogi of the wisdom of equality, should practice.

original: rab tu byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las kyang /
translated: As the Prajfiiimula says,

original: ji ltar bdag nyid de bzhin dgra //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid de bzhin dgra //
translated: Just as he is to himself, so is he to his enemy.

original: ji ltar chung ma de bzhin sring //
analyzed: ji ltar chung ma de bzhin sring //
translated: Just as a wife, so a sister.

original: ji ltar smad 'tshong de bzhin ma //
analyzed: ji ltar smad 'tshong de bzhin ma //
translated: Just as a prostitute, so a mother.

original: ji ltar bram ze de bzhin gdol //
analyzed: ji ltar bram ze de bzhin gdol //
translated: Just as a brahmin, so an outcaste.

original: ji ltar pags pa de bzhin gos //
analyzed: ji ltar pags pa de bzhin gos //
translated: Just as skin, so a garment.🔽Just as blood, so poison.

original: ji ltar khrag nyid @52b de bzhin dug / ji ltar chang dang de bzhin gcin //
analyzed: ji ltar khrag nyid @52b de bzhin dug / ji ltar chang dang de bzhin gcin //
translated: Just as beer, so excrement.

original: ji ltar bza' ba de bzhin bshang //
analyzed: ji ltar bza' ba de bzhin bshang //
translated: Just as food, so feces.

original: ji ltar dri bzangs ga bur dag / de bzhin bshang ba las byung dri //
analyzed: ji ltar dri bzangs ga bur dag / de bzhin bshang ba las byung dri //
translated: Just as a good smell, so camphor.

original: ji ltar bstod pa byed pa'i tshig / de bzhin du ni smod pa'i tshig / drag po rdo rje can de bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar bstod pa byed pa'i tshig / de bzhin du ni smod pa'i tshig / drag po rdo rje can de bzhin //
translated: Just as praise, so blame.

original: ji ltar nyin mo de bzhin mtshan //
analyzed: ji ltar nyin mo de bzhin mtshan //
translated: Just as the sun, so the night.

original: ji ltar rmi lam de bzhin mthong //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam de bzhin mthong //
translated: Just as a dream, so what is seen.

original: ji ltar 'jig pa de bzhin gnas //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig pa de bzhin gnas //
translated: Just as destruction, so duration.

original: ji ltar bde ba de bzhin sdug / ji ltar sdang ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar bde ba de bzhin sdug / ji ltar sdang ba de bzhin du //
translated: Just as pleasure, so pain.

original: mnar med mtho ris de bzhin te //
analyzed: mnar med mtho ris de bzhin te //
translated: Just as hell, so heaven.

original: de bzhin sdig dang bsod nams so //
analyzed: de bzhin sdig dang bsod nams so //
translated: Just as sin, so merit.

original: de ltar shes na ye shes can //
analyzed: de ltar shes na ye shes can //
translated: If you know it thus, O wise one,

original: dogs pa med par thams cad byed //
analyzed: dogs pa med par thams cad byed //
translated: do everything without hesitation.

original: sbas pa'i brtul zhugs kun bsgrubs na //
analyzed: sbas pa'i brtul zhugs kun bsgrubs na //
translated: If one accomplishes all the secret observances,

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'grub //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'grub //
translated: one will accomplish all perfections.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa la yang spyod pa'i brtul zhugs ni rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa la yang spyod pa'i brtul zhugs ni rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs te /
translated: Likewise, the observance of conduct for the yoga of the perfection stage is taught in the Vajra Garland:

original: skyes pa'i sa ni yongs spangs nas //
analyzed: skyes pa'i sa ni yongs spangs nas //
translated: Having abandoned the stage of birth,

original: tshogs kyi dbang phyug gzugs byas nas //
analyzed: tshogs kyi dbang phyug gzugs byas nas //
translated: one should assume the form of the lord of the gaṇa,

original: yul ni gzhan la zhugs byas te //
analyzed: yul ni gzhan la zhugs byas te //
translated: and enter into another land,

original: gang du sus kyang ngo mi shes //
analyzed: gang du sus kyang ngo mi shes //
translated: where no one knows him.

original: tshogs kyi rtags ni blangs byas te //
analyzed: tshogs kyi rtags ni blangs byas te //
translated: Having taken up the signs of the gaṇa,

original: mgo bo'i skra ni bregs byas nas //🔽rags pa ral pa gcig byas pa //
analyzed: mgo bo'i skra ni bregs byas nas // rags pa ral pa gcig byas pa //
translated: having shaved the hair on the head,🔽one should have a single coarse lock,

original: gtsug phud gcig cig gzhag par bya //
analyzed: gtsug phud gcig cig gzhag par bya //
translated: and leave a single topknot.

original: 'od spro ba yis khyab pa ni ;
analyzed: 'od spro ba yis khyab pa ni ;
translated: One should be pervaded by the radiance🔽of the supreme armlet and bracelet,

original: / dpung rgyan dang ni gdu bu mchog / ru dr'a ksha dang shel mchog ni //
analyzed: / dpung rgyan dang ni gdu bu mchog / ru dr'a ksha dang shel mchog ni //
translated: the ruddhaka and crystal,

original: phan tshun 'dres par byas pa ste //🔽smad kyi cha la 'chang ba ni //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dres par byas pa ste // smad kyi cha la 'chang ba ni //
translated: mutually mixed.🔽The lower part is the loincloth,

original: ske ba la ni mgul rgyan btags //
analyzed: ske ba la ni mgul rgyan btags //
translated: and the necklace is worn around the neck.

original: 'bad pas thig le gsum byas la //
analyzed: 'bad pas thig le gsum byas la //
translated: Having made effort, one should make three bindus.

original: mdzub mor zangs kyi sor gdub gdags //
analyzed: mdzub mor zangs kyi sor gdub gdags //
translated: One should hang a copper bracelet on the index finger.

original: mdun gyi cha la 'phyang ba ni //🔽sha ma thabs kyang ni gyon par bya //
analyzed: mdun gyi cha la 'phyang ba ni // sha ma thabs kyang ni gyon par bya //
translated: Hanging in front,🔽one should also put on a loincloth.🔽One should hang a pouch with a strap

original: gtsag pu dang bcas za ma tog / mchan khung du ni 'phyang bar btags //
analyzed: gtsag pu dang bcas za ma tog / mchan khung du ni 'phyang bar btags //
translated: on one’s shoulder,🔽and having taken on the form of Gaṇeśa,

original: yan lag thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i //🔽tshogs bdag gzugs ni blangs nas su //🔽tshem bu gyon par byas nas ni //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i // tshogs bdag gzugs ni blangs nas su // tshem bu gyon par byas nas ni //
translated: adorned with all the limbs,🔽one should enter the abode of the low caste,

original: rigs ngan gnas la 'jug par bya //
analyzed: rigs ngan gnas la 'jug par bya //
translated: wearing a patched robe.

original: dngos grub phyir ni de ltar mchog / shin tu sbas par byas nas ni //
analyzed: dngos grub phyir ni de ltar mchog / shin tu sbas par byas nas ni //
translated: In order to attain power, having thus concealed the supreme

original: gang du sus kyang ngo mi shes //
analyzed: gang du sus kyang ngo mi shes //
translated: in a place where no one knows,

original: yul mchog de la spyad par bya //
analyzed: yul mchog de la spyad par bya //
translated: one should practice in that supreme place.

original: de ltar rdzogs pa'i spyod pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas rang dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub par nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rdzogs pa'i spyod pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas rang dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub par nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the yogin who abides in the conduct of perfection will be able to accomplish the welfare of self and other.

original: de ltar dngos po rab tu @53a * //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po rab tu @53a * //
translated: Thus, the thing that is well known

original: grags // zhes bya ba'i rigs pas dngos po ni spyod pa ste /
analyzed: grags // zhes bya ba'i rigs pas dngos po ni spyod pa ste /
translated: is the conduct, by the reasoning of the thing.

original: rdzogs pa'i brtul zhugs kyi mtshan nyid khyad par du brten par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i brtul zhugs kyi mtshan nyid khyad par du brten par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that one should rely on the special characteristics of the perfection of conduct, which is the stage of union.

original: de ltar gsungs so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar gsungs so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Thus it is said means as before.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: gdon mi za ba zhes bya ba rim pa lnga po nye bar bsdus nas 'bras bu dang bcas pa grub pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i phyag rgya'i dngos grub gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba zhes bya ba rim pa lnga po nye bar bsdus nas 'bras bu dang bcas pa grub pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i phyag rgya'i dngos grub gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who has accomplished the five stages and has the result is called the one who has the power of the great Vajradhara's mudra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni ye shes lnga'i rim pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni ye shes lnga'i rim pa lnga ste /
translated: All tathagatas are the five stages of the five wisdoms.

original: de rnams zil gyis gnon pa ni gang gis ro gcig par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams zil gyis gnon pa ni gang gis ro gcig par byed pa ste /
translated: Overpowering them means that which makes them one taste.

original: de nyid sreg par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'jig par mi 'gyur ba dang / mi phyed pa'i mtshan nyid can rdo rje ting nge 'dzin gang la yod pa de la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de nyid sreg par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'jig par mi 'gyur ba dang / mi phyed pa'i mtshan nyid can rdo rje ting nge 'dzin gang la yod pa de la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: That is the vajra samadhi, which has the characteristic of being indestructible, undestroyable, and indivisible.
