original: byang chub kyi sems 'di ni rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pa dang bral ba gsungs so zhes ston to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'di ni rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pa dang bral ba gsungs so zhes ston to //
translated: This enlightenment mind is taught to be free from stages and non-stages.

original: chos rnams rang bzhin 'od gsal ba //
analyzed: chos rnams rang bzhin 'od gsal ba //
translated: The nature of phenomena is luminosity,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so forth.

original: chos rnams ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: chos rnams ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The phenomena are characterized by engagement, abiding, and arising,

original: dkyil 'khor bzhi'i 'od spro ba ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhi'i 'od spro ba ste /
translated: or the emission of light from the four maṇḍalas.

original: de rnams thams cad rang bzhin 'od gsal ba zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de rnams thams cad rang bzhin 'od gsal ba zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: All of those are the nature of luminosity, which is the nature of natural luminosity.

original: 'on kyang las dang po la skas bzhin du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang las dang po la skas bzhin du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
translated: However, for beginners, the methods of engagement and so on are taught, like a staircase.

original: gzod nas dag pa nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: gzod nas dag pa nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: Primordially pure like space,

original: zhes bya ba la nam mkha' ni ye shes gsum ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la nam mkha' ni ye shes gsum ste /
translated: and so forth. Space is the three exalted wisdoms.

original: de dang mthun pa ni rang bzhin rnams te de rnams kyang gdod nas dag pa zhes pa ni don dam pa'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo zhes ston to //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa ni rang bzhin rnams te de rnams kyang gdod nas dag pa zhes pa ni don dam pa'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo zhes ston to //
translated: The natures that accord with that are primordially pure, which is taught to be the nature of ultimate reality.

original: byang chub ni gang zhig 'di sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin 'ja' tshon dang 'dra ba de yang med ces pa ni brtags pas med pa ste don dam pa'i ngo bor yod pa'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: byang chub ni gang zhig 'di sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin 'ja' tshon dang 'dra ba de yang med ces pa ni brtags pas med pa ste don dam pa'i ngo bor yod pa'o zhes ston to //
translated: Enlightenment is that which is like an illusion, the samādhi that is like a rainbow, and that also does not exist, which is shown to be nonexistent when examined, and exists as the essence of ultimate reality.

original: mngon rtogs med ces pa ni de kho na nyid bzhi pa yang de la zhen pa dang ldan pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon rtogs med ces pa ni de kho na nyid bzhi pa yang de la zhen pa dang ldan pa med pa yin te /
translated: The absence of realization is the absence of attachment to that very fourth reality.

original: 'on kyang 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo rnam par mi rtog pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo rnam par mi rtog pa kho na yin no //
translated: However, it is the nature of clear light, which is only nonconceptual.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang gis 'di zhes pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang gis 'di zhes pa /
translated: For that very reason, “by whom” is said.

original: de la byang chub tshul zhes pa la /
analyzed: de la byang chub tshul zhes pa la /
translated: In that, the method of enlightenment is said.

original: byang chub ni zung 'jug gi bsam gtan te tshul ni de'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes bstan pa'i rdzogs pa'i spyod pas byas la @53b 'byung bar 'gyur zhes tshig gi don te rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub ni zung 'jug gi bsam gtan te tshul ni de'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes bstan pa'i rdzogs pa'i spyod pas byas la @53b 'byung bar 'gyur zhes tshig gi don te rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Enlightenment is the concentration of union, and the method is the post-meditational gnosis, which is the activity of the perfect Buddha, and will arise, is the meaning of the words. The perfect stage is said to be like the previous.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: byams pa la sogs pa ni byams pa gtso bor gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni phung po lnga dang / sku ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang / gsung ni rdo rje bzlas pa dang /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa ni byams pa gtso bor gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni phung po lnga dang / sku ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang / gsung ni rdo rje bzlas pa dang /
translated: Maitreya and so forth means that the bodhisattva who is foremost in love, who possesses unobstructed pristine consciousness, all tathāgatas are the five aggregates, the body is the self-empowerment, the speech is vajra repetition,

original: thugs ni sems rnam par dag pa dang / chos ni chos nyid de mngon par byang chub pa dang / de kho na nyid ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad pa zung 'jug dang / yi ge zhes pa ni g-yo ba dang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid thos nas ngo mtshar ba ni thos pa /
analyzed: thugs ni sems rnam par dag pa dang / chos ni chos nyid de mngon par byang chub pa dang / de kho na nyid ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad pa zung 'jug dang / yi ge zhes pa ni g-yo ba dang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid thos nas ngo mtshar ba ni thos pa /
translated: the mind is the pure mind, the phenomena are the manifest enlightenment of dharmatā, suchness is the union of the non-differentiation of the conventional and the ultimate, and the syllables are the suchness of luminous clarity that does not move or disintegrate.

original: rmad du byung ba ni mngon du byas nas ro de nyid kyis ldang zhing ched du brjod pa 'di zhes bya ba ni stong pa'i tshig brjod pa'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba ni mngon du byas nas ro de nyid kyis ldang zhing ched du brjod pa 'di zhes bya ba ni stong pa'i tshig brjod pa'o zhes ston to //
translated: Having heard that, the amazement is hearing, the marvel is arising with that taste, and the exclamation is the expression of the word of emptiness.

original: ae ma'o sangs rgyas ae ma'o chos //
analyzed: ae ma'o sangs rgyas ae ma'o chos //
translated: Amazing! Buddha! Amazing! Dharma!

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di la rdo rje'i bzlas pa dang / sems la dmigs pa dang / bdag byin gyis brlab pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dag /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di la rdo rje'i bzlas pa dang / sems la dmigs pa dang / bdag byin gyis brlab pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dag /
translated: In this verse, vajra repetition, the focus on mind, self-consecration, and manifest enlightenment

original: zung 'jug gi rim pa rnams yod pa ste /
analyzed: zung 'jug gi rim pa rnams yod pa ste /
translated: are the stages of union.

original: de la sngags rgyas zhes pa ni yi ge gsum te /
analyzed: de la sngags rgyas zhes pa ni yi ge gsum te /
translated: The mantra seal is the three syllables.

original: de rnam 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bshad pa de ni ngo mtshar ba ste /
analyzed: de rnam 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bshad pa de ni ngo mtshar ba ste /
translated: The explanation of their engagement and so forth is amazing.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught by way of the stage of vajra repetition.

original: ae ma'o chos zhes pa ni chos ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: ae ma'o chos zhes pa ni chos ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
translated: Amazing Dharma is the mind and mental factors.

original: de rnams kyi sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rnam par dag pa bstan pa de yang ngo mtshar ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rnam par dag pa bstan pa de yang ngo mtshar ba ste /
translated: The explanation of their purity by way of the stages of mantra and seal is also amazing.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: This is praise by way of the purity of mind.

original: de bzhin du chos ni sgyu ma lta bu'i sku la brten te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos ni sgyu ma lta bu'i sku la brten te /
translated: Similarly, the Dharma is based on the illusory body.

original: sems can rnams la gang bstan pa de yang shin tu ngo mtshar ba ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la gang bstan pa de yang shin tu ngo mtshar ba ste /
translated: What is taught to sentient beings is also very amazing.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: The praise by way of the consecration.

original: de nyid ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gsum ste /
translated: That itself is the three, passion, etc.

original: de rnams dag par bya ba'i phyir don ni bzhi pa ste bstan pa ngo mtshar ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams dag par bya ba'i phyir don ni bzhi pa ste bstan pa ngo mtshar ba ste /
translated: For the sake of purifying those, the fourth topic is the wonder,

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: the praise by way of manifest enlightenment.

original: dag pa'i don ni rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs dang bral ba zung 'jug gi ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: dag pa'i don ni rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs dang bral ba zung 'jug gi ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The pure topic is the concentration of union, free from the multitude of conceptual thoughts such as permanence and annihilation, etc.

original: de nyid gang bstan pa de yang ngo mtshar ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid gang bstan pa de yang ngo mtshar ba ste /
translated: That itself is the wonder, and that is taught.

original: @54a * // de'i phyir kye bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ni don dam pa'i ngo bo thams cad ro mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: @54a * // de'i phyir kye bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ni don dam pa'i ngo bo thams cad ro mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, O Bhagavat, the Bodhisattva is the nature of the ultimate, the nature of the Great Vajradhara, who has the characteristic of the equality of all tastes.🔽Homage to you! means we enter into your nature.

original: khyod la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa ni khyod kyi bdag nyid du kho bo cag 'jug pa'o zhes don te rim pa lnga'o //
analyzed: khyod la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa ni khyod kyi bdag nyid du kho bo cag 'jug pa'o zhes don te rim pa lnga'o //
translated: The five stages.

original: da ni ma lus pa'i dkyil 'khor ba'i ngo bo bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir /🔽bdag med pa yi chos las 'byung //
analyzed: da ni ma lus pa'i dkyil 'khor ba'i ngo bo bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir / bdag med pa yi chos las 'byung //
translated: Now, in order to explain the praise to the Bhagavat, the essence of the entire mandala,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: he says, “arisen from the dharma of selflessness,” and so on.

original: chos ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: chos ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The dharma is Vairocana, the essence of mirror-like pristine awareness.

original: bdag med pa ni sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: Selflessness is Ratnasaṃbhava, the essence of the pristine awareness of equality in all sentient beings.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i khams 'di las 'byung bas na 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i khams 'di las 'byung bas na 'byung ba ste /
translated: Since it arises from this nonconceptual realm, it is an arising.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: Amitābha is the essence of the pristine awareness of individual investigation.

original: sangs rgyas ni rab tu rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rab tu rtogs pa ste /
translated: Buddha is realization.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Akṣobhya is the essence of the pristine awareness of the ultimate realm.

original: byang chub ni mngon par byang chub ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni mngon par byang chub ste /
translated: Awakening is manifest enlightenment.

original: de nyid bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis sems can thams cad la rdzogs par mdzad pas na byang chub rdzogs mdzad pa ni don yod grub pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis sems can thams cad la rdzogs par mdzad pas na byang chub rdzogs mdzad pa ni don yod grub pa ste /
translated: Since that is perfected for all sentient beings by the gnosis of successful action, the perfection of enlightenment is Amoghasiddhi.

original: de'i rang bzhin dang / de bzhin du zhi ba'i las mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa ni the tshom med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dang / de bzhin du zhi ba'i las mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa ni the tshom med pa ste /
translated: Since he performs the function of pacification, the nonconceptual is Amoghasiddhi.

original: sangs rgyas spyan no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyan no //
translated: The Buddha eye.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rigs yin pa'i phyir dmigs su med pa ni m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rigs yin pa'i phyir dmigs su med pa ni m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: Since it is the lineage of the gnosis of the dharmadhatu, the unobservable is Mamaki.

original: byang chub ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo gos dkar mo'o //
translated: Enlightenment is the essence of the gnosis of individual investigation, which is Pandaravasini.

original: sems ni sems dbang du mdzad pa'i mtshan nyid can sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: sems ni sems dbang du mdzad pa'i mtshan nyid can sgrol ma'o //
translated: The mind is the nature of Tara, who has the characteristic of controlling the mind.

original: de'i ngo bo bcom ldan 'das khyod la phyag 'tshal lo zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo bcom ldan 'das khyod la phyag 'tshal lo zhes ston to //
translated: I pay homage to you, the Bhagavat who has that nature.

original: de bzhin du kun du bzang pos nye bar mtshon pa ni byang chub sems dpa' brgyad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun du bzang pos nye bar mtshon pa ni byang chub sems dpa' brgyad de /
translated: Similarly, the eight bodhisattvas are illustrated by Samantabhadra.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo dang thams cad don zhes pa ni 'dod yon lnga ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo dang thams cad don zhes pa ni 'dod yon lnga ste /
translated: The nature of those and all objects refers to the five objects of desire.

original: de rnams kyis byang chub kyi sems ni bde ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu skor bar byed pas na thams cad don byang chub sems rab tu bskor ba ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa lnga po ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis byang chub kyi sems ni bde ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu skor bar byed pas na thams cad don byang chub sems rab tu bskor ba ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa lnga po ste /
translated: Since those cause the bodhicitta, the meditative concentration of great bliss, to circulate, all objects are the bodhicitta.

original: de'i ngo bo dang / byang chub spyod pa rdo rje che //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dang / byang chub spyod pa rdo rje che //
translated: The nature of that and the great vajra conduct of enlightenment🔽are the five beginning with Rūpavajrā.

original: zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i sgo nas byang chub spyod par byed pas na byang chub spyod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i sgo nas byang chub spyod par byed pas na byang chub spyod pa ste /
translated: The conduct of enlightenment is so called because it causes one to engage in the conduct of enlightenment through the antidote to the afflictive obstructions.

original: 'phags pa gshin rje mthar byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa gshin rje mthar byed do //
translated: It is the sublime Yāma.

original: @54b shes bya'i sgrib pa'i ri bo chen po 'jig par byed pas na rdo rje ste shes rab mthar byed do //
analyzed: @54b shes bya'i sgrib pa'i ri bo chen po 'jig par byed pas na rdo rje ste shes rab mthar byed do //
translated: The great vajra that destroys the mountain of the obstructions to omniscience is the sublime Prajñāntaka.

original: byang chub sems ni las kyi sgrib pa'i gnyen po ye shes gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems te 'phags pa padma mthar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni las kyi sgrib pa'i gnyen po ye shes gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems te 'phags pa padma mthar byed do //
translated: The bodhicitta is that which has the gnosis that is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience. It is the sublime Padmantaka.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa zad pas thugs rje'i ngo bo thob pa'i phyir thugs ni bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa zad pas thugs rje'i ngo bo thob pa'i phyir thugs ni bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'o //
translated: The mind of the Tathagata is called “pure,” and so forth. The mind is Amrtakundali, because he has attained the nature of compassion by exhausting the obscurations of ripening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkas gdul bar dka' ba 'dul ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkas gdul bar dka' ba 'dul ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The Tathagata is Acala, because he tames those difficult to tame by the word of the Tathagata.

original: sdig pa byed pa rnams bcings shing sems dag par mdzad pas dag pa ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po'o //🔽bdud rnams kyi lus ngag yid rmongs par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa rnams bcings shing sems dag par mdzad pas dag pa ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po'o // bdud rnams kyi lus ngag yid rmongs par mdzad pas na /
translated: He is pure, because he purifies the minds of those who commit evil by binding them.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs ni dbyig pa sngon po can no //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs ni dbyig pa sngon po can no //
translated: He is the one with the blue club, because he confuses the bodies, speech, and minds of the Maras.

original: rdo rje brgya pas sprin gyi tshogs gcod la char 'bebs par mdzad pa'i phyir rdo rje 'dzin ni stobs po che'o //
analyzed: rdo rje brgya pas sprin gyi tshogs gcod la char 'bebs par mdzad pa'i phyir rdo rje 'dzin ni stobs po che'o //
translated: He is Mahabala, because he is the vajra-holder who cuts through the mass of clouds with a hundred vajras and causes rain to fall.

original: sa 'og la gnas pa'i bgegs rnams skrag cing /
analyzed: sa 'og la gnas pa'i bgegs rnams skrag cing /
translated: He is Takkirāja, because he terrifies the obstructors who dwell below the earth and causes them to tremble.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa rnams la rab tu ston par mdzad pas na sangs rgyas byang chub rab ston pa ni gnod mdzes rgyal po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa rnams la rab tu ston par mdzad pas na sangs rgyas byang chub rab ston pa ni gnod mdzes rgyal po'o //
translated: Since the enlightenment of the buddhas is revealed to those who have attained the state of Great Vajradhara, the one who reveals the enlightenment of the buddhas is Sumbharaja.

original: de bzhin du byang chub ni mu stegs pa thams cad kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i sgyu 'phrul dang sngags dang las rnams 'joms pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub ni mu stegs pa thams cad kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i sgyu 'phrul dang sngags dang las rnams 'joms pa ste /
translated: Likewise, enlightenment is that which conquers the magic, mantras, and actions of the dakinis of all the tirthikas.

original: de las sems gang la yod pa de la byang chub sems te /
analyzed: de las sems gang la yod pa de la byang chub sems te /
translated: The mind that is in that is the enlightenment mind.

original: gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur te /
analyzed: gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur te /
translated: The one who has that is the crown chakra-lord.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo bcom ldan 'das khyod la phyag 'tshal lo zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo bcom ldan 'das khyod la phyag 'tshal lo zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Homage to you, O Blessed One, who is the essence of those.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po bstod pa ste dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po bstod pa ste dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: Thus the bodhisattvas praise Great Vajradhara, who is the nature of thirty-two deities, the mandala Supreme Victor.

original: 'dir ni gal te na yang rdo rje 'chang chen po ston pa po yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni gal te na yang rdo rje 'chang chen po ston pa po yin te /
translated: Here, however, if it is the case that Great Vajradhara is the teacher,

original: 'on kyang mi bskyod pa la sogs pas byang chub kyi sems kyi tshigs su bcad pa rnams gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang mi bskyod pa la sogs pas byang chub kyi sems kyi tshigs su bcad pa rnams gsungs pa ste /
translated: However, Akṣhobhya and so on spoke the verses on the Thought of Enlightenment,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku dag tha mi dad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku dag tha mi dad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to teach the non-differentiation of the Enjoyment and Transformation Bodies.

original: la la na re de rnams kyi sgo nas bcom ldan 'das kho nas gsungs pa ste /🔽gang gi phyir de rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyis rim pa'i dbye ba la brtan @55a * //
analyzed: la la na re de rnams kyi sgo nas bcom ldan 'das kho nas gsungs pa ste / gang gi phyir de rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyis rim pa'i dbye ba la brtan @55a * //
translated: Some say that the Lord himself spoke them through those [Bodhisattvas],

original: te tha dad par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: te tha dad par rtogs pa ste /
translated: because those [Bodhisattvas] are the different realizations of the stages of the division of the series of sentient beings endowed with the family of passion and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ni de rnams dang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang bzhin gcig yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ni de rnams dang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang bzhin gcig yin pa'o //
translated: [But] by their own nature, they are of the same nature as Great Vajradhara.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni rdo rje'i bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lngas thob pa 'od gsal ba thob pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni rdo rje'i bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lngas thob pa 'od gsal ba thob pa ste /
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment is the attainment of clearlight by means of the five stages beginning with the vajra repetition.

original: de nyid ston par byed pa'i le'u ni byang chub sems kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston par byed pa'i le'u ni byang chub sems kyi le'u'o //
translated: The chapter which teaches just that is the Chapter on the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: le'u'i don ni snga ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: le'u'i don ni snga ma bzhin du'o //
translated: The meaning of the chapter is as before.

original: rgyud 'grel las le'u gnyis pa'i tshig gi don bcu drug pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'grel las le'u gnyis pa'i tshig gi don bcu drug pa bshad pa'o //
translated: The commentary on the tantra explains the sixteenth topic of the second chapter.

original: le'u 'di la tshigs su bcad pa'i grangs ni sum brgya'o /
analyzed: le'u 'di la tshigs su bcad pa'i grangs ni sum brgya'o /
translated: This chapter has three hundred verses.

original: // / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pas don dam pa'i bden pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: // / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pas don dam pa'i bden pa la zhugs te /
translated: Having entered ultimate reality by cultivating the thought of awakening,

original: gzhan gyi don med pas de nyid grub par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje bkod pa zhes bya ba'i lha'i le'u brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don med pas de nyid grub par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje bkod pa zhes bya ba'i lha'i le'u brtsam par bya ste /
translated: in order to accomplish that very [reality] without regard for the welfare of others, [the Bhagavān] begins the chapter on the deity called Vajraḍāka.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, etc. is stated.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Bhagavān is endowed with the six qualities of sovereignty, etc.

original: sku gsung thugs rdo rje ni rigs gsum bskyed par byed pa'i rgyu yin pas sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs rdo rje ni rigs gsum bskyed par byed pa'i rgyu yin pas sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra of body, speech, and mind is the cause of generating the three families, and is therefore the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is Mahāvajradhara.

original: des ci mdzad ce na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni dkyil 'khor pa'i gtso bo lnga ste /
analyzed: des ci mdzad ce na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni dkyil 'khor pa'i gtso bo lnga ste /
translated: What does he do? All tathāgatas are the five principal deities of the maṇḍala.🔽

original: de rnams kyi gang kun du ni shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su snang ba ni 'od zer te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gang kun du ni shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su snang ba ni 'od zer te /
translated: The light rays are the appearances of those in all directions such as the east.

analyzed: de nyid 'phro ba ni rim gyis bkod pa de nyid kyang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams mtha' yas pa'i phyir sprin te /

original: de rnams kyi yang bkod pa ni spros pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang bkod pa ni spros pa ste /

original: de nyid sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir bstan pas na rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de nyid sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir bstan pas na rdo rje ste /

analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni phung po lnga'i gang zhig sku gsung thugs ni yi ge gsum ste /
translated: Or else, all tathāgatas are the five aggregates, and their body, speech, and mind are the three syllables.

translated: The one who has the vajra of those, the process of entry, and so on, is Great Vajradhara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni dkyil 'khor bzhi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni dkyil 'khor bzhi ste /
translated: All tathāgatas are the four maṇḍalas.

original: de @55b rnams kyi gang zhig kun du ni lkog ma la sogs pa'i gnas rnams la snang ba ni dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer te /
analyzed: de @55b rnams kyi gang zhig kun du ni lkog ma la sogs pa'i gnas rnams la snang ba ni dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer te /
translated: The one who appears in all of those, in the places of the throat, and so on, is the red light ray, and so on.

original: de nyid 'phro ba ni sna'i rtses mor 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'phro ba ni sna'i rtses mor 'dzin pa ste /
translated: That itself is the cloud that emanates, held at the tip of the nose.

original: de nyid zhi ba la sogs pa'i la 'grub par byed pas na sprin te /
analyzed: de nyid zhi ba la sogs pa'i la 'grub par byed pas na sprin te /
translated: That itself is the cloud that accomplishes pacification, and so on.

original: de dgod pa ni g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dang gnyis ka dang dal bus rgyu ba bas gang zhig rdo rje ni lha'i rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: de dgod pa ni g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dang gnyis ka dang dal bus rgyu ba bas gang zhig rdo rje ni lha'i rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: The one who emits that, moving to the right, to the left, and both, and slowly, is the vajra, the mindfulness of the deity.

original: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: He entered into equipoise on the samādhi called🔽“cloud of Dharma.”

original: rdo rje ni rlung gsum ste de rnams kyi bkod pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i bya ba le'u gang la yod pa de gsungs so zhes 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ni rlung gsum ste de rnams kyi bkod pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i bya ba le'u gang la yod pa de gsungs so zhes 'brel pa ste /
translated: The array of vajras is the three vital winds, and the chapter in which their function of going and coming is taught is called the array of vajras.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of vajra repetition.

original: dang po dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgom pa'i dus su chos thams cad stong pa nyid mngon du byas te mngon du bya ba de byung na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i 'grub pa'i sngags kyi mthu stobs kyis stong pa nyid de kho na nyid rnal 'byor pa
analyzed: dang po dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgom pa'i dus su chos thams cad stong pa nyid mngon du byas te mngon du bya ba de byung na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i 'grub pa'i sngags kyi mthu stobs kyis stong pa nyid de kho na nyid rnal 'byor pa
translated: At the time of meditating on the mandala wheel, one should realize the emptiness of all phenomena. When that realization occurs, the power of the mantra of accomplishment taught by the Bhagavān causes that reality of emptiness to be realized by the

original: la mngon du gyur te ;
analyzed: la mngon du gyur te ;
translated: yogi.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags 'di brjod nas rang dang gzhan gyi sems nam mkha' bzhin du blta bar bya ste dang po sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags 'di brjod nas rang dang gzhan gyi sems nam mkha' bzhin du blta bar bya ste dang po sbyor ba'o //
translated: Having recited this mantra, “oṃ śūnyatā,” and so on, one should view oneself and others as being like space. This is the first yoga.

original: aom zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: aom zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: Oṃ is Vairocana.

original: sh'u n+ya t'a ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: sh'u n+ya t'a ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Śūnyatā is Akṣobhya.

original: dzny'a na ni rin chen 'byung ldan la'o //
analyzed: dzny'a na ni rin chen 'byung ldan la'o //
translated: Jñāna is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: badzra ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: badzra ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: Vajra is Amitābha.

original: sva bh'a ba ni don yod grub pa ste /
analyzed: sva bh'a ba ni don yod grub pa ste /
translated: Svabhāva is Amoghasiddhi.

original: a'atma ko& ham zhes pa ni de rnams kyi bdag nyid ye shes lnga ste de'i rag bzhin no zhes rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: a'atma ko& ham zhes pa ni de rnams kyi bdag nyid ye shes lnga ste de'i rag bzhin no zhes rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Ātmāko ’ham means “I am the nature of those five intuitions, ” and so on.

original: yang na aom ni thabs so //🔽sh'u n+ya t'a ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: yang na aom ni thabs so // sh'u n+ya t'a ni shes rab bo //
translated: Or else, Oṃ is the means.🔽Śūnyatā is insight.

original: dzny'a na ni padma'o //
analyzed: dzny'a na ni padma'o //
translated: Jñāna is the lotus.

original: badzra ni rgyal mtshan no //
analyzed: badzra ni rgyal mtshan no //
translated: Vajra is the banner.

original: sva bh'a ba ni sngags dgod pa'i sngon du 'gro ba bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: sva bh'a ba ni sngags dgod pa'i sngon du 'gro ba bskyod pa'o //
translated: Svabhāva is the shaking that precedes the placement of the mantra.🔽Ātmā is great bliss.

original: a'atma ni bde ba chen po ste de rnams kyi rang bzhin dag yin te /
analyzed: a'atma ni bde ba chen po ste de rnams kyi rang bzhin dag yin te /
translated: They are the nature of those.

original: rang bzhin dang rgyu dang las dang 'bras bu rnam so //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rgyu dang las dang 'bras bu rnam so //
translated: The nature, cause, action, and result are all empty.

original: thams cad stong pa nyid bsgoms nas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad stong pa nyid bsgoms nas ci bya zhe na /
translated: Having meditated on emptiness, what should one do?

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa //
translated: In the middle of the realm of space

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam mkha'i rtsa lnga ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam mkha'i rtsa lnga ste /
translated: and so on. The five channels are space.

original: de rnams dang ldan pas na nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: de rnams dang ldan pas na nam mkha' ste /
translated: Endowed with those, it is space.

original: chos 'byung gi phyag rgya gru gsum pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'byung gi phyag rgya gru gsum pa'o //
translated: The triangle is the seal of the source of phenomena.

original: khams kyi rdzas drug gi nang na gtso bor gyur pa'i khams ni byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: khams kyi rdzas drug gi nang na gtso bor gyur pa'i khams ni byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The element that is the principal one among the six substances of the elements is the bodhicitta.

original: des gang ba'i chos 'byung gi phyag rgya ni nam mkha'i dbyings te /
analyzed: des gang ba'i chos 'byung gi phyag rgya ni nam mkha'i dbyings te /
translated: The source of phenomena that is filled with that is the realm of space.

original: de'i dbus su gnas pa @56a * //
analyzed: de'i dbus su gnas pa @56a * //
translated: In the middle of that,

original: sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: the mandala of the buddhas is the mandala of Vairocana.

original: rtag pa'i gzhal yas khang bsgom pa ni bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i gzhal yas khang bsgom pa ni bsam par bya'o //
translated: The meditation on the palace of permanence should be imagined.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'od zer sprin gyi tshogs chen po //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'od zer sprin gyi tshogs chen po // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is a great cloud of light rays.🔽The cloud of light rays is the great assembly of the bodhisattvas such as Kṣitigarbha, who are the essence of the emanation body.

original: 'od zer sprin ni sbrul pa'i sku'i ngo bo sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis tshogs chen po ni spros pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'od zer sprin ni sbrul pa'i sku'i ngo bo sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis tshogs chen po ni spros pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who has that is called “the great assembly of the cloud of light rays.”

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas ye shes ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas ye shes ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: Similarly, buddha jñāna is Vairocana.

original: de dang mnyam pa 'od dkar po gang la yod pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa 'od dkar po gang la yod pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: That which has white light is just so.

original: 'od zer sna lnga ste de'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo bzhi pos khyab pa ni mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer sna lnga ste de'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo bzhi pos khyab pa ni mdzes pa'o //
translated: It is pervaded by the four goddesses who are of the nature of the five light rays, which is beautiful.

original: kun nas yongs su zlum pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas yongs su zlum pa ste /
translated: It is completely round.

original: thams cad du bzang po 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis khyab pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du bzang po 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis khyab pa'o //
translated: It is pervaded by the goddesses such as Rūpavajrā, who are all good in every way, and the five sense objects.

original: de bzhin du sha lnga ni mchod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sha lnga ni mchod pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the five meats are the offerings.

original: gang la yod pa de ni mchod pa lnga ste khro bo'i rgyal po bcu yin no //
analyzed: gang la yod pa de ni mchod pa lnga ste khro bo'i rgyal po bcu yin no //
translated: That which has them is the five offerings, which are the ten wrathful kings.

original: de rnams kyis kyang brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang brgyan pa'o //
translated: They also are the ornaments.

original: mdor na de ltar bsgoms nas su //
analyzed: mdor na de ltar bsgoms nas su //
translated: In brief, having meditated in that way,🔽the wheel of the maṇḍala is the brief summary.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i mdor zhes pa ni mdor bsdus pa'i zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim gyis bsgoms te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i mdor zhes pa ni mdor bsdus pa'i zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim gyis bsgoms te /
translated: Having meditated on the moon, vajra, and so on, in the center,

original: dbus su zhes pa ni 'khor lo'i dbus su gzugs ni rnam par snang mdzad de sku bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus su zhes pa ni 'khor lo'i dbus su gzugs ni rnam par snang mdzad de sku bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate on the form, which is Vairocana, in the center of the maṇḍala.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rnam par snang mdzad phyag rgya che //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad phyag rgya che // zhes pa la /
translated: Vairocana, the great seal.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa /
translated: Here, one should meditate on the great seal of Vairocana, which is adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being,

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po ni sku gsung thugs ni dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po ste zhal gsum gyis mtshan pa ni ldan pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po ni sku gsung thugs ni dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po ste zhal gsum gyis mtshan pa ni ldan pa'am /
translated: and which is endowed with three faces, white, red, and black, which are the body, speech, and mind,

original: dam tshig la sogs pa'i sems dpa' gsum dang bcas pa 'am /
analyzed: dam tshig la sogs pa'i sems dpa' gsum dang bcas pa 'am /
translated: or which is endowed with the three beings of the commitments, etc.,

original: sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags rnams dang ldan pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags rnams dang ldan pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: or which is endowed with the mantras of the consecration of body, speech, and mind.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rigs nye bar bsdu ba rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rigs nye bar bsdu ba rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
translated: The great Vairocana is the condensation of the body, speech, and mind families.

original: de nyid kyi phyag rgya ni sku bsgom par bya'o /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyag rgya ni sku bsgom par bya'o /
translated: One should meditate on the seal of that, the body.

original: des ni 'di bshad pa yin te gang zhig 'di bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po de ni rdo rje 'chang chen po dang tha mi dad par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: des ni 'di bshad pa yin te gang zhig 'di bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po de ni rdo rje 'chang chen po dang tha mi dad par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: This is explained as follows: One should meditate on the great Vairocana, the Blessed One, as not different from the great Vajradhara.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rjes su zhugs pa rnam par snang mdzad ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rjes su zhugs pa rnam par snang mdzad ni /
translated: Therefore, the one who enters that, Vairochana,

original: zla ba bzhin du dkar dmar bsgom par bya'o /
analyzed: zla ba bzhin du dkar dmar bsgom par bya'o /
translated: is meditated upon as white and red like the moon.

original: @56b zhes ston te /
analyzed: @56b zhes ston te /
translated: This is taught.

original: de ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: That is the mandala of Vairochana.

original: tshogs gnyis dang ni ldan pa yis //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis dang ni ldan pa yis //
translated: By the passage beginning “endowed with the two accumulations,”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa gtso bor gyur pa 'khor lo bzhi de bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa gtso bor gyur pa 'khor lo bzhi de bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate on the four wheels with Akshobhya and so forth as the principal ones.

original: glegs bam mthong bsang rgyal dang ldan pa rnams 'khrul par bya ba'i phyir go bzlog pas sku mdog la sogs pa'i dbye ba bshad par bya ste /🔽aindra n'i la'i kha dog 'dra //
analyzed: glegs bam mthong bsang rgyal dang ldan pa rnams 'khrul par bya ba'i phyir go bzlog pas sku mdog la sogs pa'i dbye ba bshad par bya ste / aindra n'i la'i kha dog 'dra //
translated: In order to avoid confusion for those who see the scriptures, the colors and so forth are explained in reverse order.🔽The color of sapphire

original: zhes pa ni aindra n'i la'i nor bu dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni aindra n'i la'i nor bu dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: is like the sapphire jewel.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The one with the vajra of body, speech, and mind is Akshobhya.

original: gtso bo'i phyag gis rdo rje 'dzin pas na rdo rje bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo'i phyag gis rdo rje 'dzin pas na rdo rje bsnams pa'o //
translated: Since the principal one holds a vajra in his hand, he is the vajra-holder.

original: lhag ma ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The rest has been explained previously.

original: rab 'byor ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sprul pa'i sku spro ba'i bdag nyid do //🔽rnam par gtsigs la 'jigs 'jigs lta zhes pa ni rnam par gtsigs pa ni sgeg pa'i ro gtso bor gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sprul pa'i sku spro ba'i bdag nyid do // rnam par gtsigs la 'jigs 'jigs lta zhes pa ni rnam par gtsigs pa ni sgeg pa'i ro gtso bor gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: Subhūti is the nature of the emanation of various emanation bodies.

original: 'jigs 'jigs lta ni drag po'i nyams gtso yang yin te /
analyzed: 'jigs 'jigs lta ni drag po'i nyams gtso yang yin te /
translated: The one with a fierce, terrifying appearance is the one with the rasa of passion as the main thing, and fierce is the main thing in the experience of wrath.

original: zhe sdang gi rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is of the family of hatred.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The meditation on Vairocana should be explained.

original: shel dang zla ba 'od 'dra ba ni chu shel gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: shel dang zla ba 'od 'dra ba ni chu shel gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Like crystal and moon light means like a water crystal gem.

original: thor tshugs cod pan ni ral pa'i cod pan gyis brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: thor tshugs cod pan ni ral pa'i cod pan gyis brgyan pa ste /
translated: The crown of matted hair is adorned with a crown of matted hair.

original: zhi ba gtso bor gyur pas thub pa'i cha lugs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba gtso bor gyur pas thub pa'i cha lugs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has the attire of a sage, with peace as the main thing.

original: rab 'bar ni phyi rol du dkyil 'khor pa rnams spro bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'bar ni phyi rol du dkyil 'khor pa rnams spro bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: Blazing is emanating the maṇḍala retinue externally.

original: phyag na 'khor lo bsnams pa ni rtsibs brgyad pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor lo 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: phyag na 'khor lo bsnams pa ni rtsibs brgyad pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor lo 'chang ba'o //
translated: He holds a wheel in his hand, which is an eight-spoked wheel, symbolizing the purity of the realm of reality.

original: sna tshogs kun gyis mdzes par brgyan //
analyzed: sna tshogs kun gyis mdzes par brgyan //
translated: He is adorned with all kinds of ornaments.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi rgyu mthun pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi rgyu mthun pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This means that he is adorned with the ornaments that are the natural outflow of the factors of enlightenment.

original: de nas rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the meditation on Ratnasaṃbhava is explained.

original: 'dzam bu chu bo'i gser 'ong 'dra ba ni rgyas pa'i las 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzam bu chu bo'i gser 'ong 'dra ba ni rgyas pa'i las 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is like the gold of the Jambu River, because the activity of increasing is accomplished.

original: sangs rgyas sprin gyis kun du 'khrigs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sprin gyis kun du 'khrigs //
translated: He is surrounded by clouds of Buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni phyi rol du yang de bzhin du sangs rgyas spro bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyi rol du yang de bzhin du sangs rgyas spro bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: This means that he also emits Buddhas externally.

original: sngar bshad pa mi bskyod pa'i phyag mtshan gang yin pa de ji lta bu rtse dgu pa ni ye shes lnga dang nyon mongs pa bzhi rnam par dag pas de'i phyag na bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa mi bskyod pa'i phyag mtshan gang yin pa de ji lta bu rtse dgu pa ni ye shes lnga dang nyon mongs pa bzhi rnam par dag pas de'i phyag na bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The hand implement of Akṣobhya explained above is a nine-spoked vajra, which should be meditated on in his hand, symbolizing the purity of the five pristine consciousnesses and the four afflictions.

original: mar gang 'dra ba'i 'od @57a * //🔽'dra ba ni /
analyzed: mar gang 'dra ba'i 'od @57a * // 'dra ba ni /
translated: The light rays are like a jewel,

original: nam mkha' lding gi nor bu dang 'dra ba dgug pa gtso bor gyur pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi nor bu dang 'dra ba dgug pa gtso bor gyur pa /
translated: like a garuḍa jewel,🔽the light rays are like a blazing vajra,

original: rdo rje 'bar ni dgug pa gtso bor gyur pa'i 'od zer te de rnams kyis brgyan pa don yod grub pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ni dgug pa gtso bor gyur pa'i 'od zer te de rnams kyis brgyan pa don yod grub pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: adorned with those light rays, one should meditate on Amoghasiddhi.

original: phyag na rin chen zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phyag na'o //
analyzed: phyag na rin chen zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phyag na'o //
translated: The jewel in the hand is in the hand of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: 'bar ba'i sprin gyis kun tu khyab //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i sprin gyis kun tu khyab //
translated: The blazing cloud completely pervades

original: ces pa ni rin chen gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: ces pa ni rin chen gyi khyad par ro //
translated: the special jewel.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The meditation on Amitābha should be explained.

original: padma r'a ga ni nor bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: padma r'a ga ni nor bu zhes bya ste /
translated: The padmarāga is called a jewel.

original: de'i 'od 'dra ba ni de'i 'od zer dang 'dra ba dbang gi las gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'od 'dra ba ni de'i 'od zer dang 'dra ba dbang gi las gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The light rays are like that, like its light rays, because the activity of subjugation is primary.

original: ral pa'i cod pan gyis brgyan pa ni 'dod chags rab tu zhi ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ral pa'i cod pan gyis brgyan pa ni 'dod chags rab tu zhi ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Adorned with a crown of hair is the method for completely pacifying desire.

original: phyag mtshan bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: phyag mtshan bstan par bya ste /
translated: The hand implements should be explained.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri mas mgos pa'i padma gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri mas mgos pa'i padma gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is so called because he has a lotus that is not soiled by the stains of the afflictions such as passion, by virtue of his nature as the gnosis of discernment.

original: de bzhin du rab 'bar ni snga ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rab 'bar ni snga ma bzhin du'o //
translated: Similarly, he is blazing, as before.

original: 'dod chags rnam par dag pas na 'dod chags rdo rje can no /
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par dag pas na 'dod chags rdo rje can no /
translated: He is the vajra possessor of passion, because of the purity of passion.

original: don yod grub pa'i bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the meditation on Amoghasiddhi should be explained.

original: gdon mi za ba rdo rje can ni don yod grub pa ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za ba rdo rje can ni don yod grub pa ste /
translated: The vajra possessor of the irresistible is Amoghasiddhi.

original: sngar mar ka ta'i 'od 'phro ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: sngar mar ka ta'i 'od 'phro ba bshad zin to //
translated: The light of emerald has already been explained.

original: 'od zer sna lnga'i 'od ni rlung gi khams dang bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od zer sna lnga'i 'od ni rlung gi khams dang bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the light of five-colored rays, because of his nature as the gnosis of successful action and the wind element.

original: ral gri ni nyon mongs pa gcod pa de phyag na bsnams pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ral gri ni nyon mongs pa gcod pa de phyag na bsnams pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: He is the sword, because he cuts off the afflictions. He should be meditated on as holding that in his hand.

original: de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: This is the mandala of the supreme victor.

original: don bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The summary is this:

original: re zhig dang po stong pa nyid mngon du byas la sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba rang dang gzhan bsams te /
analyzed: re zhig dang po stong pa nyid mngon du byas la sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba rang dang gzhan bsams te /
translated: First, having actualized emptiness, one should imagine oneself and others like cloudless space.

original: de nas kha dog dkar po bhr'um yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i 'gro ba ma lus bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa nang du byang chub kyi sems kyi rdzas kyis gdab /
analyzed: de nas kha dog dkar po bhr'um yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i 'gro ba ma lus bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa nang du byang chub kyi sems kyi rdzas kyis gdab /
translated: Then, having generated the cause for the production of all migrating beings from the white color of the syllable bhrūṃ, one should imagine that the substance of the bodhicitta is sprinkled inside.

original: kha dog dkar po gru gsum pa chos 'byung gi phyag rgya rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: kha dog dkar po gru gsum pa chos 'byung gi phyag rgya rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: One should imagine a white, triangular dharma source seal.

original: de'i 'og tu sa 'og gi bar thams cad khyab pa yi ger yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje 'bar ba'i tshogs las skyes pa rdo rjes gzhi bsam ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sa 'og gi bar thams cad khyab pa yi ger yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje 'bar ba'i tshogs las skyes pa rdo rjes gzhi bsam ste /
translated: Then, having imagined that the entire area below is pervaded by the syllable vaṃ, one should imagine that the vajra ground arises from the mass of blazing vajras produced from the transformation of the syllable.

original: rdo rje de bzhin du phyogs bzhi po la rdo rjer ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje de bzhin du phyogs bzhi po la rdo rjer ba ste /
translated: The vajra fence is the vajras in the four directions.

original: de'i nang du rdo rjer ba dang / steng du rdo rje bla re dang / ra ba'i phyi rol du me'i @57b dra ba dang / de'i phyi rol du rdo rje ma da'i dra ba ste /
analyzed: de'i nang du rdo rjer ba dang / steng du rdo rje bla re dang / ra ba'i phyi rol du me'i @57b dra ba dang / de'i phyi rol du rdo rje ma da'i dra ba ste /
translated: In it, there is a vajra ground, above it a vajra canopy, outside the fence a net of fire, and outside that a net of vajra arrows.

original: de ltar drug de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs drug gi ngo bo gnas bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar drug de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs drug gi ngo bo gnas bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these six are the essence of the six families of the transcendent ones.

original: de rnams byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags 'di yin te /
analyzed: de rnams byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags 'di yin te /
translated: This is the mantra for the consecration of those:

original: aom me di n'i badzri bh'a ba badzra bandha h'um /🔽aom badzra pr'a ka ra h'um bam h'um phat /
analyzed: aom me di n'i badzri bh'a ba badzra bandha h'um / aom badzra pr'a ka ra h'um bam h'um phat /
translated: oṃ vajra-medini bhava vajra-bandha hūṃ🔽oṃ vajra-prakara hūṃ vaṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: aom badzra panytsa ra h'um bom h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra panytsa ra h'um bom h'um /
translated: oṃ vajra-pañjara hūṃ boṃ hūṃ

original: aom badzra bi d'a ni h'um bom h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra bi d'a ni h'um bom h'um /
translated: oṃ vajra-vidāriṇi hūṃ boṃ hūṃ

original: aom badzra aa na l'a rka h'um h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra aa na l'a rka h'um h'um h'um /
translated: oṃ vajra-anala-arka hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ🔽oṃ śarāṇāṭa traṃ saṃtraṃ.

original: aom sha ra dz'a la tr'am sam tr'am zhes bya ba'i sngags rnams kyis rdo rje'i sa gzhi la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: aom sha ra dz'a la tr'am sam tr'am zhes bya ba'i sngags rnams kyis rdo rje'i sa gzhi la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: With these mantras, one should consecrate the vajra ground and so forth.

original: de'i rjes la chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'i steng du yi ge bhr'um yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa sku mdog dkar po phyag rgya ma dang bcas pa zhi ba'i ngo bo sku la sogs par byin gyis brlabs pa spro ba dang
analyzed: de'i rjes la chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'i steng du yi ge bhr'um yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa sku mdog dkar po phyag rgya ma dang bcas pa zhi ba'i ngo bo sku la sogs par byin gyis brlabs pa spro ba dang
translated: After that, upon the mudra of the source of phenomena, the syllable bhrūṃ completely transforms into the three-faced, six-handed, white Gaṇapati with a consort, the essence of peace, and imagine that he blesses your body and so on.🔽

original: bsdu bar mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms te /
analyzed: bsdu bar mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms te /
translated: Then, on top of the mudra of the source of phenomena, meditate on the Bhagavat Vairocana, who is born from the completely transformed syllable bhrūṃ, who has three faces and six arms, who is white in color, who is endowed with a consort, who is of the nature of peace, and who radiates and gathers.

original: de'i rjes la sems can gyi khams ma lus pa zhugs pa la sngon du 'gro ba bde ba chen po'i dbang gis me'i reg pas zhu ba mar gyi bum pa bzhin du zhu ba skar ma dang 'dra ba byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le tsam du bsam
analyzed: de'i rjes la sems can gyi khams ma lus pa zhugs pa la sngon du 'gro ba bde ba chen po'i dbang gis me'i reg pas zhu ba mar gyi bum pa bzhin du zhu ba skar ma dang 'dra ba byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le tsam du bsam
translated: Then, after all the realms of sentient beings have entered, one should imagine that the bindu of bodhicitta, like a star, melts by the heat of the empowerment of great bliss, like a butter lamp, into a mere drop.

original: par bya'o // de yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa gru bzhi dang sgo bzhi pa ka ba brgyad kyis nye bar brgyan pa /
analyzed: par bya'o // de yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa gru bzhi dang sgo bzhi pa ka ba brgyad kyis nye bar brgyan pa /
translated: That completely transforms into a square with four doors, adorned by eight pillars,

original: dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa dang / dar dpyangs dang ; me tog gi phreng ba dang / dril bu g-yer kha'i dra ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang / sna tshogs gsang ba'i mchod pa dang bcas pa rin po che'i ngo bo 'od zer chen po'i tshogs kyis nam mkha'i khams ma lus pa gsal bar byed pa gzhal yas khang pa bsgom par bya'o//
analyzed: dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa dang / dar dpyangs dang ; me tog gi phreng ba dang / dril bu g-yer kha'i dra ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang / sna tshogs gsang ba'i mchod pa dang bcas pa rin po che'i ngo bo 'od zer chen po'i tshogs kyis nam mkha'i khams ma lus pa gsal bar byed pa gzhal yas khang pa bsgom par bya'o//
translated: One should visualize the celestial mansion, which is the nature of jewels, illuminating the entire realm of space with a great mass of light rays, together with nets and half-nets, streamers, flower garlands, nets of small bells, the five sense pleasures, and various secret offerings.

original: de'i nang du a'a li dang k'a li las byung ba padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte bar yi ge gsum las byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge gsum bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nang du a'a li dang k'a li las byung ba padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte bar yi ge gsum las byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge gsum bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In its center, one should visualize the three syllables arisen from the vowels and consonants, on a moon disk arisen from the three syllables, in the center of an eight-petaled lotus.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i rim pas mi bskyod pa la nyi ma'i gdan yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i rim pas mi bskyod pa la nyi ma'i gdan yin no //
translated: In the procedure of the maṇḍala rite, Akṣobhya has a sun seat.

original: gzhan ma rnams la zla ba'i gdan no ;
analyzed: gzhan ma rnams la zla ba'i gdan no ;
translated: The others have moon seats.

original: / lha mo rnams dang gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo brgyad po la zla ba'i gdan /
analyzed: / lha mo rnams dang gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo brgyad po la zla ba'i gdan /
translated: The goddesses and the eight goddesses beginning with Rūpavajrā have moon seats.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang de bzhin du zla ba'i gdan no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang de bzhin du zla ba'i gdan no //
translated: Likewise, the bodhisattvas have moon seats.

original: khro bo rnams la yi ge gsum las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan bcu yin no //
analyzed: khro bo rnams la yi ge gsum las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan bcu yin no //
translated: The wrathful ones have ten seats of sun maṇḍalas arisen from the three syllables.

original: de'i rjes la @58a * //
analyzed: de'i rjes la @58a * //
translated: After that,

original: dbus kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge gsum po bkod la de las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dkar po sngar bshad pa'i phyag mtshan dang / zhal la sogs pa mnga' ba bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge gsum po bkod la de las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dkar po sngar bshad pa'i phyag mtshan dang / zhal la sogs pa mnga' ba bsam par bya'o //
translated: one should visualize the three syllables arranged on the moon maṇḍala in the center, and the Bhagavān arisen from that, white in color, with the previously explained implements, faces, and so on.

original: de nas rim pa de nyid kyis dkyil 'khor pa rnams spros te /
analyzed: de nas rim pa de nyid kyis dkyil 'khor pa rnams spros te /
translated: Then, in that very order, one should emanate the maṇḍala and

original: shin tu gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bltas te /
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bltas te /
translated: gaze at the maṇḍala wheel, which is very clear.

original: ye shes kyi 'khor lo gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'khor lo gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should cause the gnosis wheel to enter.

original: de'i rjes la snying ga dang lkog ma dang spyi bo rnams la rdo rje dang padma dang 'khor lo'i steng du nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po'i yi ge gsum bkod la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la snying ga dang lkog ma dang spyi bo rnams la rdo rje dang padma dang 'khor lo'i steng du nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po'i yi ge gsum bkod la /
translated: After that, one should arrange the three syllables—black, red, and white—on the vajra, lotus, and wheel at the heart, throat, and head.

original: aom sarbba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko&amp ;🔽zhes bya ba dang / dpal ldan sangs rgyas sku 'chang ba //
analyzed: aom sarbba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko&amp ; zhes bya ba dang / dpal ldan sangs rgyas sku 'chang ba //
translated: oṃ sarvatathāgata kāya vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ🔽and the verses beginning “Glorious, holding the Buddha’s body” and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa brtan par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa brtan par bya ste /
translated: One should stabilize the consecration of body, speech, and mind.

original: ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i 'od zer gyis bskul ba nam mkhar bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la gsol ba gdab cing /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i 'od zer gyis bskul ba nam mkhar bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la gsol ba gdab cing /
translated: The light rays from the heart of the gnosis being invoke the tathāgatas in the space, who are requested to confer the empowerment.

original: des kyang ye shes kyi chus gang pa'i bum pa rnams kyis bdag nyid dbang bskur te /
analyzed: des kyang ye shes kyi chus gang pa'i bum pa rnams kyis bdag nyid dbang bskur te /
translated: They confer the empowerment with vases filled with the water of gnosis.

original: de bzhin du yang gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa spros te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa spros te /
translated: Similarly, one emanates Rūpavajrā, and so on.

original: de rnams kyis yang mchod pa byas la slar yang 'dus shing gsum mi dmigs pas bstod pa byas la /
analyzed: de rnams kyis yang mchod pa byas la slar yang 'dus shing gsum mi dmigs pas bstod pa byas la /
translated: They make offerings and then reabsorb, and one praises with the nonapprehension of the three spheres.

original: go ku da ha na dang / mar bi shu mu gcig tu gyur par byas la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs su bsams te /
analyzed: go ku da ha na dang / mar bi shu mu gcig tu gyur par byas la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs su bsams te /
translated: One should make go, ku, and da ha na and ma, ri, and śu into one and imagine it as the form of the tathāgatas.

original: spro ba la sogs pa'i rim pas bdud rtsir bsams shing yi ge gsum gyis sbyar ba la sogs pa byas te /
analyzed: spro ba la sogs pa'i rim pas bdud rtsir bsams shing yi ge gsum gyis sbyar ba la sogs pa byas te /
translated: Having imagined the nectar through the stages of the emanation and so forth, one should perform the consecration with the three syllables and so forth.

original: rang gi sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs shing /
analyzed: rang gi sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs shing /
translated: One should bless oneself with one's own mantra.

original: bdag nyid kyi lce la aa las byung ba'i padma'i 'dab ma ru h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje phra mo kha dog dkar po bkod cing /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lce la aa las byung ba'i padma'i 'dab ma ru h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje phra mo kha dog dkar po bkod cing /
translated: One should arrange on one's tongue a lotus petal arisen from A, and a white fine vajra arisen from HŪM.

original: dbang po dang dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dag par byas la kha'i me thab la snying gar gnas pa'i ye shes sems dpa'i me la mchog gi bdud rtsi'i glos nang gi bdag nyid dang rang gi 'khor lo la sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dag par byas la kha'i me thab la snying gar gnas pa'i ye shes sems dpa'i me la mchog gi bdud rtsi'i glos nang gi bdag nyid dang rang gi 'khor lo la sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having purified the sense organ and the sense consciousness, one should make an inner offering of the supreme nectar to the fire of the gnosis being residing in the heart, the fire hearth of the mouth.

original: de nas langs te smon lam yongs su bsngo ba byas la /
analyzed: de nas langs te smon lam yongs su bsngo ba byas la /
translated: Then, having arisen, one should dedicate the prayers.

original: 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should cultivate the subtle yoga which will be explained below.

original: dang po sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang / @58b las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
analyzed: dang po sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang / @58b las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
translated: The first is the yoga, the samadhi of the supreme victor mandala, and the samadhi of the supreme victor karma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum la /
translated: Therefore, in the three samadhis,

original: stong pa nyid kyi sngags las dang po gang zhig yan lag tu gyur pa sngags de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi sngags las dang po gang zhig yan lag tu gyur pa sngags de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the mantra of emptiness is the first branch. In order to explain that mantra,🔽then, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sku gsung thugs rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o ;
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sku gsung thugs rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o ;
translated: The vajra of body, speech, and mind is Mahavajradhara.

original: / chos kyi dbyings ni thams cad stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: / chos kyi dbyings ni thams cad stong pa nyid de /
translated: The dharmadhatu is the emptiness of everything.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: He entered the samadhi that is the nature of that,

original: tha mal pa'i lus ngag yid byin gyis rlob pa ni sngags gang gis mi snang bar byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i lus ngag yid byin gyis rlob pa ni sngags gang gis mi snang bar byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: and the consecration of the ordinary body, speech, and mind is the mantra by which he became invisible.

original: aom dharm'a dh'a tu sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: aom dharm'a dh'a tu sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes bya ba la /
translated: Om dharmadhatusvabhava atmako ham.

original: aa ni bcom ldan 'das te cha phyed dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: aa ni bcom ldan 'das te cha phyed dang bzhi'o //
translated: A is the Bhagavat, with four parts.

original: dper na aa ao ma /
analyzed: dper na aa ao ma /
translated: For example, a ā o.🔽In that regard,🔽a is the supreme of all syllables,

original: de la / aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
analyzed: de la / aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
translated: the great meaning, the holy syllable.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it occurs thus.

original: aa ni aaksho bhya ste mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: aa ni aaksho bhya ste mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: a is Akṣobhya, the immovable.

original: aa ni aa mi t'a bha ste 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: aa ni aa mi t'a bha ste 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: a is Amitābha, the infinite light.

original: aa ni aa mo gha ste don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: aa ni aa mo gha ste don yod grub pa'o //
translated: a is Amogha, the accomplished purpose.

original: ao ni rgyas pa'i phyir rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: ao ni rgyas pa'i phyir rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: o is Ratnasaṃbhava, because of expansion.

original: ma ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: ma ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: ma is Vairocana, the clear light.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga nye bar bsdu ba'i rang bzhin shes pa dang / shes bya'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can zla phyed dang sgra dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga nye bar bsdu ba'i rang bzhin shes pa dang / shes bya'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can zla phyed dang sgra dag go //
translated: The knowledge of the nature of the collection of the five transcendent lords and the crescent moon and sound, which have the characteristic of the emptiness of the object of knowledge and the subject, are the two syllables.

original: de la zla phyed ni shes pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la zla phyed ni shes pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therein, the crescent moon is the emptiness of the subject.

original: sgra ni shes bya'i stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: sgra ni shes bya'i stong pa nyid de /
translated: Sound is the emptiness of the object of knowledge.

original: de dag dang bral ba ni sgra mtha' ste /
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba ni sgra mtha' ste /
translated: The end of sound is free from those two.

original: thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The nature of all emptiness is Mahāvajradhara.

original: cha shas cha ni med pa dang // cha dang phyed dang bzhi bcas pa //
analyzed: cha shas cha ni med pa dang // cha dang phyed dang bzhi bcas pa //
translated: and the half and the fourth,

original: aom yig gang gis mi shes pa //
analyzed: aom yig gang gis mi shes pa //
translated: he who does not know the syllable Om,

original: bram ze de ni bram ze min //
analyzed: bram ze de ni bram ze min //
translated: that brahmin is not a brahmin.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba las kyang /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba las kyang /
translated: And in the Net of Illusion,🔽the Brahma-world is the brahmin Brahma,

original: tshangs ris bram ze tshangs pa dang // tshangs pa'i mya ngan 'das pa thob //🔽ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshangs ris bram ze tshangs pa dang // tshangs pa'i mya ngan 'das pa thob // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: and the nirvana of Brahma.

original: 'dir ni aom gyi ngo bo ni tshangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni aom gyi ngo bo ni tshangs pa ste /
translated: Here, the essence of Om is Brahma.

original: de nyid gang gis shes pa de ni tshangs ris so //
analyzed: de nyid gang gis shes pa de ni tshangs ris so //
translated: He who knows that is the Brahma-world.

original: de bzhin du de nyid ni bram ze tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid ni bram ze tshangs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, that itself is the brahmin Brahma.

original: tshangs pa ni yi ge aom gyis mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa ni yi ge aom gyis mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
translated: Nirvana by the syllable Om is

original: sgra mtha' cha dang bcas pa ma yin pa gang gis shes pa de 'ang des kyang mya ngan las 'das pa thob bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra mtha' cha dang bcas pa ma yin pa gang gis shes pa de 'ang des kyang mya ngan las 'das pa thob bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the end of sound, without a part. He who knows that also attains nirvana by that.

original: de nyid las kyang /
analyzed: de nyid las kyang /
translated: And in that very same text,

original: yi ge lnga pa stong pa che //
analyzed: yi ge lnga pa stong pa che //
translated: the five syllables are the great emptiness,

original: thig le stong pa yi ge brgya //
analyzed: thig le stong pa yi ge brgya //
translated: the drop is the emptiness of the syllable.

original: de'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: dper na aa ao ma zhes bya ba lnga ni mi g-yo ba ste /🔽mi 'gyur zhing mi g-yo bas na yi @59a * //
analyzed: dper na aa ao ma zhes bya ba lnga ni mi g-yo ba ste / mi 'gyur zhing mi g-yo bas na yi @59a * //
translated: For example, the five letters a, ā, o, au, and m are Akṣobhya.

original: ge ste / de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: ge ste / de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o zhes ston to //
translated: The letter a is the five tathāgatas, because it is unchanging and unmoving.

original: stong pa chen po zhes pa ni sgra mtha' ste /
analyzed: stong pa chen po zhes pa ni sgra mtha' ste /
translated: The term “great emptiness” is the final sound.

original: de nyid thig le stong pa ni rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid thig le stong pa ni rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs med pa ste /
translated: That itself is the empty drop, which is the subsequent vowel, which is without sound.

original: ji srid du thig le bsgom pa de srid du sgra yod pa ste /
analyzed: ji srid du thig le bsgom pa de srid du sgra yod pa ste /
translated: As long as one meditates on the drop, there is sound.

original: thig le zad na sgra yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thig le zad na sgra yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the drop is exhausted, the sound also disappears.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol phyin ma las kyang /🔽spros pa med cing snang ba med //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol phyin ma las kyang / spros pa med cing snang ba med //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom says:🔽Without conceptual elaboration, without appearance,

original: rnam rtog med cing gnas med pa //
analyzed: rnam rtog med cing gnas med pa //
translated: without discursive thought, without location,

original: rang bzhin med pa mchog tu phra //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa mchog tu phra //
translated: without intrinsic nature, supremely subtle,

original: sgra dang thig le rnams spangs pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgra dang thig le rnams spangs pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: free from sound and drop.

original: bsdu ba'i rim pa bshad nas /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i rim pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the stages of gathering,

original: spro ba'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: spro ba'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: I will now explain the stages of emanating.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid yi ge aom ni yi ge brgya pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid yi ge aom ni yi ge brgya pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān himself is the syllable oṃ, which is the hundred-syllable mantra.

original: dper na aa nas brtsams te ksha'i bar du yi ge phyi mo ni yi ge lnga bcu yin te /
analyzed: dper na aa nas brtsams te ksha'i bar du yi ge phyi mo ni yi ge lnga bcu yin te /
translated: For example, beginning with a, there are fifty letters up to kṣa.

original: de nyid mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i dbye bas rang bzhin nyid du lte ba'i phyogs nas 'byung zhing brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i dbye bas rang bzhin nyid du lte ba'i phyogs nas 'byung zhing brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those very [letters] are one hundred by the division of night and day, arising from the navel region as the nature.

original: yang shes rab dang thabs kyi ngo bos so //
analyzed: yang shes rab dang thabs kyi ngo bos so //
translated: Again, by the nature of wisdom and method.

original: de ni gang las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de ni gang las 'byung zhe na /
translated: From what does that arise?

original: smras pa / aom kho na las so //
analyzed: smras pa / aom kho na las so //
translated: It is said: from oṃ alone.

original: 'o na / aa ni yi ge kun gyi mchog / ces bya ba'i tshig gis aa de nyid 'byung ba'i rgyu yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'o na / aa ni yi ge kun gyi mchog / ces bya ba'i tshig gis aa de nyid 'byung ba'i rgyu yin mod kyi /
translated: But if it is said that the statement “a is the best of all letters” is the cause of the arising of that a,

original: yi ge aom gyis ni ci bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge aom gyis ni ci bya'o zhe na /
translated: what is the purpose of the letter oṃ?

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: sngags thams cad kyi dang po bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde la sogs pa dang / rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams las gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sngags thams cad kyi dang po bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde la sogs pa dang / rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams las gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One has stated in the sūtras and so forth, and in the king of tantras, that oṃ is the beginning of all mantras.

original: de nyid bskyed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bskyed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That is the cause of generation.

original: yang na aa la yongs su zhugs pas so //
analyzed: yang na aa la yongs su zhugs pas so //
translated: Or, by entering into a.

original: gal te yon tan byas nas aa mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te yon tan byas nas aa mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: If a is not observed after making the qualities,

original: de ltar yin na yang rna ba'i dbang pos aom brjod pa'i dus su yi ge aa dang po thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang rna ba'i dbang pos aom brjod pa'i dus su yi ge aa dang po thos par 'gyur ro //
