translated: In that case, when the ear sense faculty hears the utterance of OM, it hears the first syllable A.

original: de'i 'og tu yi ge ao la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yi ge ao la sogs pa'o //
translated: After that, it hears the syllable O, and so on.

original: myur du brjod pas dbye ba ni mi shes /
analyzed: myur du brjod pas dbye ba ni mi shes /
translated: Because of the rapid utterance, the distinction is not known.

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / autpala gyi 'dab ma brgya phug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / autpala gyi 'dab ma brgya phug pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a whirling firebrand or a hundred lotus petals pierced at once.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol gyi bstan bcos rnams la yang rig byed rnams la dang bo aom brjod ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol gyi bstan bcos rnams la yang rig byed rnams la dang bo aom brjod ba yin te /
translated: In the same way, in the external treatises, the Vedas begin with the utterance of OM.

original: bram ze rnams kyis zer ba ni //
analyzed: bram ze rnams kyis zer ba ni //
translated: The Brahmins say:

original: thog ma dang ni tha ma ru //
analyzed: thog ma dang ni tha ma ru //
translated: At the beginning and at the end,

original: rtag tu rig byed aom brjod bya //
analyzed: rtag tu rig byed aom brjod bya //
translated: always utter the Vedic OM.🔽Without OM at the beginning, it is destroyed,

original: sngon du aom med 'jig pa dang // zhabs su yang ni 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: sngon du aom med 'jig pa dang // zhabs su yang ni 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: and also if destroyed at the end.

original: kha zhabs zad pa'i rgyal pa ru //
analyzed: kha zhabs zad pa'i rgyal pa ru //
translated: Like a vessel with a broken bottom,

original: 'bru rnams blugs na 'bo ba bzhin //
analyzed: 'bru rnams blugs na 'bo ba bzhin //
translated: if grain is poured in, it is lost.

original: de nyid yi ge brgya pa yin//
analyzed: de nyid yi ge brgya pa yin//
translated: That is the hundred syllable mantra.

original: @59b zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: @59b zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention.

original: de bzhin du de nyid las /
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid las /
translated: In the same text it says:

original: rnam pa kun dang rnam pa med //
analyzed: rnam pa kun dang rnam pa med //
translated: In all aspects and without aspects,

original: bcu drug thig le phyed phyed 'chang //
analyzed: bcu drug thig le phyed phyed 'chang //
translated: The sixteen are the bearers of the half-drop.

original: cha med pa dang cha las 'das //
analyzed: cha med pa dang cha las 'das //
translated: They are partless and beyond parts.

original: bsam gtan bzhi po'i mthar 'dzin pa //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po'i mthar 'dzin pa //
translated: They are the culmination of the four meditative concentrations.

original: de la rnam pa kun ni yi ge thams cad kyi bskyed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rnam pa kun ni yi ge thams cad kyi bskyed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, all aspects refers to the vowels, because they are the cause of the generation of all the syllables.

original: rnam pa med pa ni sgra mtha' tsam la ngal so pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa ni sgra mtha' tsam la ngal so pas so //
translated: The aspectless refers to the consonants, because they are merely the end of sound.

original: bcu drug ni dbu ma'i stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rang bzhin dbyangs bcu drug dang / nyan thos pa rnams kyi btsog ba dang / rtsol ba rjes su dran pa bcu drug gam //
analyzed: bcu drug ni dbu ma'i stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rang bzhin dbyangs bcu drug dang / nyan thos pa rnams kyi btsog ba dang / rtsol ba rjes su dran pa bcu drug gam //
translated: The sixteen are the nature of the sixteen empty states of the central channel, the sixteen vowels, the sixteen recollections of the śrāvakas,

original: skad cig ma bcu drug gi rang bzhin dang / sngags kyi bstan pa la zla ba'i cha bcu drug gi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma bcu drug gi rang bzhin dang / sngags kyi bstan pa la zla ba'i cha bcu drug gi rang bzhin te /
translated: the sixteen moments, and the sixteen phases of the moon in the teaching of the mantra vehicle.

original: aa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the vowels a and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi phyed ni aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha ste brgyad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi phyed ni aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha ste brgyad do //
translated: Half of them are the eight a ka ca ṭa ta pa ya śa.

original: nyan thos pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi rang bzhin dang / dbu ma pa rnams kyi bsam gtan rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi rang bzhin dang / sngags kyi theg pa chen po rjes su 'brang ba rnams la rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i dus su thun brgyad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi rang bzhin dang / dbu ma pa rnams kyi bsam gtan rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi rang bzhin dang / sngags kyi theg pa chen po rjes su 'brang ba rnams la rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i dus su thun brgyad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: For the śrāvakas, it is the nature of the eight consciousnesses; for the Mādhyamikas, it is the nature of the eight liberations and dhyānas; and for those who follow the Mahāyāna of Mantra, it is the nature of the eight periods during vajra recitation.

original: de rnams kyi yang phyed ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang phyed ni bzhi ste /
translated: Half of those is four.

original: aa ao ma /
analyzed: aa ao ma /
translated: A, ā, oṃ, and ma.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi 'phags pa'i bden bzhi'i rang bzhin dang / dbu ma pa rnams kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi'i rang bzhin dang / sngags kyi theg pa la dga' ba bzhi'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi 'phags pa'i bden bzhi'i rang bzhin dang / dbu ma pa rnams kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi'i rang bzhin dang / sngags kyi theg pa la dga' ba bzhi'i rang bzhin no //
translated: For the śrāvakas, it is the nature of the four noble truths; for the Mādhyamikas, it is the nature of the four doors of liberation; and for those who delight in the Mantra Vehicle, it is the nature of the four joys.

original: bcu drug phyed phyed yi ge bzhi po rnams kyi thams cad bsdu pa'i rang bzhin thig le ni sgra mtha' gang yin pa de 'dzin pas na bcu drug phyed phyed thig le can te yi ge aom nyid do //
analyzed: bcu drug phyed phyed yi ge bzhi po rnams kyi thams cad bsdu pa'i rang bzhin thig le ni sgra mtha' gang yin pa de 'dzin pas na bcu drug phyed phyed thig le can te yi ge aom nyid do //
translated: The bindu, which is the nature of the collection of all the sixteen parts, is the one that ends with the sound of the syllable oṃ. Since it holds the sixteen parts, it is the one with the bindu of the sixteen parts, which is the syllable oṃ.

original: gang gi tshe de lta bu yin na de'i tshe cha med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de lta bu yin na de'i tshe cha med pa ste /
translated: When it is like that, then it is partless.

original: cha ni cha dang gug skyed ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: cha ni cha dang gug skyed ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Parts are called “portions” up to “curls.”

original: de dag kyang phyed dang bzhi ste de dang bral bas na bsdu ba'i dus su cha med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang phyed dang bzhi ste de dang bral bas na bsdu ba'i dus su cha med pa'o //
translated: They are also half and four. Free from that, it is partless at the time of inclusion.

original: cha rnams ni yi ge bdag nyid yin pas sgra yin la sgra yang rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de med pas na cha las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: cha rnams ni yi ge bdag nyid yin pas sgra yin la sgra yang rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de med pas na cha las 'das pa ste /
translated: Since the parts are the nature of syllables, they are sound. Since sound is the cause of conceptualization, it is beyond parts because of the absence of that.

original: rtog pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is beyond thought.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi ni nam mkha' mtha' yas kyi skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / yod min med min gyi skye mched do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi ni nam mkha' mtha' yas kyi skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / yod min med min gyi skye mched do //
translated: Similarly, the four meditative concentrations are the base of infinite space, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither existence nor nonexistence.

original: de rnams kyi mtha' ni srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtha' ni srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
translated: The end of those is the peak of existence.

original: nyan thos rnams ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gis nyon mongs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad spong ba dang / @60a * //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gis nyon mongs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad spong ba dang / @60a * //
translated: The hearers abandon the eighty-eight afflictions by means of the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi ste /
translated: Likewise, in the desire realm, and in the four concentrations and four formless states,

original: sa dgu pa'i 'khor ba'i dbye bas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig spong zhing chos kyi ye shes dang / rjes su rtog pa'i ye shes dang bzod pa'i ye shes kyis dgra bcom pa nyid thob cing khams gsum pa'i chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa dgu pa'i 'khor ba'i dbye bas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig spong zhing chos kyi ye shes dang / rjes su rtog pa'i ye shes dang bzod pa'i ye shes kyis dgra bcom pa nyid thob cing khams gsum pa'i chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the bodhisattva eliminates the eighty-one afflictions such as desire, by means of the nine levels of the path of cultivation. By means of the gnosis of Dharma, the gnosis of subsequent realization, and the gnosis of acceptance, he attains the state of an arhat and becomes free from attachment to the three realms.

original: de bzhin du dbu ma pa rnams kyi bsam gtan bzhi ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi'o//
analyzed: de bzhin du dbu ma pa rnams kyi bsam gtan bzhi ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi'o//
translated: Likewise, the four concentrations of the Madhyamikas are the four gateways to liberation: emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and non-composition.

original: de rnams kyi rtse mo ni rang bzhin dang bral ba dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i dbang gis bag chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rtse mo ni rang bzhin dang bral ba dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i dbang gis bag chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: The peak of these is freedom from intrinsic nature, freedom from signs, and freedom from wishes, and thus freedom from habitual tendencies.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi de kho na nyid mngon du byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi de kho na nyid mngon du byed do //
translated: One realizes the reality of the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'i sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i bsam gtan bzhi ni dga' ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'i sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i bsam gtan bzhi ni dga' ba bzhi ste /
translated: The realm of phenomena is the four joys of the four meditative concentrations of the Mahayana mantra vehicle.

original: de rnams kyi mtha' ni dpe'i bde ba'i phyir dus su dpe las 'byung ba'i bde ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtha' ni dpe'i bde ba'i phyir dus su dpe las 'byung ba'i bde ba ste /
translated: The end of those is the example bliss, because it is the time of the example bliss.

original: de 'dzin pas na bsam gtan bzhi po'i mtha' 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na bsam gtan bzhi po'i mtha' 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Since one holds that, it is the holder of the end of the four meditative concentrations.

original: yi ge aom gyi sgra mtha'i dus ni bsam gtan bzhi po'i mtha'i mtshan nyid chos kyi dbyings dang / chos nyid kyi ngo bo yi ge aom gyi gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: yi ge aom gyi sgra mtha'i dus ni bsam gtan bzhi po'i mtha'i mtshan nyid chos kyi dbyings dang / chos nyid kyi ngo bo yi ge aom gyi gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: The end time of the sound of the syllable oṃ is the reality of the realm of phenomena, which is the characteristic of the end of the four meditative concentrations, and the essence of reality is the syllable oṃ.

original: de nyid dharma dh'a tu ste thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid dharma dh'a tu ste thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: That itself is the dharmadhātu, the emptiness of everything.🔽Svabhāva ātmako ’ham

original: sva bhva ba a'atma ko& ham de'i rang bzhin ba yin no zhes nga rgyal skyed par byed /
analyzed: sva bhva ba a'atma ko& ham de'i rang bzhin ba yin no zhes nga rgyal skyed par byed /
translated: I generate the pride that I am the nature of that.

original: dang por sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: dang por sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the first yoga.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, after that, and so on.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni sku gsung thugs gong bu gcig gi gzugs can byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam pa ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni sku gsung thugs gong bu gcig gi gzugs can byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam pa ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The vajra of body, speech, and mind is the form of the bodhicitta, which is the unity of body, speech, and mind, that is, Mahāvajradhara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rtsa bdun khri nyis stong ste de rnams las kun du ni yan lag thams cad las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rtsa bdun khri nyis stong ste de rnams las kun du ni yan lag thams cad las /
translated: All tathāgatas are the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: snang ba ni byang chub sems te de nyid 'phro ba ni rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: snang ba ni byang chub sems te de nyid 'phro ba ni rgyu ba ste /
translated: From all of them, the appearance is the bodhicitta, which is the radiation, the movement.

original: de ni sprin bzhin du bkod pa ni yang dag par bkod pa /🔽rdo rje ni rdo rje'i rtse mor ting nge 'dzin gang la yod pa de la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de ni sprin bzhin du bkod pa ni yang dag par bkod pa / rdo rje ni rdo rje'i rtse mor ting nge 'dzin gang la yod pa de la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: That is the cloud-like array, the perfect array.🔽Vajra means the vajra tip.🔽The chapter that has the samādhi that is present there is called the “Vajra Array.”🔽Vajra means the vajra tip. The array is the presence of the bindu of bodhicitta.

original: rdo rje bkod pa zhes bya ba la rdo rje ni rdo rje'i rtse mor bkod pa ni byang chub sems kyi thig le gnas pa le'u gang la yod pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo rje bkod pa zhes bya ba la rdo rje ni rdo rje'i rtse mor bkod pa ni byang chub sems kyi thig le gnas pa le'u gang la yod pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: The chapter that has that is just that.🔽Samādhi is the one-pointed mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa ste de dag gtso bor gyur pa'i le'u gsungs zhes @60b 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa ste de dag gtso bor gyur pa'i le'u gsungs zhes @60b 'brel pa'o //
translated: The chapter that has those as its main topic is called the “Vajra Array.”

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Om shunyata, etc.

original: aom ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: aom ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Om is joy.

original: sh'u n+ya t'a ni mchog tu dga' ba'o //🔽dzny'a na ni dga' bral lo //
analyzed: sh'u n+ya t'a ni mchog tu dga' ba'o // dzny'a na ni dga' bral lo //
translated: Shunyata is supreme joy.🔽Jñana is the joy of separation.

original: badzra ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: badzra ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: Vajra is the innate joy.

original: de rnams kyi sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham ni de'i rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham ni de'i rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Svabhava atmako ham means I am the nature of those.

original: de ltar dga' ba'i ngo bo sku rdzogs par byas la ci bya'o zhe na /🔽nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar dga' ba'i ngo bo sku rdzogs par byas la ci bya'o zhe na / nam mkha'i dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Having thus completed the body, which is the nature of joy, what should one do?

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ni lus te de nyid kyi dbus na gnas pa ni yan lag dang nying lag gi dbus su gnas pa sangs rgyas ni rtsa bdun khri nyis stong ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni lus te de nyid kyi dbus na gnas pa ni yan lag dang nying lag gi dbus su gnas pa sangs rgyas ni rtsa bdun khri nyis stong ste /
translated: The sky is the body, and in the middle of that is the middle of the limbs and secondary limbs, the buddhas, which are the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ni 'khor lo bsgom pa ni bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ni 'khor lo bsgom pa ni bsam par bya'o //
translated: The mandala of those is the wheel, which should be contemplated.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'od zer sprin zhes pa ni kun rdzob byang chub sems kyis khyab pa dang / sangs rgyas 'bar ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'od de /
analyzed: 'od zer sprin zhes pa ni kun rdzob byang chub sems kyis khyab pa dang / sangs rgyas 'bar ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'od de /
translated: The cloud of light rays is pervaded by the relative awakening mind, and the blazing buddhas are the light of Vairocana.

original: de dang 'od mnyam pa ni kha dog dkar po'o //
analyzed: de dang 'od mnyam pa ni kha dog dkar po'o //
translated: The light equal to that is the white color.

original: de bzhin du 'od zer sna lnga ni pags pa dang / sha dang khrag dang rtsa rgyus dang / rus pa dang / de rnams kun du khyab pa ni bskyed par byas pa ste gang gi phyir lus po'i cha ni drug ste ma dang pha'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od zer sna lnga ni pags pa dang / sha dang khrag dang rtsa rgyus dang / rus pa dang / de rnams kun du khyab pa ni bskyed par byas pa ste gang gi phyir lus po'i cha ni drug ste ma dang pha'i dbye bas so //
translated: Similarly, the five light rays are skin, flesh, blood, veins, and bones, and their pervasion is their generation. The body is six parts, divided into mother and father.

original: lnga po skyed par byed pa ni byang chub kyi sems kho na'o //
analyzed: lnga po skyed par byed pa ni byang chub kyi sems kho na'o //
translated: The five are generated by the awakening mind alone.

original: de bzhin du kun nas shes pa ni spyi bo nas rkang pa'i bar du yongs su zlum por te zhes pa ni zlum po ni rnam par gnas pa'o //🔽'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ni yul lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun nas shes pa ni spyi bo nas rkang pa'i bar du yongs su zlum por te zhes pa ni zlum po ni rnam par gnas pa'o // 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ni yul lnga ste /
translated: Similarly, the consciousness is completely round from the crown to the feet.🔽The five objects are the five sense objects.

original: de rnams la longs spyod pa dbang po rnams ni mchod pa lnga dang phung po rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams la longs spyod pa dbang po rnams ni mchod pa lnga dang phung po rnams so //
translated: The enjoyment of those is the five sense faculties and the five aggregates.

original: de rnams kyis brgyan pa ni de rnams kyi yang rgyu yin na zhes ston to //
analyzed: de rnams kyis brgyan pa ni de rnams kyi yang rgyu yin na zhes ston to //
translated: The phrase adorned with those indicates that they are the causes of those.

original: de lta bu'i byang chub sems dang ldan pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo mdor na zhes pa ni khams gsum pa ni nye bar bsdus nas bsgoms te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i byang chub sems dang ldan pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo mdor na zhes pa ni khams gsum pa ni nye bar bsdus nas bsgoms te /
translated: The phrase the wheel of channels endowed with such a bodhicitta means that the three realms are included and meditated upon.

original: gzugs ni don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: gzugs ni don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Form is the ultimate bodhicitta.

original: dbus su bsgom par bya ba ni rtsa'i 'khor lo'i nang du bsgom par bya'o //🔽rnam par snang mdzad phyag rgya che //
analyzed: dbus su bsgom par bya ba ni rtsa'i 'khor lo'i nang du bsgom par bya'o // rnam par snang mdzad phyag rgya che //
translated: The phrase meditated in the center means that it is meditated in the middle of the channel wheel.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma'i nang du gnas pa rtsa 'dod pa'i gdugs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma'i nang du gnas pa rtsa 'dod pa'i gdugs so //
translated: The phrase the great seal of Vairocana refers to the channel of desire, which is located in the middle of the vajra and lotus.

original: sku gsung thugs ro gcig par gyur pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs ro gcig par gyur pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan ma'o //
translated: The phrase the sign of body, speech, and mind refers to the single taste of body, speech, and mind.

original: sku ni shu kra'o //
analyzed: sku ni shu kra'o //
translated: The body is semen.

original: gsung ni khrag go //
analyzed: gsung ni khrag go //
translated: Speech is blood.

original: thugs ni dri chab ste /
analyzed: thugs ni dri chab ste /
translated: The mind is the scent.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin rtsa g-yon pa dang / g-yas pa dang / dbu ma rnams kyi phyag rgya @61a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin rtsa g-yon pa dang / g-yas pa dang / dbu ma rnams kyi phyag rgya @61a * //
translated: The nature of those is the left, right, and middle channels.

original: ni bsdu ba'i phyag rgya bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ni bsdu ba'i phyag rgya bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the seal of the union of the two.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa'i gdugs de ni chu rgyu ba'i phyir mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa'i gdugs de ni chu rgyu ba'i phyir mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bo'o //
translated: For that very reason, that parasol of desire is the essence of the great seal of Akṣobhya, because it moves through the water.

original: g-yon dang g-yas dag bsdu ba ni ngo bo gcig pas so //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas dag bsdu ba ni ngo bo gcig pas so //
translated: The union of the left and right is of one nature.

original: de nyid gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba ni tha mi dad pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba ni tha mi dad pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: That very nondual union should be meditated on with undifferentiated samādhi.

original: dkon mchog dpal zhes pa ni khrag go //
analyzed: dkon mchog dpal zhes pa ni khrag go //
translated: Ratnaśrī is blood.

original: de nyid kyi phyag rgya chen po ni rtsa g-yas pa ste rus sbal ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyag rgya chen po ni rtsa g-yas pa ste rus sbal ma'o //
translated: The great seal of that is the right channel, Kṛkālikā.

original: de bzhin du tshe dpag tu med pa ni shu kra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshe dpag tu med pa ni shu kra'o //
translated: Similarly, Amitāyus is semen.

original: de nyid kyi 'od byed pa ni rtsa g-yon pa ste zla ba ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'od byed pa ni rtsa g-yon pa ste zla ba ma'o //
translated: The illumination of that is the left channel, Candālī.

original: de dag g-yon dang g-yas su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag g-yon dang g-yas su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Those two should be meditated on as left and right.

original: thogs med ni sha'o //
analyzed: thogs med ni sha'o //
translated: Asādhā is feces.

original: 'grub pa ni bshang ba ste /
analyzed: 'grub pa ni bshang ba ste /
translated: Siddhi is urine.

original: de dag gi rgya chen ni shar dang nub phyogs na gnas pa'i rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag gi rgya chen ni shar dang nub phyogs na gnas pa'i rtsa gnyis te /
translated: Their great seal is the two channels located in the east and west.

original: lha sbyin ma dang nor rgyas ma'o //
analyzed: lha sbyin ma dang nor rgyas ma'o //
translated: The goddesses are Lāsya and Mālā.

original: de dag sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor ni nam mkha' lnga'i rang bzhin padma'i nam mkhar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor ni nam mkha' lnga'i rang bzhin padma'i nam mkhar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The mandala of the Buddhas is to be contemplated in the lotus of the sky, which is of the nature of the five skies.

original: aindra n'i la'i kha dog 'dra ba ni chu rgyu ba rtsa dbus ma'o //
analyzed: aindra n'i la'i kha dog 'dra ba ni chu rgyu ba rtsa dbus ma'o //
translated: Having the color of sapphire is the central channel, which is the flow of water.

original: sku gsung thugs nye bar bsdu bas na 'di nyid sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can no //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs nye bar bsdu bas na 'di nyid sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can no //
translated: Since it is the gathering of body, speech, and mind, it is having the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: rdo rje ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: rdo rje ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te /
translated: Vajra is the gnosis of the dharmadhātu,

original: de'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir phyag na rdo rje bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir phyag na rdo rje bsnams pa'o //
translated: and since it has the form of that, it is holding a vajra in the hand.

original: 'od zer chen po'i tshogs spro ba'i phyir rab 'bar ro //
analyzed: 'od zer chen po'i tshogs spro ba'i phyir rab 'bar ro //
translated: It is blazing because it emits a mass of great light rays.

original: rnam par gtsigs pas 'jigs pa ni shu kra dang khrag dag /'jigs lta ni za bar byed pa'o //🔽shel dang zla ba'i 'od 'dra ba //
analyzed: rnam par gtsigs pas 'jigs pa ni shu kra dang khrag dag /'jigs lta ni za bar byed pa'o // shel dang zla ba'i 'od 'dra ba //
translated: Frightening with bared fangs is semen and blood. Looking frightening is devouring.

original: zhes pa ni kha dog dkar po rtsa g-yon pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kha dog dkar po rtsa g-yon pa'o //
translated: Having the color of crystal and moonlight is the white-colored left channel.

original: byang chub kyi sems rgyu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rgyu ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is the flow of bodhicitta,

original: thor tshugs cod pan ni byang chub kyi sems rgyu ba'i rtsa'i 'khor los brgyan pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thor tshugs cod pan ni byang chub kyi sems rgyu ba'i rtsa'i 'khor los brgyan pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The topknot crest is the meditation on the chakra of the nāḍīs through which bodhicitta moves.

original: 'khor lo ni byang chub kyi sems kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: 'khor lo ni byang chub kyi sems kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The chakra is the maṇḍala of bodhicitta.

original: de nyid phyag ste khong stong na gang la yod pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid phyag ste khong stong na gang la yod pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: That is the hand; if it is hollow, then it is just so.

original: de bzhin du sna tshogs rgyan ni spro ba'i thig le rnams kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sna tshogs rgyan ni spro ba'i thig le rnams kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the various ornaments are the ornaments of the emanating bindus.

original: 'dzam bu'i chu gser ni bshang ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i chu gser ni bshang ba'o //
translated: Jambū river gold is feces.🔽That which is like that is filled with that.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni des gang ba shar phyogs kyi rtsa lha sbyin ma'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni des gang ba shar phyogs kyi rtsa lha sbyin ma'o //
translated: The eastern nāḍī is Devī.

original: sangs rgyas sprin ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rdzas rnams kyis kun du 'khrigs pa ni khyab pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sprin ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rdzas rnams kyis kun du 'khrigs pa ni khyab pa'o //
translated: The cloud of buddhas is the pervasiveness of the pervading substance of Vairocana.

original: rtse mo dgu ni sgo dgu ste /
analyzed: rtse mo dgu ni sgo dgu ste /
translated: The nine peaks are the nine doors.

original: de rnams kyi rdo rje ni bshang sgo /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rdo rje ni bshang sgo /
translated: The vajra of those is the anus.

original: phyag na khong stong la de nyid la gnas pa bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: phyag na khong stong la de nyid la gnas pa bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The hollow hand is just that.

original: bha ga'i dbus na gnas pa'i bshang ba'i rtsas bshang sgo khyab par byed pa zhes @61b ston to //
analyzed: bha ga'i dbus na gnas pa'i bshang ba'i rtsas bshang sgo khyab par byed pa zhes @61b ston to //
translated: The channel of feces located in the middle of the bhaga pervades the anus.

original: ma ra ka ta'i 'od ni don yod grub pa ste /
analyzed: ma ra ka ta'i 'od ni don yod grub pa ste /
translated: The light of emerald is Amoghasiddhi.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni de'i rang bzhin sha'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni de'i rang bzhin sha'o //
translated: That which is similar to that is the nature of blood.

original: de rgyu gang zhig rdo rje 'bar ba ni nub kyi rtsa ste /
analyzed: de rgyu gang zhig rdo rje 'bar ba ni nub kyi rtsa ste /
translated: What is its cause? The blazing vajra is the western channel.

original: de nyid phyag ni nang gi khong stong la /
analyzed: de nyid phyag ni nang gi khong stong la /
translated: That itself is the hand, which is the inner cavity.

original: rin chen ni sha'o //
analyzed: rin chen ni sha'o //
translated: The jewel is the blood.

original: 'bar ba'i sprin ni lus kyi sha'i dum bu rnams kyis kun du khyab par bsgom pa'o ;
analyzed: 'bar ba'i sprin ni lus kyi sha'i dum bu rnams kyis kun du khyab par bsgom pa'o ;
translated: The blazing cloud is the meditation on the pervasiveness of the body with pieces of flesh.

original: / de bzhin du padma r'a ga'i mdog ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: / de bzhin du padma r'a ga'i mdog ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: Similarly, the color of padmaraga is Amitabha.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni khrag go //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni khrag go //
translated: That which is similar to that is blood.

original: de'i rnam pa ni rtsa g-yas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa ni rtsa g-yas pa'o //
translated: Its aspect is the right channel.

original: snga ma bzhin du thor tshugs cod can gyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thor tshugs cod can gyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: As before, it is adorned with a topknot and earrings.

original: de bzhin du padma dang 'dra ba khrag phyag na khong stong gi nang na gang la yod pa de ni phyag na padmo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du padma dang 'dra ba khrag phyag na khong stong gi nang na gang la yod pa de ni phyag na padmo'o //
translated: Similarly, that which is like a lotus is blood. In the hand, in the inner cavity, is the one who has it. He is Padmankara.

original: rab 'bar ni kha dog dmar po'i 'od zer spro ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'bar ni kha dog dmar po'i 'od zer spro ba'o //
translated: The blazing one is the emission of the light rays of the color red.

original: 'dod chags rdo rje can zhes pa ni de nyid shes rab kyi ngo bo bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags rdo rje can zhes pa ni de nyid shes rab kyi ngo bo bsam par bya'o //
translated: The one with the vajra of passion should be contemplated as the nature of wisdom.

original: nye bar bsdu ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The summary should be explained.

original: 'od zer sna lnga'i 'od 'dra'i sku //
analyzed: 'od zer sna lnga'i 'od 'dra'i sku //
translated: The body of the light of the five light rays

original: zhes pa ni rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtsa lnga'o //
translated: is the five nāḍīs.

original: gdon mi za ba rdo rje can gyi sku ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba rdo rje can gyi sku ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The body of the one with the vajra of certainty is the essence of Mahāvajradhara, the relative bodhicitta.

original: de nyid kyis gang ba de rnams bsgom par bya'o //🔽zhi ba phyag na ral gri bsnams //
analyzed: de nyid kyis gang ba de rnams bsgom par bya'o // zhi ba phyag na ral gri bsnams //
translated: One should meditate on those that are filled with that.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The peaceful one holds a sword in his hand.

original: ral gri ni rno ba'i ngo bo don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ral gri ni rno ba'i ngo bo don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The sword is the nature of sharpness, holding the ultimate bodhicitta.

original: rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peaceful because all conceptuality is gathered.🔽The maṇḍala of buddhas is the nature of that in the center of the cakra of nāḍīs.

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor ni rtsa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su de nyid rang gi ngo bo dang / rang bde ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor ni rtsa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su de nyid rang gi ngo bo dang / rang bde ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on one’s own bliss.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then, etc. as before.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni bde ba chen po de'i ngo bo ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni bde ba chen po de'i ngo bo ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: The realm of phenomena is the nature of great bliss.

original: sku gsung thugs ni kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems byin gyis rlob pa ni bde ba chen po dbang du byed pa'i sngags brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs ni kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems byin gyis rlob pa ni bde ba chen po dbang du byed pa'i sngags brjod par bya ste /
translated: The consecration of body, speech, and mind is the expression of the mantra that brings great bliss under control.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Om, etc.

original: aom ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: aom ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: Om is Great Vajradhara.🔽The nature of the realm of phenomena is great bliss.

original: dharm'a dh'a tu ni de nyid bde ba chen po sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes pa ni de'i bdag nyid bdag yin no zhes de'i dus su nga rgyal gzung bar bya ste 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dharm'a dh'a tu ni de nyid bde ba chen po sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes pa ni de'i bdag nyid bdag yin no zhes de'i dus su nga rgyal gzung bar bya ste 'bras bu'o //
translated: I am of the nature of that.

original: da ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to cultivate the subtle yoga,

original: rin chen chen po kha dog lnga //
analyzed: rin chen chen po kha dog lnga //
translated: the great jewel with five colors,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: etc. is stated.

original: re zhig 'dir ni sngags kyi rim pas bsgom pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig 'dir ni sngags kyi rim pas bsgom pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Here, the cultivation by means of the mantra process should be taught.

original: 'dir ni sna rnam pa lnga yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni sna rnam pa lnga yin te /
translated: Here, the nose is fivefold:

original: gdong gi sna dang / lkog @62a * //
analyzed: gdong gi sna dang / lkog @62a * //
translated: the nose of the face,

original: ma'i sna dang / snying ga'i sna dang / lte ba'i sna dang / gsang ba'i sna'o //
analyzed: ma'i sna dang / snying ga'i sna dang / lte ba'i sna dang / gsang ba'i sna'o //
translated: the nose of the throat, the nose of the heart, the nose of the navel, and the nose of the secret place.

original: de la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas gdong gi sna ru bsgom par bya'o //🔽snang ba mtha' yas kyi rnal 'byor pas lkog ma'i sna la'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas gdong gi sna ru bsgom par bya'o // snang ba mtha' yas kyi rnal 'byor pas lkog ma'i sna la'o //
translated: Among them, the yogin of Vairocana should meditate on the nose of the face.🔽The yogin of Amitābha should meditate on the nose of the throat.

original: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas snying ga'i sna la'o //🔽rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rnal 'byor pas lte ba'i sna la'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas snying ga'i sna la'o // rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rnal 'byor pas lte ba'i sna la'o //
translated: The yogin of Akṣobhya should meditate on the nose of the heart.🔽The yogin of Ratnasaṃbhava should meditate on the nose of the navel.

original: don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pas gsang ba'i sna la bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pas gsang ba'i sna la bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The yogin of Amoghasiddhi should meditate on the nose of the secret place.

original: dbang gi dbye bas bstan to //
analyzed: dbang gi dbye bas bstan to //
translated: This is taught by the division of empowerment.

original: kha dog lnga ni yi ge lnga ste /
analyzed: kha dog lnga ni yi ge lnga ste /
translated: The five colors are the five syllables:

original: aom a'a:h'um tr'am kham zhes so //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um tr'am kham zhes so //
translated: om āḥ hūṃ traṃ khaṃ.

original: de rnams rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhi ba dang / dbang dang mngon spyod dang / rgyas pa dang dgug par byed pa'i phyir rin chen chen po'o //
analyzed: de rnams rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhi ba dang / dbang dang mngon spyod dang / rgyas pa dang dgug par byed pa'i phyir rin chen chen po'o //
translated: They are great jewels because they respectively accomplish pacification, power, destruction, increase, and summoning.

original: yungs kar gyi 'bras bu bzhin du rags pa'i tshad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yungs kar gyi 'bras bu bzhin du rags pa'i tshad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It has the measure of a coarse mustard seed.

original: sna'i rtse mo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sna'i rtse mo zhes pa ni /
translated: The tip of the nose is

original: sngar bshad pa'i sna'i rtse mo rnams su'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i sna'i rtse mo rnams su'o //
translated: the tips of the nose explained above.

original: nan tan du zhes pa ni sems rtse gcig pas so//
analyzed: nan tan du zhes pa ni sems rtse gcig pas so//
translated: With effort means with a one-pointed mind.

original: rnal 'byor pa yis rtag tu bsgom //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis rtag tu bsgom //
translated: The yogi/nī always meditates

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: means

original: sngags kyi de kho na nyid shes pas so //
analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na nyid shes pas so //
translated: with knowledge of the reality of mantra.

original: rin chen brtan par zhes pa ni bdag nyid dang khams gsum pa'i thig le tsam du shes nas /
analyzed: rin chen brtan par zhes pa ni bdag nyid dang khams gsum pa'i thig le tsam du shes nas /
translated: Firmly in the jewel means that, knowing the drops of oneself and the three worlds,

original: spro ba ni sngags thams cad skyed par byed pa'i yi ge'i phyi mo de las spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: spro ba ni sngags thams cad skyed par byed pa'i yi ge'i phyi mo de las spro bar bya'o //
translated: one should emanate. Emanation is the emission of all mantras from the letters that generate them.

original: brtan par ma gyur pa ni sngar bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du ma gyur na spro bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: brtan par ma gyur pa ni sngar bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du ma gyur na spro bar mi bya ste /
translated: If one has not become firm, that is, if one has not actualized the samādhi explained above, one should not emanate.

original: bsgom pa de nyid de srid du bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa de nyid de srid du bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should meditate on that meditation for as long as

original: ji srid du brtan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du brtan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: one becomes firm.

original: spro ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: spro ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Emanation will be explained.

original: mchog rab ces bya ba la sogs pa mchog rab sprin rnams ni mchog tu gyur pa'i yi ge phyi mo'i sde tshan rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mchog rab ces bya ba la sogs pa mchog rab sprin rnams ni mchog tu gyur pa'i yi ge phyi mo'i sde tshan rnams kyis so //
translated: The “supreme clouds” and so forth are the supreme collections of the later letters.

original: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ste /
translated: The “buddhas” are Vairochana and so forth.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni de dang mtshungs pa'i 'od rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni de dang mtshungs pa'i 'od rnams kyis so //
translated: “Like them” means like them, with their corresponding lights.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: 'khor lo rdo rje'i sprin chen dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'khor lo rdo rje'i sprin chen dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the “great clouds of wheels and vajras” and so forth.

original: 'khor lo la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo 'od zer ram /
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo 'od zer ram /
translated: The wheels and so forth are the essence of the Tathagatas, which are the light rays,

original: de'i phyag mtshan 'chang ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyag mtshan 'chang ba rnams kyis so //
translated: or the emblems of their hands.

original: mos pa'i dbang gis byang chub sems dpa'i sprin chen gyi ngo bo dang nye bar mtshon pa tsam gyis lha mo dang / khro bo rnams kyis kyang las kyi dbang gis spro ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rnal 'byor pas spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa'i dbang gis byang chub sems dpa'i sprin chen gyi ngo bo dang nye bar mtshon pa tsam gyis lha mo dang / khro bo rnams kyis kyang las kyi dbang gis spro ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rnal 'byor pas spro bar bya ste /
translated: By the power of devotion, the yogin who is of the nature of the great cloud of Bodhisattvas, and is merely indicated by the emblems, should emanate the goddesses and wrathful ones by the power of karma.

original: bskyed pa'i @62b rim ba'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i @62b rim ba'o //
translated: This is the creation stage.

original: 'dir ni man ngag 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni man ngag 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the instruction:

original: re zhig 'dir ni a'a li dang k'a l'i ngo bo yi ge phyi mo ni /
analyzed: re zhig 'dir ni a'a li dang k'a l'i ngo bo yi ge phyi mo ni /
translated: Here, for the time being, the essence of the vowels and consonants is the first letters.🔽

original: sngags thams cad la bskyed pa'i rgyu yin te /🔽de yang dbyangs dang gsal bar bya ba'i bdag nyid kyis /
analyzed: sngags thams cad la bskyed pa'i rgyu yin te / de yang dbyangs dang gsal bar bya ba'i bdag nyid kyis /
translated: Here, for the time being, the essence of the vowels and consonants is the cause of the generation of all mantras.🔽Moreover, they are of two kinds, the nature of wisdom and means,

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: by means of the nature of vowels and consonants.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: They are also the essence of the Tathagata.

original: dper na aa dang a'a ni rnam par snang mdzad dang / lha mo spyan no //
analyzed: dper na aa dang a'a ni rnam par snang mdzad dang / lha mo spyan no //
translated: For example, a and ā are Vairocana and the goddess Locanā.

original: ai dang a'i ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang m'a ma k'i'o //🔽au dang a'u ni snang ba mtha' yas dang gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: ai dang a'i ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang m'a ma k'i'o // au dang a'u ni snang ba mtha' yas dang gos dkar mo'o //
translated: i and ī are Ratnasaṃbhava and Māmakī.🔽u and ū are Amitābha and Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: ri dang r'i ni mi bskyod pa dang // m'a ma k'i chen mo'o //
analyzed: ri dang r'i ni mi bskyod pa dang // m'a ma k'i chen mo'o //
translated: ṛ and ṝ are Akṣobhya and Mahāmāyūrī.

original: li dang l'i ni don yod grub pa dang / lha mo sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: li dang l'i ni don yod grub pa dang / lha mo sgrol ma'o //
translated: l and ḷ are Amoghasiddhi and the goddess Tārā.

original: ae aee / ao aoo zhes bya ba gshin rje mthar byed dang / shes rab mthar byed dang / padma mthar byed dang / bgegs mthar byed rnams so //
analyzed: ae aee / ao aoo zhes bya ba gshin rje mthar byed dang / shes rab mthar byed dang / padma mthar byed dang / bgegs mthar byed rnams so //
translated: Ai Ai, Au Au are Yamantaka, Prajna-Yamari, Padma-Yamari, and Vighna-Yamari.

original: de bzhin du kha ga gha nga zhes pa ni ka ni spyan no //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha ga gha nga zhes pa ni ka ni spyan no //
translated: Likewise, Kha Gha Gha Nga are: Ka is Locana,🔽 Kha is Mamaki,

original: kha ni m'a ma k'i'o //🔽ga ni gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: kha ni m'a ma k'i'o // ga ni gos dkar mo'o //
translated: Ga is Pandara,🔽 Gha is Tara,

original: gha ni lha mo sgrol ma'o //🔽nga ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: gha ni lha mo sgrol ma'o // nga ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: and Nga is Vairocana.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the mandala of Vairocana.🔽 Likewise, Ca Cha Ja Jha Nya are:

original: de bzhin du tsa tsha dza dzha nya zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du tsa tsha dza dzha nya zhes bya ba /
translated: Ca and so forth are the goddesses Locana and so forth,🔽 Nya is Ratnasambhava,🔽 and this is the mandala of Ratnasambhava.🔽 Ta Tha Da Dha Na are:

original: tsa la sogs pa ni lha mo spyan la sogs pa'o //🔽nya ni rin chen 'byung ldan te /
analyzed: tsa la sogs pa ni lha mo spyan la sogs pa'o // nya ni rin chen 'byung ldan te /
translated: Ta and so forth are the goddesses Locana and so forth,🔽 Na is Amitabha,

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: and this is the mandala of Amitabha.

original: ta tha da dha na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ta tha da dha na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Likewise, Ta Tha Da Dha Na are:🔽

original: ta la sogs pa ni lha mo spyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ta la sogs pa ni lha mo spyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: Ta and so forth are the goddesses Locana and so forth,

original: na ni snang ba mtha' yas te /
analyzed: na ni snang ba mtha' yas te /
translated: Na is Amoghasiddhi,🔽 and this is the mandala of Amoghasiddhi.🔽 Likewise, Pa Pha Ba Bha Ma are:🔽 Pa and so forth are the goddesses Locana and so forth,🔽 Ma is Akshobhya,

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: and this is the mandala of Akshobhya.🔽 Likewise, Ya Ra La Va are:🔽

original: de bzhin du ta tha da dha na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ta tha da dha na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Ya and so forth are the goddesses Locana and so forth,🔽 Sha is Vajra-Yamari,🔽 and this is the mandala of Vajra-Yamari.🔽 Likewise, Sha Sha Sa Sa are:🔽 🔽 Sha and so forth are the goddesses Locana and so forth,🔽 Ksha is Vajra-Akobhya,🔽 and this is the mandala of Vajra-Akobhya.🔽 Likewise, Ha Ksha are:🔽 🔽 Ha is Vajra-Vairocana,🔽 and this is the mandala of Vajra-Vairocana.🔽 Likewise, Ksha is Vajra-Akobhya,🔽 and this is the mandala of Vajra-Akobhya.🔽 Likewise, Sva is Vajra-Ratnasambhava,🔽 and this is the mandala of Vajra-Rat

original: ta la sogs pa ni lha mo spyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ta la sogs pa ni lha mo spyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ta and so forth are the goddesses Locanā and so forth.

original: na ni mi bskyod ba ste ;
analyzed: na ni mi bskyod ba ste ;
translated: The na is Akṣobhya,

original: mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //🔽de bzhin du pa pha bha ba ma zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor ro // de bzhin du pa pha bha ba ma zhes bya ba la /
translated: the maṇḍala of Akṣobhya.

original: pa la sogs pa ni lha mo spyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa ni lha mo spyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the pa pha bha ma are the goddesses Locanā and so forth.

original: ma ni don yod grub pa ste /
analyzed: ma ni don yod grub pa ste /
translated: The ma is Amoghasiddhi,

original: don yod grub pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: the maṇḍala of Amoghasiddhi.

original: yar la wa sha sha sa ha aam aa:zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i rgyal po bcu yin te /
analyzed: yar la wa sha sha sa ha aam aa:zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i rgyal po bcu yin te /
translated: The ya ra la va and so forth are the ten kings of wrathful ones.

original: de ltar na yi ge phyi mo ma lus pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na yi ge phyi mo ma lus pa ni /
translated: Thus, all the letters

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: are the essence of the tathāgatas.

original: de la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas ni /
translated: Among them, a practitioner of Vairocana

original: gdong gi sna la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dbus kyi cha ru 'o ma'i rgya mtsho bzhin dkar ba /
analyzed: gdong gi sna la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dbus kyi cha ru 'o ma'i rgya mtsho bzhin dkar ba /
translated: should visualize in the middle of the face, on top of a moon maṇḍala, a white a like a milk ocean,

original: spro ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor los khams @63a * //
analyzed: spro ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor los khams @63a * //
translated: with a surrounding halo of light rays radiating🔽from the a and pervading the three realms.

original: gsum pa gsal bar byed pa nang du me long gi pra dbab pa bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa /
analyzed: gsum pa gsal bar byed pa nang du me long gi pra dbab pa bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa /
translated: Third, the inner descent of the mirror-like gnosis is like the descent of the mirror.

original: sgra mtha' ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo sgra dang / thig le dag gis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo //
analyzed: sgra mtha' ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo sgra dang / thig le dag gis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo //
translated: The end of sound is the essence of the dharmakāya, and the bindu is the essence of the saṃbhogakāya.🔽The remaining syllables are the nature of the nirmāṇakāya.

original: lhag ma'i yi ges ni sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid 'jug pa'i ngo bos ni sku'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: lhag ma'i yi ges ni sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid 'jug pa'i ngo bos ni sku'i rang bzhin /
translated: The nature of the body is the nature of the entry.

original: nad la sogs pa zhi par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nad la sogs pa zhi par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it pacifies illness and so on,

original: zhi ba'i las byed pa /
analyzed: zhi ba'i las byed pa /
translated: it performs the activity of pacifying.

original: rig byed kyi dang po rnam par dgod cing de nyid kyi phyi rol du g-yon skor bas /
analyzed: rig byed kyi dang po rnam par dgod cing de nyid kyi phyi rol du g-yon skor bas /
translated: The first of the Vedas is arranged, and to the right of that,🔽in a clockwise circle,

original: phreng ba gcig la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du /
analyzed: phreng ba gcig la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du /
translated: on a moon maṇḍala in a single garland,

original: aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug kha dog dkar po dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug kha dog dkar po dgod par bya'o //
translated: the sixteen vowels, such as a, and so on, are arranged in white color.🔽Outside of the garland of vowels, in a clockwise circle,

original: dbyangs kyi phreng ba'i phyi rol du yang phreng ba gnyis pa la g-yas skor bas /
analyzed: dbyangs kyi phreng ba'i phyi rol du yang phreng ba gnyis pa la g-yas skor bas /
translated: in a second garland,

original: yi ge ka la sogs pa ha'i mtha' can kha dog snga ma dang 'dra ba dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge ka la sogs pa ha'i mtha' can kha dog snga ma dang 'dra ba dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should arrange the letters beginning with ka and ending with ha, the same color as before.

original: de'i rjes la de nyid las 'od zer gyi 'khor lo spros te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la de nyid las 'od zer gyi 'khor lo spros te /
translated: After that, one should emanate a circle of light rays from that.

original: 'gro ba drug gi sems can rnams rnam par snang mdzad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing la /
analyzed: 'gro ba drug gi sems can rnams rnam par snang mdzad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing la /
translated: The sentient beings of the six realms are established in the buddhafield of Vairocana.

original: sa bcu thob par gnas par byas shing /
analyzed: sa bcu thob par gnas par byas shing /
translated: They are caused to attain the ten stages.

original: slar yang bsdus te /
analyzed: slar yang bsdus te /
translated: Again, they are gathered.

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'adya nutpanna tv'a ta aom a'a:h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod cing /
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'adya nutpanna tv'a ta aom a'a:h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod cing /
translated: One should recite the mantra: oṃ akāro mukhaṃ sarvadharmāṇāṃ tadyathā oṃ āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: snga ma bzhin du gsal bya'i yi ge de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang mthun pas /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du gsal bya'i yi ge de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang mthun pas /
translated: As before, the letters to be clarified are in accord with the Tathāgata family.

original: dbyangs kyi sde la zhugs nas ro gcig par bya'o //🔽de'i rjes la khro bo'i yi ge bzhi ni rigs kyi dbye ba la brten te /
analyzed: dbyangs kyi sde la zhugs nas ro gcig par bya'o // de'i rjes la khro bo'i yi ge bzhi ni rigs kyi dbye ba la brten te /
translated: Having entered the class of vowels, they are made into one taste.

original: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge bzhi po la thim par bya'o //
analyzed: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge bzhi po la thim par bya'o //
translated: After that, the four wrathful letters are dissolved into the four letters beginning with a, based on the division of the families.

original: de nas shes rab kyi ngo bo yi ge ring ba lnga po ni /
analyzed: de nas shes rab kyi ngo bo yi ge ring ba lnga po ni /
translated: Then, the five long letters, the essence of wisdom,

original: yi ge thung ba rnams la thim par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge thung ba rnams la thim par bya'o //
translated: The short vowels dissolve into the long vowels.🔽The four short vowels dissolve into the letter A.🔽That dissolves into the letter Om.

original: yi ge thung ba bzhi po ni yi ge aa la dang / de yang yi ge aom la dang / yi ge aom gyi cha gsum ni thig le la thim par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge thung ba bzhi po ni yi ge aa la dang / de yang yi ge aom la dang / yi ge aom gyi cha gsum ni thig le la thim par bya'o //
translated: The three parts of the letter Om dissolve into the bindu.🔽The bindu, the size of a mustard seed, is the essence of all the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.🔽It is clear, unclear, and the nature of all the tathagatas, complete with all the atoms.

original: thig le tsam yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad phung po dang / khams dang skye mched ma lus pa rjes su zhugs pas gsal ba dang ; mi gsal ba'i ngo bo dang / tho rangs kyi skar ma dang 'dra ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdul phra rab yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo zhes te /
analyzed: thig le tsam yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad phung po dang / khams dang skye mched ma lus pa rjes su zhugs pas gsal ba dang ; mi gsal ba'i ngo bo dang / tho rangs kyi skar ma dang 'dra ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdul phra rab yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo zhes te /
translated: It is like a star at dawn.

original: 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang la gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should abide in the state of luminosity.

original: 'di ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi dus dang / shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa'i chos @63b nyid dang chos kyi dbyings yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi dus dang / shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa'i chos @63b nyid dang chos kyi dbyings yin no //
translated: This is the inner time, the perfection of wisdom, the dharmadhatu, and the nature of phenomena.

original: de'i rjes la snga ma'i 'du byed kyi dbang gis snying rje chen pos dbang du byas pa'i rnal 'byor pas rmi lam las sad pa bzhin du thig le brtan par byas te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la snga ma'i 'du byed kyi dbang gis snying rje chen pos dbang du byas pa'i rnal 'byor pas rmi lam las sad pa bzhin du thig le brtan par byas te /
translated: Then, by the power of the previous formative forces, the yogin who is governed by great compassion stabilizes the drop like one who has awakened from a dream.

original: rim pa de nyid kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la thig le las spro ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor los a'a li dang k'a li phreng ba gnyis su spro bar bya'o //🔽de nas yang phyi rol du nam mkha' la sogs par aa dang aa las zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa 'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan 'chang ba sku mdog dkar por spros te /
analyzed: rim pa de nyid kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la thig le las spro ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor los a'a li dang k'a li phreng ba gnyis su spro bar bya'o // de nas yang phyi rol du nam mkha' la sogs par aa dang aa las zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa 'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan 'chang ba sku mdog dkar por spros te /
translated: By that very process, he should emanate the two garlands of āli and kāli with the wheel of light rays from the drop on the moon maṇḍala.

original: bsgrub bya rnams kyi grong khyer la sogs pa la zhi ba'i las bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya rnams kyi grong khyer la sogs pa la zhi ba'i las bya'o //
translated: Then, again externally, he should emanate from ā and ā in the sky and so forth a white three-faced and six-armed [deity] holding a wheel and so forth, and perform the rite of pacifying in the city and so forth of those to be tamed.

original: ae la sogs pa yang de bzhin du spros te /
analyzed: ae la sogs pa yang de bzhin du spros te /
translated: Also, emanate e and so forth in the same way,

original: rgyas pa dang mngon spyod dang dbang dang dgug pa rnams bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa dang mngon spyod dang dbang dang dgug pa rnams bya'o //
translated: and perform the rites of enriching, destroying, controlling, and summoning.

original: gsal bya'i sde tshan lnga yang spros te /
analyzed: gsal bya'i sde tshan lnga yang spros te /
translated: Also, emanate the five groups of the clear [light].

original: snga ma bzhin du phyag dang zhal dang phyag mtshan dang sku mdog tu ldan pa de rnams kyis zhi ba la sogs pa bya ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du phyag dang zhal dang phyag mtshan dang sku mdog tu ldan pa de rnams kyis zhi ba la sogs pa bya ste /
translated: Having the same number of hands, faces, implements, and colors as before, one should perform the pacifying, etc.

original: 'gro ba kun ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing la sogs par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing la sogs par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: , and establish all beings in the buddha-fields, etc.

original: de nas kyang khro bo'i yi ge rnams de'i ngo bor spros te 'jig rten skyong ba brgyad dang sa 'og tu klu mo dang / nam mkhar lha'i bu mo dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas kyang khro bo'i yi ge rnams de'i ngo bor spros te 'jig rten skyong ba brgyad dang sa 'og tu klu mo dang / nam mkhar lha'i bu mo dgug par bya'o //
translated: Then, again, one should summon the eight Lokapālas to the underworld with the wrathful syllables, and the celestial maidens to the sky with their essence.

original: de ltar byas na rang gi sems dbang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na rang gi sems dbang du gyur pa'o //
translated: If one does it this way, one's mind becomes subject to one's will.

original: ji skad du rdul phra rab dang shin tu che ba nyid kyi mthar sems dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du rdul phra rab dang shin tu che ba nyid kyi mthar sems dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: As it is said, The mind becomes subject to one's will at the end of the subtle and very gross.

original: yang dag pa so sor rtogs pas rang gi don dang / zhi ba la sogs pa grub pas gzhan gyi rnal 'byor pa las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa so sor rtogs pas rang gi don dang / zhi ba la sogs pa grub pas gzhan gyi rnal 'byor pa las 'byung ba ste /
translated: By correct discernment, one's own purpose is accomplished, and by pacifying, etc., the purpose of others.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor sgom pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor sgom pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the stage of cultivating the subtle yoga by a Vairocana yogin.

original: de ltar yang snang ba mtha' yas la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas lkog ma la sogs pa'i sna rnams su zla ba dang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor rnams la ngag gi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams las yi ge phyi mo spros te 'gro ba'i don
analyzed: de ltar yang snang ba mtha' yas la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas lkog ma la sogs pa'i sna rnams su zla ba dang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor rnams la ngag gi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams las yi ge phyi mo spros te 'gro ba'i don
translated: Thus, the yogī of Amitābha and so on should emanate the vowels from the seed syllables of Vāgīśvara and so on on the moon and sun maṇḍalas in the nose at the throat, and so on, and perform the benefit of migrating beings.🔽Again, having gathered them by the division of the consonants and vowels, one should rely on the meditation of the mere bindu.

original: byas la slar yang gsal bya dang dbyangs kyi dbye bas bsdus te thig le tsam gyi bsgom pa brten par bya zhing de bzhin du yi ge'i lha rnams kyi dbang po la sogs pa byas te /
analyzed: byas la slar yang gsal bya dang dbyangs kyi dbye bas bsdus te thig le tsam gyi bsgom pa brten par bya zhing de bzhin du yi ge'i lha rnams kyi dbang po la sogs pa byas te /
translated: In the same way, one should perform the rite of the deities of the letters and so on.

original: ci bde ba'i spyod pas spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: ci bde ba'i spyod pas spyad par bya ste /
translated: One should practice with any conduct that is comfortable.

original: snang ba mtha' yas la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi bsgom pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi bsgom pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: This is the explanation of the stage of meditation of the subtle yoga of the yogī of Amitābha and so on.

original: sngags kyi rim pa bshad nas phyag rgya'i rim pas phra mo'i @64a * //
analyzed: sngags kyi rim pa bshad nas phyag rgya'i rim pas phra mo'i @64a * //
translated: Having explained the stage of mantra, now the stage of the mudra will be explained.

original: rnal 'byor bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bshad par bya ste /
translated: The stage of the mudra is explained in the second chapter of the Vajraśekhara Tantra:

original: rin chen chen po kha dog lnga //
analyzed: rin chen chen po kha dog lnga //
translated: The five colors of the great jewel

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽phung po lnga nye bar bsdu ba'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / phung po lnga nye bar bsdu ba'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: In this and other such passages.🔽The great jewel is the great element, which is the nature of the five aggregates, or the nature of the five pristine awarenesses.

original: ye shes lnga'i ngo bo khams drug gtso bor gyur pas chen po yang yin la 'gro bskyed par byed pas rin chen yang yin te rin chen chen po'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i ngo bo khams drug gtso bor gyur pas chen po yang yin la 'gro bskyed par byed pas rin chen yang yin te rin chen chen po'o //
translated: It is great because it is the principal of the six elements, and it is a jewel because it generates the world.

original: yungs kar ni don dam pa ste phra mo //
analyzed: yungs kar ni don dam pa ste phra mo //
translated: Mustard seed is the ultimate, that is, subtle.

original: 'bru ni kun rdzob ste rags pa'o //
analyzed: 'bru ni kun rdzob ste rags pa'o //
translated: Grain is the relative, that is, coarse.

original: tshad tsam zhes pa ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: tshad tsam zhes pa ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The size of a grain is the nature of both.

original: yungs kar ni 'bru tshod tsam mo //
analyzed: yungs kar ni 'bru tshod tsam mo //
translated: Mustard seed is the size of a grain.

original: sna'i rtse mor zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i gdugs kyi rtse mor ro //
analyzed: sna'i rtse mor zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i gdugs kyi rtse mor ro //
translated: At the tip of the nose means at the tip of the nose of the desire realm.

original: nan tan du zhes pa ni rtsol ba'i rlung 'gags pas sngags dgod pas bsgom pa ni 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: nan tan du zhes pa ni rtsol ba'i rlung 'gags pas sngags dgod pas bsgom pa ni 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: With effort means that the meditation of the mantra recitation is to be held by the cessation of the vital wind of exertion.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni yan lag drug pa'i rnal 'byor la mkhas pas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni yan lag drug pa'i rnal 'byor la mkhas pas so //
translated: The yogi is skilled in the yoga of the six-branched yoga.

original: de nas brtan par ni smig rgyu la sogs pa'i mtshan ma lnga bltas nas spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas brtan par ni smig rgyu la sogs pa'i mtshan ma lnga bltas nas spro bar bya'o //
translated: Then, when stability is attained, one should emanate after seeing the five signs such as the mirage.

original: sngar bshad pa'i mtshan ma mthong na bstan par ma gyur pa ni spro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i mtshan ma mthong na bstan par ma gyur pa ni spro bar mi bya'o //
translated: If the signs explained above are not seen, one should not emanate without having been instructed.

original: srog dang rtsol ba'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du ma gyur na spro bar mi bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du ma gyur na spro bar mi bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: It is taught that one should not emanate if the samādhi of prāṇa and āyāma is not manifest.

original: rigs kyi dbye bas ni spro ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye bas ni spro ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: Emanation should be taught by way of the divisions of the family.

original: mchog rab sprin rnams spro bar bya //
analyzed: mchog rab sprin rnams spro bar bya //
translated: Emanate the supreme clouds.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs mchog go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs mchog go //
translated: This is the supreme family of the tathāgatas.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sangs rgyas 'bar ni 'od lnga ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'bar ni 'od lnga ste /
translated: The blazing buddhas are the five lights.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i 'od ni de'i kha dog 'dzin pa'o //🔽'khor lo rdo rje sprin chen dang // zhes pa ni phyag mtshan gyis nye bar mtshon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i 'od ni de'i kha dog 'dzin pa'o // 'khor lo rdo rje sprin chen dang // zhes pa ni phyag mtshan gyis nye bar mtshon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sam /
translated: The light that is like that is the color of that.🔽The great clouds of wheels and vajras

original: phyag mtshan rnams so //
analyzed: phyag mtshan rnams so //
translated: are the tathāgatas characterized by their hand implements or the hand implements themselves.

original: de ltar spro ba'i bdag nyid can ni spro ba'i rim pa shes pas spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar spro ba'i bdag nyid can ni spro ba'i rim pa shes pas spro bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, one who has the nature of emanation should emanate by knowing the process of emanation.

original: rnal 'byor de ni phyag rgya'i rim pas phra mo rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor de ni phyag rgya'i rim pas phra mo rnal 'byor ro //
translated: That yoga is the yoga of the subtle through the stage of the seal.

original: rlung gi rim pas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rlung gi rim pas bshad par bya ste /
translated: The explanation by the stages of the winds is as follows.

original: rin chen chen po kha dog lnga //
analyzed: rin chen chen po kha dog lnga //
translated: The great jewels are five-colored.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And so on.

original: srog la sogs pa'i rlung lnga'i rang bzhin te /🔽de nyid kyi phyir de rnams nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir mchog tu gyur pas na /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa'i rlung lnga'i rang bzhin te / de nyid kyi phyir de rnams nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir mchog tu gyur pas na /
translated: The nature of the five winds, life-force and so on, is the five-colored light.

original: rin chen chen po'o //
analyzed: rin chen chen po'o //
translated: For that very reason, they are the great jewels, because they are supreme, since they include all those.

original: yungs kar ni tshim par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yungs kar ni tshim par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'o //
translated: Mustard seed is the entering, because it satisfies.

original: 'bru ni ldang ba'i bdag nyid yin pas ldang ba'o //
analyzed: 'bru ni ldang ba'i bdag nyid yin pas ldang ba'o //
translated: Grain is the rising, because it has the nature of rising.

original: tshod tsam ni gnas pa tsam gyi phyir gnas pa'o //🔽de rnams nye bar bsdu ba ni yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshod tsam ste /
analyzed: tshod tsam ni gnas pa tsam gyi phyir gnas pa'o // de rnams nye bar bsdu ba ni yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshod tsam ste /
translated: The measure of a finger is the abiding, because it is just the abiding.

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa gsum po dang bral ba'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa gsum po dang bral ba'o zhes ston to //
translated: The inclusion of those is the measure of a mustard seed, which is free from the three, entering and so on.🔽Thus it is taught.

original: de lta bu'i 'od gsal ba gang du bsgom zhe @64b na ;
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'od gsal ba gang du bsgom zhe @64b na ;
translated: Where is that clear light meditated?

original: sna'i rtse mo nan tan du //
analyzed: sna'i rtse mo nan tan du //
translated: At the tip of the nose, with effort.

original: zhes pa ni sna ni stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po ste gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sna ni stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po ste gsum mo //
translated: The nose is the three, empty, very empty, and great empty.

original: de rnams kyi rtse mo ni thams cad stong pa nyid de de ru bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rtse mo ni thams cad stong pa nyid de de ru bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The peak of those is the emptiness of all, and that is where one should meditate.

original: nan tan du zhes pa ni rlung gi rtsol ba 'gags pas so //
analyzed: nan tan du zhes pa ni rlung gi rtsol ba 'gags pas so //
translated: “With effort” means by stopping the effort of the wind.

original: rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ni rdo rje'i bzlas pa la mkhas pas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ni rdo rje'i bzlas pa la mkhas pas so //
translated: “The yogī” is skilled in vajra repetition.

original: brtan pa ni 'od gsal ba brtan par shes nas spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: brtan pa ni 'od gsal ba brtan par shes nas spro bar bya ste /
translated: “Firmly” means that, knowing the stability of clear light, one should emanate.

original: de nas 'od zer rnams spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'od zer rnams spro bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should emanate the light rays.

original: brtan par ma gyur ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: brtan par ma gyur ces bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “If one is not stable” and so on is as before.

original: mchog rab sprin rnams spro bar bya //
analyzed: mchog rab sprin rnams spro bar bya //
translated: “One should emanate the supreme cloud.”

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bzhi'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bzhi'o //
translated: The “supreme” is the four maṇḍalas.

original: sangs rgyas ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Buddhas” are Akṣobhya and so on.

original: de rnams kyi 'bar ba ni sku mdog ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'bar ba ni sku mdog ste /
translated: Their “blazing” is the color of their bodies.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i 'od dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i 'od dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They have light that is similar to that.

original: 'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: The tathāgatas bless them with hand implements such as wheels.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva, etc.

original: byang chub ni gdong pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni gdong pa'o //
translated: The face is enlightenment.

original: de nyid kyi sems dpa' ni sna khung gnyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi sems dpa' ni sna khung gnyis so //
translated: The heroic being is the two nostrils.

original: de dag gi sprin chen po ni g-yon dang g-yas dang gnyis ka dang / dal bus rgyu ba'i dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis sna'i rtse mor thun phyed phyed kyi dus su gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sprin chen po ni g-yon dang g-yas dang gnyis ka dang / dal bus rgyu ba'i dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis sna'i rtse mor thun phyed phyed kyi dus su gnas par bya'o //
translated: The great cloud is the left, right, and both, and the slow-moving red light rays, etc. , which should be placed at the tip of the nose at the time of each half-period.

original: spro ba'i bdag nyid can zhes pa ni spro ba'i 'od zer gyi lha'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas te rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: spro ba'i bdag nyid can zhes pa ni spro ba'i 'od zer gyi lha'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas te rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The nature of emanation is the pride of the light-ray deities of emanation. This is the stage of vajra repetition.

original: ye shes kyi rim pas bshad par bya ste /🔽rin chen chen po kha dog lnga //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rim pas bshad par bya ste / rin chen chen po kha dog lnga // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The stage of wisdom will now be explained.

original: kha dog lnga ni dbang po lnga'i sgo las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog lnga ni dbang po lnga'i sgo las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The five colors are the mental consciousness that arises from the doors of the five sense organs.

original: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa chen po rnams kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa chen po rnams kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is the abode of the great views of self, etc. ,🔽 it is the great jewel.

original: rin chen chen po ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rin chen chen po ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The great jewel is the mental consciousness of all afflictions.

original: shin tu mtshon par dka' ba'i phyir bag chags phra mos rjes su 'brang bar yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshod tsam ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu mtshon par dka' ba'i phyir bag chags phra mos rjes su 'brang bar yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshod tsam ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Because it is extremely difficult to discern, the subtle habitual tendencies that follow it, the size of a mustard seed, are the ālaya consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa de dag gsum sna'i rtse mo zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo'i gnas su thig le dang yi ge med pa'i 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang la bsgom pa ni thim par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de dag gsum sna'i rtse mo zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo'i gnas su thig le dang yi ge med pa'i 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang la bsgom pa ni thim par bya'o //
translated: Those three consciousnesses at the tip of the nose are the stage of clear light without a drop or syllable in the location of the wheel of the dharmadhātu.

original: nan tan du zhes pa ni rang bzhin brgya drug cu'i bsdus nas so //🔽rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor la @65a * //
analyzed: nan tan du zhes pa ni rang bzhin brgya drug cu'i bsdus nas so // rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor la @65a * //
translated: “Practice” means the practice of the one hundred and sixty natures.

original: mkhas pas so //🔽rin chen brtan par gyur nas spro //
analyzed: mkhas pas so // rin chen brtan par gyur nas spro //
translated: “Yogin” is skilled in the yoga of mantra and mudra.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Having become stable as a jewel, emanate” and so on.

original: sems rnam par dag pa brtan par shes te /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa brtan par shes te /
translated: The mind is known to be stable and pure.

original: phyi nas cig car du bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku spro bar bya'o //🔽mchog rab sprin rnam spro bar bya ;
analyzed: phyi nas cig car du bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku spro bar bya'o // mchog rab sprin rnam spro bar bya ;
translated: Then, all at once, one should emanate the body of Great Vajradhara by the rite of self-consecration.

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pas spro ba brtan par bya ste /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pas spro ba brtan par bya ste /
translated: One should stabilize the emanation with the words, The supreme illusion, the emanation of clouds, the blazing Buddha, the wheel, the vajra, the great cloud, the lotus, the sword, the weapon, the great hero, the emanation of the Bodhisattva clouds.

original: mchog rab ni mig 'phrul can gyi sgyu ma'o //
analyzed: mchog rab ni mig 'phrul can gyi sgyu ma'o //
translated: The supreme illusion is the magic of the magician.

original: sprin rnams ni brag ca'o //
analyzed: sprin rnams ni brag ca'o //
translated: The clouds are the echo.

original: sangs rgyas 'bar ni smig rgyu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'bar ni smig rgyu'o //
translated: The blazing Buddha is the mirage.

original: 'khor lo ni me long gi gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: 'khor lo ni me long gi gzugs brnyan no //
